loans.name: Abduvali

texts.ru: Абдували житель города Куляб. Ему 24 года. Он женат. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Абдували имеет высшее экономическое образование. По профессии - не работает. На сегодняшний день он предоставляет услугу. У него имеется дилерский центр, где он пополняет балансы телефонов, продает мобильные телефоны, зарядные устройства и сим-карты. Этим видом деятельность он занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для покупки сим-карт, запасных частей мобильных телефонов и для приобретения новых моделей мобильных телефонов.
texts.en: Abduvali lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 24 years old and married.  His wife is a homemaker.  Abduvali has a higher education as an economist.  He does not work in that field.  Today, he provides a service.  He has a dealer center, where he refills mobile phone balances, sells mobile phones, chargers and SIM cards.  He has been involved in this business for five years.  Abduvali is requesting this loan for the purchase of SIM cards, spare parts for mobile phones and for the purchase of new mobile phones.

loans.use: to purchase SIM cards, spare parts for mobile parts and new mobile phones

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga de 54 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito Las Lomas que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Olga se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de repuestos de moto y otros productos similares, su negocio lo tiene en un local cerca de su casa, cuenta con regular clientela, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades y gastos diarios de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de repuestos para seguir comercializándolo y con lo que adquiera de dinero pagará su crédito y mejorara el nivel de vida de su familia. Olga es una mujer de alegre y con mucho trabajo a logrado sacar a su familia adelante y le está permitiendo tener un poco más de comodidades en su casa.
texts.en:
Olga is 54 years old and lives in a house with her family. They do not receive basic services. Olga resides in the rural section of the District of Las Lomas, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for its businesses involving agriculture and livestock breeding.

Olga has been selling motorcycle parts and other similar products for several years. Her business is located in a shop near her home. She has a regular customer base and the income she generates is used to cover her needs and the daily household expenses.

Olga is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN in order to buy a large quantity of spare parts so that she can continue selling them. The money she earns will be used to repay the loan and improve her family’s standard of living. Olga is a cheerful woman who works hard so that she can move her family forward and provide them a few more household comforts.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of parts to sell in her business.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bokk Jom est créé depuis le 28 juin 2010, il est composé de quinze femmes qui sont voisines et s'entendent bien; elles s'activent dans le commerce.


La responsable Anta est âgée de 44 ans,elle est mariée mère de six enfants; elle mène une activité de vente de légumes depuis environ 15 ans, elle a une bonne expérience. Elle est debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo  habillée en boubou saumon avec un châle blanc sur l'épaule et a levé la main gauche.


Elle s'approvisionne dans les villages maraîchers et revend au marché central de la ville.

Son prêt lui servira à renforcer son activité afin de se faire plus de revenus.

Elle aide son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes avec ses bénéfices obtenus; mais investi aussi dans les tontines une façon d'épargner pour préparer son remboursement.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bokk Jom was formed on June 28, 2010. It is made up of 15 women who are neighbors and get along well; they are active in commerce. 

The leader of the group, Anta, is 44 years old. She is a married mother of six children. She has been in the business of selling vegetables for about 15 years. She has good experience. She is standing all the way to the right of the photo dressed in a salmon-colored dress with a white shawl on her shoulder and her left hand raised. 

She stocks up in the village markets and resells in the central market of the city. 

The loan will serve to strengthen her business in order to make more income. 

She helps her husband with the daily expenses with the income received but also invested in tontines as a way to save to prepare for her repayment.

loans.use: To buy vegetables intended for sale

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, el señor Juan Ramón   se dedica   a laborar como fontanero de sistema de agua potable  en una institución del estado, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace diez y siete años. Es soltero y con cinco personas a su cargo, es una persona con buenos valores morales. 

El señor Juan Ramón ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda en la compra de materiales de construcción tale como bloque, cemento, arena, y pago de mano de obra, para hacer un anexo de un cuarto en su vivienda, por medio de esta obra brindarle mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Ramón works as a plumber in the state’s water supply system in the municipality of Managua. He has done this work for 17 years. He is unmarried, with five people who are dependent on him. He is a person with good moral values.

Juan Ramón came to Ceprodel to request a loan to improve his house by buying construction material, such as cement blocks and sand, and to pay for labor to add a room to his house, thereby providing better living conditions to his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is 56 years old and is married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past five years, Florentina has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from selling soft drinks both wholesale and retail. She has borrowed and repaid five previous loans from NWTF.

Florentina is requesting a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more merchandise to sell in her store. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell in her store

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra enjoys her activities in her food selling business. In the afternoon, she cooks and sells fish balls and other dim sum to sell to the people in her village. Though income generated from this business is minimal, she patiently saves it for the daily allowances of her children. She has three children and two of them attend school. She had been doing this activity for three years. 

She needs additional products to sell. That is why she needs a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy more meatballs, fish balls and eggs to sell. 

In the future, she wants to strengthen her business to generate more income. She hopes to save enough profit to finance the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more meatballs, fish balls and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
To earn a living, Delia owns and manages a variety store in her village. She is 57 years old and was separated from her husband due to problems and unavoidable circumstances. Despite this, she lives with her mother and decided to take care of her for she is now old and incapable. She aimed to improve her business and increase her income to satisfy their necessities and save for their future.

Due to financial constraints, Delia is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy beverages, soaps, candies, shampoos, seasonings and soft drinks to sell in her variety store. She believes that through her patience and hard work, she will improve the business and make it a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy beverages, soaps, candies, shampoos, seasonings and soft drinks to sell

location.town: Brgy. La Torre North, Bayombong,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Francisca Del Socorro

texts.es: Francisca Del Socorro tiene mucho tiempo de ser cliente de Fundación León 2000, pues ha realizado muchas mejoras de su negocio gracias a los financiamientos. Inicio hace 6 años, con una pequeña de tienda de ropa usada debido a que el negocio no era muy rentable decidió quitarlo cuando su esposo se jubilo y fue con su esposo que decidió realizar este negocio. el motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de huevos, fideos, queso, mantequilla, azucar, sal entre otros productos.
texts.en: Francisca del Socorro has been a Fundación León 2000 client for a long time.  She has made many improvements to her business thanks to the loans.  She started out six years ago with a small used clothes store.  Because the business wasn’t very profitable she decided to close it when her husband retired.  It was with her husband that she then decided to open this business.  The reason for the loan is for the purchase of eggs, noodles, cheese, butter, sugar, salt, and other products.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, cheese, butter, sugar, cinnamon and cornmeal.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is married and blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. He has been selling goats for the last five years to bring up his family. He also does farming to increase his income. His potential customers are the local residents. Christopher has employed one person to assist him manage the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to own a butcher shop. He has requested for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more goats for resale.

loans.use: buy more goats

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Lilia has a shop that sells clothing like t-shirts and blouses. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy clothes to sell.
Lilia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lilia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo nació en la  ciudad de Cusco y vive en la ciudad de Urubamba. Ricardo tiene 65 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene ocho hijos.   

Ricardo desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Urubamba, él trabaja en el ministerio de educación en el área de administrativa pero a la vez tiene un negocio familiar que consiste en la venta de comida quienes atienden el local son sus hijos y su esposa, ellos tiene un pequeño local donde por ejemplo se vende comida típicas de la región, almuerzo y cena, ellos abren el restaurante de lunes a domingos. Ya son varios años que se dedican a la venta de comida y les va muy bien gracias al empeño que ponen en su trabajo. 

Ricardo pertenece al banco comunal “Tercer Milenio” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba. Las reuniones de la socias son cada treinta días en la ciudad  de Urubamba. Ricardo requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más. 

Ricardo se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ricardo was born in the city of Cusco and lives in the city of Urubamba.  Ricardo is 65 years old, and is married.  He has eight children from his marriage.

Ricardo undertakes both his daily activities and his business activities in the city of Urubamba.  He works for the Ministry of Education in administration, but at the same time he also has a family business selling food.  The premises for this business are managed by his sons and his wife; they have a small premises where they sell typical meals from the region (for example) for both lunch and dinner.  The restaurant is open from Monday through Sunday.  They have been selling food for several years now, and it is going very well for them thanks to the dedication that they bring to their work.

Ricardo belongs to the "Tercer Milenio" ["Third Millennium"] communal bank, which is part of Asociación Arariwa and is in Urubamba city. The members' meetings take place every month in Urubamba city.  

Ricardo requires the loan to purchase ingredients; for example sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, and other additional items.

Ricardo is grateful for the opportunity that's being provided to him by this means, and at the same time he agrees to comply with his repayments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients; for example sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, and other additional items.

loans.name: Watoka Mbali Group

texts.en:
David is the facilitator of the Watoka Mbali group. David and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

 With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to David and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

David takes care of nine children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for his family and to have additional maize profits to send his children to school. In the recent 2011 season, David had a good maize yield harvesting 7 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, David was only able to harvest 1/2 a bag of maize on ½ acre of land. 

With income from maize sales, David will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing and business as savings for future use. In 2012, the members of Watoka Mbali group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Shijirbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Shijirbaatar, is a 23-year-old taxi driver and has been running his business since last year. He lives with his wife and his son in Kherlen, a border town in Mongolia. His monthly earnings do not meet his family's necessities and he always wants to increase his business earnings step by step. 
He decided to change his old taxi car to provide better service quality. Therefore, he is purchasing his friend's car named “Bluebird”. It is a suitable car to run a taxi service around the city. He needs 1,000,000 MNT to cover the cost of purchasing his new car.

loans.use: To cover the cost of purchasing a new car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Chantha, 32, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are vegetable vendors in the market. One of her children is employed at the garment factory. In order to increase her family’s income, Chantha is asking for a loan of USD 500 to purchase a plot of farmland for growing rice to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to purchase a cart for carrying rice to sell and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of farmland for growing rice.

loans.name: Ena

texts.en:
Ena is 21 years of old.  She is married and has one child.

Ena owns and operates a business venture, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business.  Ena is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 WST to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 WST or $125 per week) to improve and/or expand the business.

In 2011, Ena joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Ena's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase perfumes, necklaces, earrings, and other items.

loans.name: John

texts.en: For the last four years John has been dealing in motorcycle transport business. He was inspired to start business by the need to look after his family being a married man with one child. His business suffers a setback of bad roads that lead to accidents and constant mechanical break downs as a big expense especially during the rainy season.  John has an aspiration of completing his house hence requesting a loan to buy doors for closing his house.

loans.use: to buy doors for closing his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: With a loan of USD 550, Mary plans to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: PURCHASE DAIRY COWS

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supply their shop at school.

loans.name: Felipa De Jesús

texts.es:
Felipa is married and has three children, ages 14, 21 and 25. Her husband is a construction worker. More than three years ago, she started working for a maquiladora (factory), while at the same time she runs a business selling men's and women's clothing. She sells the clothes to co-workers, neighbors and friends, all in an effort to help her husband with family expenses and keep moving their three kids forward, although only two are still school-age. Felipa already has a good fixed clientele, whose buying changes with the seasons, and since summer is coming she is certain she will take in good sales.

Felipa is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase clothes and add to her stock, since she knows her demand is increasing and already has orders for the upcoming season. She plans to repay the loan within four months. She is grateful for your support in continuing her business and helping improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Felipa esta casada y tiene 3 hijos de 14, 21 y 25 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como albañil, ella desde hace más de 3 años atrás trabaja como empleada en un empresa maquiladora y a la vez tiene un negocio de venta de ropa para dama y caballero, la cual la vende entre sus compañeras de trabajo, vecinos y amigos, todo por ayudar a su esposo con la economía familiar y sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos que aún están en edad escolar los dos últimos. Felipa ya tiene una cartera de clientes fijos los cuales le compran por lo general por temporadas y ya se viene el verano por lo que ella esta segura de que va a tener buenas ventas.

Felipa solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de US $250 para comprar mercadería y poder surtirse por que ella conoce a su demanda y aparte ya tiene pedidos para esta temporada que se avecina, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 4 meses, agradece tu apoyo para continuar con su negocio y poder con el ayudar a sacar adelante a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Nancy Guadalupe

texts.es:
Nancy lives in the San Nicolas de los G. neighborhood of Nuevo Leon. She’s a single mother of two children who are 16 and 20 years old. She has been selling cosmetics for five years, starting the business to be able to give her children the things they need, knowing that they can’t count on anyone else to help them get ahead. Little by little, she’s made a name for herself and increased her customer base. Nothing has been easy for Nancy but her love for her family has motivated her to work ever harder.

In order to meet the orders that she has and to offer a good service to her customers, Nancy is asking for a $475 loan that she will use to buy merchandise. She promises to repay the loan in 6 months. You play an important part in the development of this business and in the lives of Nancy and her family, and she thanks you for your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Nancy vive en la localidad de San Nicolás de los G. en Nuevo León, es soltera y tiene dos hijos de 16 y 20 años de edad. Desde hace cinco años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, inició este negocio para poder darle todo lo necesario a sus hijos ya que no cuenta con la ayuda de nadie más para sacar adelante a su familia. Poco a poco se ha dado a conocer y ha incrementado su número de clientes considerablemente, no ha sido fácil para Nancy pero el amor hacia su familia la motiva a esforzarse más cada día.

Para poder surtir los pedidos que tiene y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes ahora Nancy está solicitando un crédito de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía y se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, así como en la vida de Nancy y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for sale.

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Soleha

texts.id:
Mr. Soleha has a business making weaving products. He lives in a rented home at Rp3,000,000 (about US$330)/year. His wife and daughter live with him. His sales is about Rp5,000,000- Rp7,000,000 (about US$550-770)/month. His nett profit could reach Rp1,000,000 (about $110)/month. At this moment he has 4 employees at a monthly salary of Rp600,000 (about $66)/person. Loan to be obtained would be used to buy weaving raw materials like rattan and bamboo. His assumption is that profit could increase to about Rp1,500,000 ($165)/month. So far the raw materials he bought are finished products. Monthly living expenses are Rp 750,000 (about $82.50), and child education expense of Rp60,000 (about $6.60)/month could be afforded. Larger capital would help in expansion of his business,

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Bapak Soleha mempunyai usaha membuat kerei (anyaman). Dia tinggal di rumah kontrakan Rp 3.000.000,00 per tahunnya. Istri dan satu putrinya tinggal bersamanya. Omzet penjualannya Rp 5.000.000,00 – Rp 7.000.000,00/bulan. Keuntungan bersih per bulannya mencapai Rp 1.000.000,00. Saat ini dia memiliki 4 anak buah dengan gaji per bulan Rp 600.000,00 per orang. Pinjaman yang diperoleh akan digunakan untuk membeli bahan mentah kerei, seperti rotan dan bambu. Asumsinya keuntungan akan bertambah ± Rp 1.500.000,00/bulan. Karena selama ini bahan baku yang dia beli, berupa bahan yang sudah jadi. Biaya hidup per bulan Rp 750.000,00 dan biaya pendidikan anak per bulan Rp 60.000,00 dapat dia cukupi. Modal yang besar tentu akan membantu perkembangan usahanya.

loans.use:
To buy weaving raw materials like rattan & bamboo

Membeli bahan mentah kerei, seperti rotan dan bambu

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is father of 4 children. He lives in Istaravshan, Khujand. His business is located in the big wholesale market in Istaravshan.

Hamza's business is going well. He has good turnover of his goods.He has been in business for over 7 years. Currently he has many constant clients and always tries to meet all their needs. For the winter season he wants to purchase warm woman's boots, as this kind of shoes are in high demand in winter.

loans.use: Purchase of warm women's shoes for resale

loans.name: Isolina Benicia

texts.es:
Isolina has been in business selling refreshing shakes during the past 17 years. She started with a small loan from her oldest son. Her day begins at home where she blends the shakes to be sold at the Terminal market.

Her drink stand is very tidy and well located within the market. She is a widow and mother of 2 children that is struggling to help them improve their lives and aid their education.

Ceprodel has assisted Isolina financially during the past three years with 19 loans which have been repayed. The impact of these loans has been an improvement in her quality of life and an increase in the earnings from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Señor Carlos M. lives in his own house in the Ciudadela Ferroviaria are of La Paz. Carlos is an public administration officer in the department of La Paz.

With previous loans he has undertaken the construction of his home and the installation of running water and waste-disposal systems.

The loan now being requested will be used for the construction of walls in his house. This is the seventh occasion that he has asked for a loan and socioeconomic analysis undertaken leaves him favourably qualified to be able to request a further loan.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Carlos M. vive en casa propia en la zona Ciudadela Ferroviaria de la Ciudad de La Paz. El señor Carlos es rentista de la administración pública del departamento de La Paz.

Con créditos anteriores realizó la construcción de su vivienda y la instalación de agua y alcantarillado.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción del amurallado de su vivienda. Esta es la séptima ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Constrcution of a house wall

loans.name: Julia Demetria's Group

texts.en:
Epifania, Maria, and Julia have been members of the “Tulipanes” community bank for over one year. As part of the community bank, they have learned to be responsible, manage their time, learned how to educate their children, and the importance of saving.

Epifania is 54years old. She is married and has ten children, four of whom live with her. Epifania runs a store where she sells food staples such as rice, flour, and sugar. She also sells fruits and vegetables.

Maria is 26 years old. She lives with her partner and five year old son. Maria rents a space in the town center where she sells food staples. She has been running this business for three years.

Julia is 30 years old. She lives with her partner and two children. Julia sells vegetables in the Nery Garcia market. She buys the vegetables in bulk from the nearby jungle region and then transports them to Ayacucho.

Epifania, Maria, and Julia need loans of 400, 1200, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying milk, noodles, soft drinks, soaps, shampoo, sugar, rice, oil, sweet potatoes and lemons.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Epifania, Maria and Julia plan to use their savings to buy land, pay for their children’s education, and to increase the capital available for their businesses. Their dreams are to buy land, own a home, and help their children move forward and become professionals.

loans.use: Epifania, Maria, and Julia need loans of 400, 1200, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying milk, noodles, soft drinks, soaps, shampoo, sugar, rice, oil, sweet potatoes and lemons.

loans.name: Derlin Antonio

texts.es:
This young man, 27 years old, lives in Ticuantepe with his wife and 6 year old son. His wife sells agricultural products and together they work the land. With a lot of effort and work they have successfully increased their pineapple production. They work a standard plot and a half of pineapple. They are applying for a loan with which to buy the agricultural products for the maintenance of their crop. While they grow the crops they will later harvest, they will need to pay the household expenses and their loan payments and without the loan , what they need is outside of their reach. They have always worried about meeting their obligations and guaranteeing the quality of their product.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Este joven de 27 años de edad, vive en Ticuantepe acompañada de su pareja y un hijo de 6 años , su esposo es comerciante de productos agrícolas y a la vez junto a ella trabajan la tierra, con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo han logrado sacar adelante su producción de piña, trabajan un manzana y media de piña y solicitan el crédito para comprar los productos agrícolas para su mantenimiento en vista que con lo que trabajan mientras se da la cosecha pagan los gastos del hogar y las obligaciones de su crédito y la cantidad necesaria para comprar todo lo que necesitan está fuera de su alcance, siempre se han preocupado por cumplir con sus obligaciones y por garantizar la calidad de su producto.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru:
Nazokat K. lives in Tursun-zoda city. She is 41, married and has 4 children. She has finished high school. Nazokat buys and sells women's and childrens' shoes on a market. She has been in this business for 8 years. It brings additional income to her family, which makes it possible to provide for the family. All Nazokat's children are still in school. This is why she only can rely on herself for income. Because of her long experience in the retail business, Nazokat knows that the greater her variety of goods, the better the sales. This is why the client decided to get a loan. She plans to repay it within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

Кунушова Назокат жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 41 год,замужем , имеет 4 детей.Образование средние. Занимается куплей продажей женской и детской обувью на рынке.Имеет опыт в бизнесе уже 8 лет. Торговля приносит ее семье дополнительный доход. Что позволяет ей содержать свою большую семью. Все дети Назокат учатся в средней школе. Поэтому клиентка надеется только на себя. Имея хороший опыт в бизнесе Назокат знает,чем больше ассортимента товара ,тем лучше торговля. Поэтому клиентка решила взять кредит. Планирует погасить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S. is 47 years of age, working in Kampong Cham province. He and his wife, Bea Rai, have carved out a living there for themselves and their two children. He drives a horse-drawn cart for transporting both people and goods around their district. She is a local banana seller. Both of their children are able to attend school despite their parents' meager revenue. Sok S. wants to take out a small business loan to help his wife progress with her banana-selling business. She will use this loan to buy more bananas to sell. If their savings can increase, he hopes to someday purchase a better cart for himself.

loans.use: Buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Ayékinam

texts.fr:
Thirty-one years old, Mrs. Ayékinam A. is married to Mr. Mélébou KONDO who works as a firefighter in Lomé. They have two children who are both attending school. In 2005, she opened her hair salon “Sandrine Coiffure” in Lomé’s Agoè neighborhood and also sells beauty products. This first loan she is seeking will allow her to purchase five cartons of lotions, two cartons of soap, and one carton of shampoo.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 31 ans, madame A. Ayékinam s’est mariée à Monsieur KONDO Mélébou qui exerce le métier de sapeur pompier à Lomé. Ils ont deux enfants qui vont tous à l’école. En 2005, elle a ouvert son salon de coiffure « SANDRINE COIFFURE » dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé et vend aussi des produits de beauté. Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 5 cartons de laits, 2 cartons de savons et 1 carton de shampoon.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina is a humble mother. Sabina and her husband work together as farmers. They have 5 children who are the motivation for this couple. Farming can be risky during this season because of the changes in prices due to the economic situation her country is going through. However, what really affects her production is the cost of fertilizer needed for the land. This is why she requests $725 USD (2,000 soles), to be able to purchase fertilizer, improve the quality of the products and have more demand. She hopes that you can help her get this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Sabina, es una humilde madre de familia, ella y su esposo tienen 5 hijos quienes son el motor de vida de esta pareja, quien juntos se dedican a la agricultura.Esta labor puede ser muy arriesgada en esta época, debido a la variación de los precios por la coyuntura económica que está viviendo su país. Pero lo que realmente afecta considerablemente su producción, es el costo de los abonos y fertilizantes necesarios para sus terrenos.Por ello que requiere la cantidad de 2000 soles para poder comprar los abonos y fertilizantes y sus productos agrícolas sean de mejor calidad y mejor cotizados en el mercado. Ella espera que usted pueda ayudarla a conseguir este monto en calidad de préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for crop land.

loans.name: Rukhsora

texts.en:
D. Rukhsora is 43 years old. She is married and has two children. The difficult living conditions forced her husband to leave for Moscow to earn money. Rukhsora is an enterprising woman with a big desire of improving the quality of life of her family. She has been running her own small business for 2 years already. In her store, Rukhsora sells sweets, sugar, canning products, potted goods, soft drinks, and tea. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m.

The love of her children is the biggest reason Rukhsora makes the effort she does. Her daughter helps her in the store, registering the stock and serving clients.

Now her business is stable and her family's main source of income. To grow her business, she requests a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 US dollars). Rukhsora is planning to spend the loan to purchase more goods, and increase the range of what she sells. She promises to repay her loan within 12 months and thanks everybody who decided to support her. Rukhsora and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods at her store.

loans.name: Erkinjon

texts.en: I. Erkinjon is 33 years old. He is married and he has three children. Erkinjon is providing taxi services with his vehicle. He has been in this business since 2004. He has many years' experience driving a taxi, which he does for a living five days a week. At the same time, Erkinjon is raising small cattle. Erkinjon buys calves on the market at a low price, feeds them and then resells on the same market at a more profitable price. His wife helps him to feed and look after the calves. Erkinjon is trying to make his business stable. These businesses generate the main income which allows Erkinjon to support his family. Because Erkinjon wants to provide high-quality taxi services, he is going to fix his car. In order to do this, he needs to purchase parts so he is requesting $450 for the term of 5 months. You can help him ensure the well-being of his family. He needs your help and he thanks you sincerely.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for repairing taxi

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Awa N. est mariée, sans enfant mais elle a en charge 03 membres de sa famille proche.
Elle s’active dans l’achat et la revente de poisson frais. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt augmenter son capital afin de mieux améliorer les conditions de vie familiales.
texts.en:
Awa N. is married and has no children, but she is responsible for three close relatives.

She works at buying and selling fresh fish. She hopes with this loan to add to her working capital so that she can improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: wholesale purchase of fish and re-sale

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Adela M. from Mwanza, the beautiful city on the shores of Lake Victoria (Lake Victoria is not only famous for being one of the largest lakes in the world, but also for the fact that it feeds the Nile River, a very important source of life for Africa). She is married with 4 children, between the ages of 7 and 15. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 1 dependant because his parents are unable to properly care for their son.

Since 2006, Adela has been running a clothing store that sells items from vitenge (traditional African clothing) to business suits, and from purses to undergarments. She works at the business for 9 to 12 hours a day, 6 days a week and is assisted by her husband. She is requesting a loan of $425 in order to purchase additional inventory in bulk. Adela thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory in bulk

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia E. is 61 years old and married with 5 children. She sells sarongs, slippers, children clothes, local pots, jewellery, and rubber sandals. Her husband is a plumber. She has no store but she hawks her goods from street to street in her community. She is requesting the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more sarongs, rubber sandals and jewellery to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs, rubber sandals and jewellery to sell

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal P., 29, is a motorcycle taxi driver. He provides his service for passengers going from village to village in the area of his community, and he can earn around US$ 3 each day to buy food for his family. He is married to Keo Sokhey who is a grocery seller. She sells items such as cooked food and sweets for kids; she has experience in this business for a long time. Keo Sokhey now has four children, all of whom are single; one of her daughters is employed as a worker in Malaysia.

P. is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase grocery inventory for his wife to sell and piglets to raise. The family lives in Kompong Tom Province. (P.'s wife is pictured, because he was not available that day.)

loans.use: to purchase inventory grocery

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
Celso es una persona de la tercera edad y por esta condición no es considerado sujeto de crédito en otras instituciones; tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde trabaja con su esposa, de donde proviene su ingresos económicos para la manutención de sus dos hijos de 12,16 años de edad que dependen de la pareja, su domicilio esta  ubicado en la zona de los Andes de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de mercadería (arroz, azucar,harina, sodas, pan, etc.), de esa forma podrá surtir su tienda con diferentes productos para satisfacer a su clientela.
 
Es el cuarto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró con nuestra institución le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Celso is an older gentleman and, given his age, other institutions do not consider him credit-worthy. He has a general store where he works with his wife, generating income to support two children ages 12 and 16 who depend on the couple. Their home is located in the Los Andes zone of the city of El Alto. The loan would be used to purchase merchandise (rice, sugar, flour, sodas, bread, etc.), which will allow him to stock his store with different types of products to satisfy customer demand. This is his fourth loan with Impro. The good repayment history he demonstrated to our institution permits him access to another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as rice, sugar, flour, sodas, bread, etc. for his general store.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 27 years old and married with a child. She sells clothing material used by Nigerian women to make native blouses and wraps (clothes that are tied around the waist and also used to carry babies on the back). She has been in this business for a long time. She also sells women's footwear. Gloria hopes for a loan to purchase more clothing material to sell. She hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing material to sell.

loans.name: Olga Luz

texts.es:
T. P. OLGA LUZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Almendras” con domicilio en el Jr. Agustín Cauper N° 458 del distrito de Calería, tiene 33 años, 03 hijos, y su cónyuge tiene trabajo como estibador.

Ingresó al negocio de lácteos, y con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, pudo comprar leche y dedicarse a elaborar  yogur, queso, manjar y otros, pero el negocio demandaba mucho tiempo y cuidado, por lo que inició el negocio de compra y venta de ropa, zapatos, artículos de limpieza y belleza. Por ello para incrementar su negocio le caerá muy bien este préstamo de S/.1,500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual comprará zapatos, zapatillas, camisas, faldas, medias para la campaña escolar y también un surtido de materiales de limpieza y  de belleza.
Manuela Ramos le ayudo mucho a desarrollarse, a tener un negocio propio y no ser dependiente del cónyuge, sino a administrar ella misma sus ganancia y contribuir con la familia.
texts.en:
Olga Luz T. P. belongs to the "Las Alemendras" Communal Bank in the district of Calería. She is 33 years old, has three children, and her husband works as a stevedore. She entered the dairy business, and with her first loan of 300 soles, she was able to buy milk and produce yogurt, cheese, manjar, etc. This business, however, required a lot of time and care, so she began another business buying and selling clothing, shoes, and cleaning and beauty products. This loan of 1,500 soles would do well to help expand her business. She will use it to buy shoes, slippers, shirts, skirts, tights for school uniforms and also a supply of cleaning and beauty supplies. Manuela Ramos has helped her develop a great deal--she has her own business, isn't dependent on her husband, is in charge of her own income and contributes to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes, slippers, shirts, skirts, tights, cleaning and beauty products

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith A. O. is a 21-year-old mother of three children, aged 7, 3 and 1. Her 7-year-old is in school, and she plans to send the other two as well. She is married to a “hawker” – someone who sells small wares on the street in downtown Kisumu.

From her own store in the Nyamasaria slum, Judith sells second-hand clothes. She hopes to use this loan to expand her business and then to finance a plot of land on which she will build rental houses. Judith says that a plot of land in the Nyamasaria slum typically costs between 80,000 and 100,000 KSH. She is asking for a loan of 50,000 shillings.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes to sell, and to buy land

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes K. is a Tanzanian woman microentrepreneur. She has two business: a traditional clothing sales shop (selling kanga and vitenge) and poultry keeping at Lumo ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases clothes from Mnazi Mmoja traditional clothing wholesale shopping center and sells retail to her customers. She keeps both broilers and layers in her poultry cages. She has been in business for three years .Her business income is used to meet her family's daily demands and for capital. She is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 Tanzania shillings to boost up the business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata B. est une femme mariée avec 05 enfants en charge. Elle veut promouvoir son commerce. Elle vend des légumes sur un étal qu’elle tient à domicile. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions  de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aminata B. is a married woman with five children to support. She wants to advance her business. She sells vegetables in a stall that she has at home. Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell vegetables retail at her stall

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
"My previous harvest reached 180 sacks of rice. Now we are busy again preparing the land to have abundant harvest," says Shirley D., a mother of three children and owner of a 1.5 hectare farm in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase seeds, complete fertilizers, ammonium sulfate and herbicides. The loan will really help a lot to sustain their livelihood.

CEVI helps provide loans for small business entrepreneurs. CEVI provides its clients with loans, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, complete fertilizers, ammonium sulfate and herbicides

loans.name: Ndiabou

texts.fr: Ndiabou G. est une femme de 44 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle vend des denrées alimentaires telles que mil, maïs, riz, pain de singe et aimerait renforcer son activité. Elle souhaite mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Ndiabou G. is a woman of 44 years of age, married and the mother of 6 children. She sells foodstuffs such as millet, maize, rice, and monkey bread, and would like to bolster her business. She hopes to cater better for her family's needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and resale of millet, maize, rice, and monkey bread

loans.name: Talaileva

texts.en:
Talaileva T., 39, is married with eight children. She has many years of experience in her bakery business. She sells to the villagers and to the public three days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). She has no previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Talaileva’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be use to maintain her business needs.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, oil, baking powder, a fryer, and some pots for her pancakes

loans.name: Nanoor Godaguene I Group

texts.fr: Nanoor Godaguene I  est un groupe de femmes habitant prés du village sandiara localité située à 25 km de la ville Mbour .Elles s’activent dans l’agriculture,  le petit commerce et l’embouche. Avec le début de l’hivernage elles sollicitent un prêt pour financer leurs différentes activités génératrices de revenus leur unique source de revenu pendant cette période. Les revenus tirés de cette activité leur permettent de nourrir leurs familles en attendant les récoltes
texts.en:
Nanoor Godaguene I is a group of women living near the village of Sandiara, located 25 km from the city of Mbour. The women are active in agriculture, small-scale commerce, and the fattening of livestock. With the beginning of the off-season, they are requesting a loan to finance their different income-generating activities, which are their only sources of revenues during this period. These revenues enable them to feed their families as they waiting for the harvests.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster their businesses

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria E. is from the village of Canibungan Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is seventy-six years old and a widow with five grown children. Gregoria's business is the planting and harvesting of coconut. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

In 2005, Gregoria joined GDMPC, one of Kiva's field partners, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Gregoria has successfully repaid previous loans from GDMPC. Now she is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her seventeenth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in the growth of her business

loans.name: Nelibeth

texts.en:
Nelibeth S. is from Valencia City. She is 34 years old. Nelibeth is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Nelibeth owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Nelibeth has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Nelibeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelibeth is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nelibeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her retail store

loans.name: Victor Francisco

texts.es: El señor Víctor Francisco vive con su esposa la señora Rocío Marisol son una familia muy unida tienen dos hijos en edad escolar; el señor Víctor Francisco trabaja para una óptica reconocida en la ciudad como laboratorista desde hace 8 años, su esposa se dedica al hogar y al cuidado de la familia. Ellos están solicitando este crédito para construir una losa en el frente de su vivienda para mayor comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Víctor Franciscolives with his wife, Rocío Marisol, and their two school-aged children. They are a very united family and for the past eight years Víctor Francisco has worked in a recognized optician’s laboratory in the city. His wife takes care of the home and family. They are requesting a loan to construct a concrete slab in front of their home to make the family more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to construct a concrete slab in front of their home

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa O. is from the village of Gumbil,Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Felipa is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Felipa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Felipa has been engaged in her business for over 31 years and earns approximately 5,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Felipa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felipa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Felipa is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Felipa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Jantsandorj

texts.en:
B. is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Kharkhorin, the ancient capital of the Mongolian empire. He and his family live together in a "ger," a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. B.’s wife stays home with their youngest child, and the eldest attends a local secondary school.

B., with the help of his youngest brother, operates a car repair business in his town. He began his business in 1998 and has since then been successful enough to buy a microbus and garage. He has also been able to purchase some land nearby where he hopes to begin farming soon.

B. is requesting a 600,000 tugrug (about $420) loan in order to purchase some repair parts and tools. These will help him decrease his repair time and increase his sales.

loans.use: To purchase repair parts and tools in order to decrease his repair time and increase his sales

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita R. is a struggling mother of five children. Through her hard work and determination to bring them out of poverty, she was able to send the eldest four to college where they took vocational courses. Her small business enabled her to augment the income of her husband who is a motorcycle driver. Now, two of her children work in Manila and two have their own families.

For her youngest child, Bernardita wants to ensure her future by supporting her studies until she graduates from college. She believes that the only way she could make this dream of hers come true is through strengthening her small business and making it grow to increase the profits she makes from it. She therefore is requesting a loan through ASHI to be able to support her dream for her family through her farming business managed by her husband.

loans.use: To finance her farming and fishing businesses

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida M. is 50 years old and has two children.  She supports her family with her small school canteen and her duckery.  She now has 300 ducks at home.  She wishes to have more capital to be used for the growth of her business.

She’s now requesting a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. of 16,000 PHP.  She will use the loan to sustain her business and provide the tuition fees for her children.

loans.use: Groceries and Ducks

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia P., 54 years old, is from the village of Sto.Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is married and has two older children. To make a living, Clemencia owns and operates a hair salon and beauty parlor. While not the only means for generating revenue, she has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Clemencia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clemencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide services. Clemencia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand her business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Clemencia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria trabaja en el magisterio rural, tiene dos hijos que están en la edad escolar; el esposo trabaja en el magisterio. Estas actividades son su principal fuente de ingresos con que cubren la manutención de su familia.  Vive en la ciudad de El Alto zona Pedro Domingo Murillo.
 
El crédito lo destinará  a la compra de  material de construcción (ladrillo, cemento, estuco, etc.) para realizar una habitación  para sus hijos.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Ana Maria and her husband both work at the rural school. They have two school-aged children. These activities are their main source of income to cover the maintenance of the family. They live in the Pedro Domingo Murillo zone of the city of El Alto.

This loan will be used for the purchase of construction materials (brick, cement, stucco, etc.) to build a bedroom for their children, so they can be more comfortable.

This is Ana Maria’s second loan with Impro. The evaluation qualifies her to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy brick, cement, stucco, and other materials to build a children's bedroom

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr: H. Delphine est née en 1973 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à KPADONOU Corneil, Delphine est mère de six enfants, dont cinq sont à sa charge. Certains de ses enfants sont scolarisés. Il y a environs cinq ans que Delphine vit à Agblangandan, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Delphine n’a pas été à l’école. Pour venir en aide à son mari, Delphine vend de la nourriture et des produits vivriers (maïs, riz, etc.) de façon ambulante. Delphine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Delphine a déjà cinq ans d’expérience dans ce domaine, et est à son deuxième crédit à ALIDé. Delphine a bien remboursé le premier crédit qu’elle a obtenu de ALIDé. Delphine sollicite un deuxième crédit, pour renforcer son capital et augmenter le stock de ses produits.
texts.en:
Delphine H. was born in 1973 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Married to Corneil Kpadonou, Delphine is the mother of six children, of whom five are in her care. Some of her children are in school. For about five years, Delphine has lived in Agblangandan, in the town of Sèmè-Podji, with her children and her husband. The couple provide for the family together. Delphine did not attend school. To help her husband, Delphine sells food staples (maize, rice, etc.) door-to-door. Delphine gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Delphine already has five years of experience in this field, and is on her second loan with ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners). Delphine properly repaid the first loan she obtained from ALIDÉ. Delphine is seeking a second loan to strengthen her capital and increase her stock of products.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and rice

loans.name: Vaifafo

texts.en:
Vaifafo F. is 42 and single with 5 children (ages 6 - 16).  She is starting a business venture, selling food products in the local community.  Vaifafo needs a loan of WST $1000 to invest in renovating the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 tala or US $104 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2009, Vaifafo joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Vaifafo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Vaifafo F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2.1 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Kimya Plus Group

texts.en:
Erméline N. is the leader of a community bank (borrower's group) named "Kimya Plus" which means "Silence" in English. It is composed of 33 members united in solidarity for receiving loans with the goal of developing their businesses.  62 years old, Erméline is a widow and the mother of ten children, whose ages vary between 22 and 43 years old. Only one of her children attends college.

Erméline has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 1971. She runs a general store to the Southwest of Kinshasa in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. She has acquired solid experience in this area and works hard with good management skills in order to realize her dream of one day opening a larges store.

She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business that now earns her $480 per month. She works to the best of her abilities and uses her contacts so that she might achieve her goals. Erméline is a trustworthy client of HOPE RDC, a Kiva partner microfinance institution, and has  thirteen times obtained and correctly repaid loans.

With this loan, Erméline plans to increase her stock of merchandise by buying cans of food, sacks of rice and sugar and milk and reselling them at a profit.

loans.use: To buy cans of food, sacks of rice and sugar, and milk

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en:
Pelagie is 43 years old and is married with seven children aged between 2 and 20 years. She and her family live in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Pelagie owns a small shop that sells various products such as cosmetics products, foodstuffs, and so forth. She has been entrepreneur since 2005 and her business is well-known which is very advantageous for her because it means she gets enough customers to her shop.

Pelagie employs one person in her business as a helper. The hours of her business are from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day, even during the weekend.

So far, Pelagie is not able to satisfy the demands of her clients through offering them a greater quantity of products. She is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to grow her business through purchasing more products to satisfy the demands of her clients.

The profits Pelagie expects to earn will be reinvested in her business so that her monthly profits increase. Once the profits are enough, she will be able to feed her children and save money for building a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi started farming when she married her husband, Antonio. She now has five children; the oldest is 23 years old. She and her husband work together at the farm to be able to earn a living. She also raises pigs to earn extra income. Like other mothers, she wants all her children to finish college and have a bright future. 

Noemi is seeking a loan of PHP 6,000 that she would use to fund her farm. She will buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She also wants to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and pig feed

loans.name: Liezyl

texts.en:
Liezyl M. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 31 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Liezyl owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling soft drinks, candies and soda in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Liezyl joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Liezyl is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase his crop yield

loans.name: Gabiro Group

texts.fr:
Jeanine Habinomana est une commercante agee de 30 ans qui habite la commune de Rugombo (en province de Cibitoke) dans l'ouest de Burundi.  Elle a fait ses etudes jusqu'en troisieme primaire.  Son mari est cultivateur.  Elle vend des habits au marche central de Rugumbo.  Auparavant, elle exercait le metier de cultivateur en plus de son commerce de vendre des habits, mais depuis un an elle s'est engage totalement dans le commerce.

Elle est mere de deux enfants; une fillette de 4 ans et un garcon de 18 mois.  Elle lutte pour que ses enfants puissent etudier et terminer avec succes afin qu'ils vivent aisement.

Elle demande le credit Turame-Kiva pour augmenter les quantites des habits qu'elle vend aux clients.  Elle espere pouvoir surmonter divers problemes de la vie, mais aussi lutter contre la pauvrete, grace aux revenus tires de ce commerce.  Elle encourage des autres a demander le credit Turame-Kiva parce qu'elle a vu comment cela lui a permis de surmonter certains problemes dans son menage.  Elle est une des membres du groupe "Gabiro" et est au deuxieme cycle de credit.
texts.en:
Jeanine Habinomana, 30, is a businesswoman who lives in the township of Rugombo (in the province of Cibitoke) in the west of Burundi. She attended school up to grade 3. Her husband is a farmer. She sells clothing in the central market of Rugumbo. Earlier, she used to work as a farmer besides selling clothing, but for the past year, she has been devoting herself completely to her business. She is the mother of two children, a little girl of 4 and a boy of 18 months. She is doing everything she can to guarantee that her children will be able to go to school and finish their studies so that they can live comfortably. Jeanine is requesting the loan from Turame-Kiva to add to her inventory of clothing that she sells her customers. She hopes to be able to surmount life's various difficulties, and also to struggle against poverty, thanks to the income from her business. She encourages others to request a Turame-Kiva loan because she has seen how much it has helped her to deal with household problems. She is a member of the 'Gabiro' group and is on her second loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying clothing for resale

loans.name: Las Golondrinas Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado “Las Golondrinas” y está conformado por 13 socias, pertenecientes a la cuidad de Temuco. Ellas se dedican principalmente a negocios de repostería, costuras, venta de ropa,  humitas y empanadas.
La socia entrevistada fue Blanca, quien es la presidenta de este grupo. En la foto se encuentra  en 2º fila, en 1º lugar de izquierda a derecha y viste chaqueta negra y chaleco rojo. Ella vende frutas, verduras y carbón en una camioneta que maneja su esposo. Quiere invertir este préstamo en carbón, ya que en esta época de frío es un buen negocio. 
Su sueño es tener un negocio establecido en su casa o en otro lugar.
A Blanca le han servido los talleres de educación emprendedora que entrega Fondo Esperanza, para  organizar mejor su dinero.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is named “Las Golondrinas” (The Swallows) and consists of 13 members who are from the city of Temuco. They engage in different businesses that include baking desserts, sewing, selling clothes, making “humitas” (a traditional dish similar to tamales), and making empanadas.

The member who was interviewed was Blanca, who is the group president. In the photograph, she is standing on the second row to the left, wearing a black jacket and red sweater. She sells fruit, vegetables, and coal from a truck that her husband drives. Blanca wants to invest her loan in coal because it is a good business since the weather is cold. Her dream is to have an established business in her home or at some other location. Blanca has served on several entrepreneurial workshops provided by Fonda Esperanza that help the members better manage their money.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region and is located 670km to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile). It has several lakeside resorts where the flora and fauna are absolutely striking. Half of the residents of this region are of Mapuche descent, an indigenous people who live in Chile.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coal

loans.name: Elvin Antonio

texts.es:
Elvin tiene 33 años de edad y tiene venta de mariscos, que inicio hace siete años con fondos propios y la ayuda de su mama que también se dedica a esta actividad.  Este es su principal fuente de ingreso y su familia depende en esto.

Elvin a tenido otros préstamos y les han servido mucho para poder invertir en su negocio.

Elvin está casado y tiene un hijo de 3 años.  La meta para su negocio es comprar un vehículo para transportar su producto.
texts.en:
Elvin is 33 years old. He sells seafood. He started seven years ago with his own funds and help from his mother. She also sells seafood. This is his principal source of income, and his family is dependent upon it. Elvin has had other loans, and they have helped him a lot to be able to invest in his business. Elvin is married and has a three year old child. The goal for his business is to buy a vehicle to transport his product.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Marketing seafood

loans.name: Baigalmaa

texts.en:
Baigalmaa is 41 years old and lives with her sister and 6 daughters in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a house, in a yard that belongs to her sister. Her husband, Naranbaatar, is currently working in Korea on a three-year labor contract. Her husband helped her with her business until he left to work overseas. 

She operates a shoe-trading business at Urt-tsagaan, the small outdoor market in Mongolia. She has been operating her business since 2003, and has steadily expanded her business since then. Since she founded her business, her living conditions have improved. She sells women and men shoes that she buys in Ereen, China, a border town, where many inexpensive Chinese products are imported to Mongolia. Because Baigalmaa chooses the cheapest shoes, her shoes are sold fast and easily. She is requesting a loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Kisagazi Farmers, Mubende Group

texts.en:
32-year-old Agiri B. has, for the last ten years, been plying her retail shop business in Kisaagazi, Mubende. With this business, which mostly deals in home utensils like basins, cups, lamps, candles and jerrycans, this married woman has significantly improved her family’s welfare. All her three children are happily in good schools.

Agiri began this business with savings from her farming business. She credits her success to hard work, determination and resilience. Her plan is to turn her retail shop into a wholesale franchise in the near future. In a week, she makes profits that add up to 50,000 shillings. With this loan, she wants to purchase more retail items in bulk for her shop so that she does not incessantly run out of stock.

loans.use: To purchase more retail items like sugar, basins, salt and bars of soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Edwin Martin

texts.es: Edwin es de 23 Años de edad es soltero, se dedica apresta servicio de alquiler de teléfono, cuanta con tres aparatos de teléfono en el parque de su localidad, su madre tiene establecido una tienes de consumo en su casa de habitación, juntos han salido adelante, su papa falleció hace varios años, solicita su primer préstamo para comprar un aparato de teléfono lo que le ayuda a mejorar su servicio y aumentar sus ingresos, en la actividad tiene aproximadamente tres años de experiencia.
texts.en:
Edwin is 23 years old and single. He rents telephone service. He has three telephones in the park in his area. His mother has a grocery store in her house. Together they have gotten ahead. His father died several years ago. He is requesting his first loan to buy a telephone, which will help him improve his service and increase his income. He has approximately three years of experience in this business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a telephone

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase materials to repair the roof of her house-corrugated iron roofing, joists

loans.name: Graciela De La Asuncion

texts.es:
Graciela vende productos naturales Omnilife desde que se enfermo ella comenzó a utilizarlos y como le ayudo con su salud, compro para venderlos a sus amigas y vecinos. 

Vende productos como el Oni plus, Teatino que son para la buena circulación, trabaja desde muy temprano, aunque no está casada ella continúa trabajando para asegurar su vejez y ayudar económicamente a sus hijos. Cuando se siente cansada deja de venderlo porque caminar le afecta a su salud, una de las dificultades que tienes es la subida momentánea de los precios. 

Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo productos naturales como teatino y star bien para incrementar sus ingresos. En el futuro quiere tener su propio local y asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Graciela has sold Omnilife natural products since she became ill and started to used them and they helped her with her health. She buys the products and sells them to her friends and neighbors. She sells products such as "Oni Plus" and "Teatino," which are good for the circulation. She works from the early morning hours, and since she is not married she continues working to save for her old age and to help her children economically. When she feels tired she stops selling, because a lot of walking can affect her health. One of the difficulties she faces is the momentary increase in prices. Graciela wants to use the loan to buy natural products such as "Teatino" and "Star Bien" to increase her earnings. In the future she wants to have her own store and have economic security when she is elderly.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy Omnilife natural producs such as Teatino and Star Bien

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single woman with one child who attends school. She has been operating her beauty shop for the last five years, women being her potential customers. With this KES 40,000 loan, Margaret wants to purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon and employ another person. She also farms and sells maize to earn another source of income.

Margaret's major challenge in the business is seasonality. She hopes to improve her business and become the best beauty salon in the future. Margaret decided to work with Yehu in order to get financial assistance to improve her business. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon and to employ another person

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en: Khanh T. D. is 53 years old. She has 3 children. Two of them are attending vocational school. Khanh is a farmer. To earn income, she grows rice, vegetables and tomatoes in paddies of 3,000 square meters. She has worked in this business for many years. To increase her daily income, Khanh also raises 300 hens. Every day, she sells eggs wholesale. Khanh has been a SEDA client since 2004, She has always repaid her loans on time. Currently, Khanh is requesting a loan of 5,450,000 VND to buy fertilizer and poultry feed.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and poultry feed.

loans.name: Leyla

texts.es: Leyla, de 52 años,  es una mujer madura y seria, es madre soltera, tiene una hija que se llama Fiorella, de 23 años, con la que vive en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de La Unión Leticia. A pesar de las constantes dificultades que logró pasar para educar a su hija, ella siente que su vitalidad sigue intacta. Hace ya 20 años que viene dedicándose a la agricultura, oficio que le ayudó a pagar los estudios universitarios de su hija, ahora según sus propias palabras, “siembra por que lo toma como un pasatiempo”. Todos los fines de semana se dirige a su terreno de cultivo, donde cuida sus plantaciones de maíz, papa y habas, que después de cada cosecha los comercializa en el mercado central de su ciudad; con el tiempo ella logró abrir una pequeña tienda de comestibles, donde diariamente vende productos de primera necesidad, por lo que espera surtir más su tienda de abarrotes. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y le agrada las reuniones de su banco comunal, ahí comparte experiencias de éxito. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja y zanahoria, que en estos meses está pensando cultivar.
