texts.en: Leyla, age 52, is a mature and serious woman. She is the single mother of Fiorella, age 23, with whom she lives in her own house, located in the town of La Unión Leticia. In spite of ongoing difficulties, she was able to educate her daughter and help her get ahead. She feels that her vitality is still intact. For the past 20 years, she has been working in agriculture, a profession that has helped her pay for her daughter's university studies. Now, in her own words, "I plant because I treat it as a hobby." Every weekend, she goes out to her fields where she takes care of her crops of corn, potatoes and beans, which after every harvest she sells in the central market of her city. Over time, she was able to open a small food store, where she sells basic products each day. In the future, she is planning to stock her store with a broader range of groceries. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she enjoys the meetings of her communal bank, where she shares experiences of success. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy carrot and pea seeds, which she is thinking of cultivating in these months.

loans.use: Buying pea and carrot seeds

loans.name: Naranchimeg

texts.en: Naranchimeg D. is 48 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. She lives with her family in a ger (a traditional Mongolian housing tent). Her two children both attend a local secondary school. Her husband works as a sawyer in the local firewood market. Naranchimeg operates a grocery out of a stall at the local market. She started her business in 2002 after working at a grocery store as a salesperson between 1985 and 2002. Over the years, she has built a stable and successful business operation. She hopes to expand her business by enlarging her workplace. With this loan, she is planning to increase her product line. Currently, she sells a variety of foodstuffs in her small wooden pavilion. She hopes to improve her workplace by making it a bigger space in the future. Naranchimeg is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrik loan to purchase a large quantity of foodstuffs at wholesale prices to sell back as a retailer and to expand her product line.

loans.use: To purchase large quantity of foodstuffs

loans.name: Gitau

texts.en:
Gitau is 62 years old and married to Ann. Together, they have five dependent children. He has been in the food service business for twenty years with an income of Kshs 12800. 

This is his first loan, which he intends to use to buy more stock of of flour, rice, and sugar. He hopes to improve his family's standard of living and buy a plot of land to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more stock of flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios C., 56, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. She finds comfort in her children. She makes sure that she earns enough for the six children still living with her so that they can have a better life. She has been managing her variety store while operating a rag-making business.

Remedios has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for over a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow a number of times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her businesses. 

To help her continue her business operation, she would like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying groceries, toiletries, and beverages for her variety store. She will also use some of the loan to purchase more raw materials needed for her rag-making business.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can leave a successful business as a legacy to her children.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for rag-making operation and additional stocks for variety store

loans.name: Sinore Enole

texts.en:
Sinore Enole S. is 50 years old. She is married to Pariken S. and the mother of four children between the ages of 5 and 15.

Sinore is a farmer and she does the farming on her own piece of land, which she has been doing for the last 12 years.

She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered members in KADET. This will be her second loan, which she is planning to spend to prepare land and buy chemicals and fertilizer for her ten-acre wheat farm for the next planting season. Wheat has proved to be doing well in this area and the market is readily available in the area to both retail and wholesale buyers.

She hopes to use the profits from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming. Sinore's dream is to do large scale farming and to own farm machinery.

loans.use: To prepare land and buy chemicals and fertilizer for her ten-acre plot

loans.name: Agustin

texts.en:
Agustin is 47 years old.  He lives in the district of Tambogrande in northen Peru.  It is a semi-tropical zone primarily populated by small farmers, many of whom own small fruit plantations or raise animals.  Agustin owns his home, which he shares with his wife.  They have two children.

Agustin raises animals in corrals behind his home.  He has 6 cows and 30 head of sheep.  He raises the animals for milk and for their meat.  In addition to animals, Agustin works a small plot of land the family owns.  He has the property planted with mature lime trees, from which he harvests fruit each week.  Given the extended growing season in the region, he is able to maintain relatively stable income levels in accordance with local prices.

Agustin has not worked with Edpyme Alternativa before. He appreciates the access to credit and a lower interest rate that is provided as a result of Kiva funding.  He plans to use the loan to purchase additional balanced feed for his animals and make various improvements to his corrals.  He expects that the investment will improve the animals' health and productivity.  From these improvements, he hopes to be able to improve his family’s lifestyle and provide greater opportunities to his children.

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed for his animals and make improvements to his corrals

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, provincia de Quispicanchis, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Oswaldo; El socio tiene 32 años de edad, el socio es conviviente; el socio tiene 2 hijos; el socio trabaja administrando su tienda de abarrotes, el socio requiere el préstamo para poder comprar mercadería, el socio comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y todo al por mayor, el también comprara leche y otros productos básicos, El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para abastecer su tienda de abarrotes.

El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos básicos para implementar su tienda.
El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Oswaldo belongs to the Virgen Asunta de Oropesa Communal Bank.  This bank is located in the Oropesa district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department.  

Oswaldo is 32 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children.  He works managing his grocery store.  He needs the loan to be able to buy merchandise.  He will buy rice, sugar, noodles, and oil.  He will buy these items wholesale.  He will also buy milk and other basic products.  Oswaldo is requesting the loan to buy merchandise to stock his grocery store.  He is also requesting the loan to buy basic products to supply his store.

He is happy with the loan that was granted, and he pledges to make his payments on time.

loans.use: To buy basic products for his store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 52 años, es separada de su esposo, y vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de sus dos hijos que son mayores. Hace muchos años tenía un bazar, negocio que le ayudaba en el sustento de su familia, pero los problemas conyugales que tenía tuvo que hacerse cargo de la educación superior de sus hijos; por tal razón su negocio no pudo auto sostenerse que fracaso. Hoy trabaja en casa ajena, realizando labores domesticas durante el día, sin embargo no le daba abasto así que emprendió un negocio adicional, que es la venta de productos de belleza. Desde entonces aprovecha la oportunidad de vender a sus amistades  y familias los cosméticos que más demanda tienen. Con estas ganancias viene afrontando y cubriendo la educación de sus hijos además de comprar los medicamentos para su madre anciana. En adelante piensa dejar de trabajar como doméstica para retomar e reabrir su bazar,  de esa manera logrará estabilizar su economía.  Es el 11avo crédito con MFP, y se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea contar con posteriores ayudas para re iniciar su negocio anterior. De obtener el crédito solicitado, podrá cubrir los gastos de operación de su madre.
texts.en:
52 year-old María is separated from her husband and lives in her own home with her two grown-up children.  María owned a store for many years and her business helped her to support her family but, owing to her marriage problems, she had to take sole responsibility for her children's higher education expenses.  For this reason, her business could not sustain itself and failed.

Currently, María works in other peoples' homes, carrying out domestic tasks during the day.  However, as this is not enough to support her family, she has taken on an additional business, selling beauty products.  María has taken the opportunity to sell her most popular cosmetics to her friends and family members.  She uses the profits from this business to cover the expenses of her children's education and to buy medication for her elderly mother.

In the future, María plans to stop working as a domestic employee and to re-open her store.  In this way, she hopes to stabilize her finances.

This is María's 11th loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time since she would like to have access to loans in the future, to help her to re-start her previous business.  María will use this loan to cover the expenses of an operation for her mother.

loans.use: To cover her mother's operation expenses

loans.name: Efraín

texts.es:
El joven Efraín tiene 21 años, es soltero y vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Caacupé, Barrio Virgen de los Remedios, distante unos 92km de la capital del País, en donde tiene una librería bien surtida, dicho negocio fue heredado de sus padres hace dos años.
Solicita a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva un crédito para cargar artículos de librería puesto que tiene a lado de su negocio una escuela primaria, y así obtendría más ingreso para su unidad familiar y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Efraín is 21 years old, single, living with his parents in the city of Caacupé’s Virgen de los Remedios neighborhood, which is located about 92 kilometers from the nation’s capital.  He has a well stocked bookstore there, a business he inherited from his parents two years ago.

He is asking Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for a loan to stock school supplies since he has an elementary school next door and this will provide more income for his family unit and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Vilma Rosa

texts.es:
Vilma O. C., tiene 53 años de edad y se dedica a la comercialización de ropa interior para damas, caballeros y para niños, en un puesto comercial que queda en el centro de Barranquilla, un lugar bien concurrido por peatones. El negocio de Vilma inició hace 16 años,  cuando llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla, procedente del municipio de Fundación en el departamento del Magdalena, pues   su hijo requería ingresar  a la universidad   para continuar sus estudios y a    Vilma   se le ocurrió vender  sabanas y toallas encargadas  por muchos conocidos, a los cuales otorgaba crédito. Con el paso del tiempo fue ampliando su inventario y agregó otras mercancías, como calcetines, conjuntos de niños y ropa interior para damas, caballeros e infantil, pero eso si siempre ha sido apoyada por su esposo en sus proyectos de vida y esto la inspira a seguir adelante.  
Vilma se acercó a la Fundación a tramitar su primer financiamiento,  pues quiere cumplir su sueño de tener un negocio donde no pague arriendo, por eso con su credikiva que también es su primer crédito,  comprará la prima del puesto comercial en el que se encuentra vendiendo mercancías  y  que en la actualidad no es de su propiedad ; ella argumenta que su inversión tendrá mucho éxito  porque no tendrá que pagar arriendo por el espacio locativo y esto la ayudará a disminuir los precios de sus productos y alcanzar un mayor volumen de ventas competitivas y a nivel personal la satisfacción de  avanzar en su crecimiento empresarial.
texts.en:
Vilma O. C. is 53 years old and her business is selling men's, women's and children's clothes from a spot in the center of Barranquilla, in an area that is has a lot of foot traffic.  Vilma started her business 16 years ago when she arrived in the city of Barranquilla from the town of Fundación, in Magdalena department as her son wanted to enter university to continue his studies.  Vilma decided to sell sheets and towels that a lot of acquaintances ordered and she offered her goods on credit.  Over time, she expanded her inventory and added other merchandise such as socks, children's outfits and men's, women's and children's underwear.  However, she has always been supported by her husband in all her projects in life and this inspires her to keep going.

Vilma approached Fundación Leon 2000 to request her first loan as she would like to achieve her dream of owning a business where she doesn't pay rent.  For this reason, she will use her Kiva loan, which is also her first loan, to pay for the spot where she sells her merchandise and which she doesn't currently own.  She tells us that her investment will be very successful because she won't have to pay rent for her spot and this will help her to reduce the price of her products and she will reach a larger volume of competitive sales.  It will also give her the personal satisfaction of making progress in her growth as a businesswoman.

loans.use: To pay for the spot where she works

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre M. is 34 years old. He is married and has six children. He has five years of experience selling beans. His business is open from 7am until 5pm every day. 

M. needs his first loan from Vision Finance Company of 300,000 RWF. With this loan, he hopes to expand his business by purchasing more beans in order to increase his sales. With the additional profits, he will be able to pay school fees for his children and save money for his future.

loans.use: To purchase more beans

loans.name: Los Fundadores Del Oriente Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Los Fundadores del oriente” está conformado por 19 emprendedores, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco. Sus principales negocios son de corte y confección de ropa, venta de abarrotes, verduras, leña, verduras congeladas, abarrotes, utensilios de aseo, repostería, frutas y verduras, papas fritas, ensaladas preparadas, ropa nueva a sectores rurales y paquetería  librería. 
Elisa es la tesorera de éste grupo, en la foto se encuentra en la última fila, en la primera columna del lado derecho, usa anteojos. Su negocio consiste en la venta de abarrotes, se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 2 años, ella adaptó un negocio en el patio de su casa, Elisa trabaja todos los días de la semana y su horario laboral es de 8:30 a 10:00 de la noche, además se dedica a la confección y arreglo de ropa, junto con esto transporta niños hacia los colegios. Su mercadería usualmente la compra en supermercados mayoristas y los proveedores de verduras llegan a su mismo domicilio. 
Con éste préstamo comprará insumos para sus costuras, específicamente hilos, cierres, botones y para su negocio de abarrotes comprará lácteos. 
Sus sueños ya los cumplió y eran obtener su vivienda propia, además de un local establecido para su negocio. 
Para Elisa los créditos de Fondo esperanza han significado un gran apoyo para su negocio, ya que con éste podrá invertir en él, ella está muy contenta con las reuniones y talleres que se realizan en Fondo esperanza, ya que son muy amenas, además que existe mucha solidaridad entre los emprendedores de éste banco. Respecto a las capacitaciones le han servido ya que ella debe llevar registro de todo su capital, inversiones y ganancias. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
“Los Fundadores del Oriente” (The Founders of the East) Communal Bank is composed of 19 entrepreneurs, all residing in the city of Temuco.  Their principal businesses are cutting and assembling clothing, and selling groceries, vegetables, firewood, frozen greens, cleaning utensils, cakes, fruits, fried potatoes, prepared salads, new clothing in the countryside, and a packaging and book shop.

Elisa is the treasurer of this group (in the back row of the photo, in the first column on the right, wearing eyeglasses).  For 2 years, her business has sold groceries from the patio of her house.  She works every day of the week from 8:30 am until 10:00 pm at night.  She also designs and makes clothing and, in addition, transports children to school.  Usually, she buys her merchandise from wholesale supermarkets and the greens come from her own house.

With this loan, she will buy supplies for clothes-making, specifically thread, zippers, buttons; and milk products for her grocery store.  Her dreams have already been accomplished -- to obtain her own house, as well as an established shop for her business.

For Elisa, the loans from Fondo Esperanza have been a big help in her business, making investments possible.  She is very happy with the reunions and workshops occurring at Fondo Esperanza, since they are very engaging.  Also, there is much solidarity among the entrepreneurs in this bank.  Concerning the training, it has been very helpful and now she can keep records of her capital, investments, and earnings.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucania region.  The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (Chile's capital).  In the surrounding area are a series of mineral baths (Pucon, Villarrica) and the native flora and fauna is very attractive, concentrated in nearby natural parks.  It's worth noting that in this region reside some 50% of the Mapuches (the native people of Chile).

loans.use: TO PURCHASE THREAD, ZIPPERS, BUTTONS, AND MILK PRODUCTS

loans.name: Jeanne D`arc

texts.en: Jeanne d`Arc is 27 years old, married and has two young children. For the last nine years, she has made a living by running a small variety store where she sells items such as lotions, soap and toothpaste. Her business is well-organized and open every day from 5 a.m. to 9 p.m. She has applied for a loan from Kiva and Vision Finance Company to buy more items to sell to her customers. She hopes to expand her business so that she can save for the future and provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Santo

texts.en: Santo is currently in business selling alcohol. She is 48 years old, married, with six children and three of them go to school. Santo borrowed a loan to stock more alcohol to sell. She hopes to pay for her children in school in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex N. is 23 years old and married to Naomi Wanjiru, who also contributes to their monthly income. He has been running his motorcycle transport business for a period of two years with an income of about $45 a month.

This is his first loan cycle with Kadet after being introduced by the group members. He wants to use the loan to buy a piece of land which they are buying as a group. He hopes to improve his family's living standards and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land with his group.

loans.name: Tito Joel

texts.es:
Tito es un joven de 21 años de edad. Es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor que vive junto a su novia y su menor hijo en casa de su suegra, ubicada en el distrito de Chiclayo.

Tito se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte público, él tiene una mototaxi.  La mototaxi es una moto que cuenta con una cabina en la parte trasera donde se pueden trasportar pasajeros, este servicio es muy común en las pequeñas comunidades del Perú. El trabajo que Tito realiza le permite mantener a su familia, obteniendo ingresos diarios.

Tito solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 700 nuevos soles que destinará en la reparación de su moto, pues últimamente esta le ha estado presentado algunas fallas, algo que ha disminuido las horas de trabajo de Tito y por lo tanto sus ganancias.

Tito tiene muchos deseos de independizarse y de formar su propio hogar. Él siente que con su trabajo y esfuerzo lo va a lograr.
texts.en:
Tito is 21 years old.  He is a hard-working and entrepreneurial young man who lives together with his girlfriend and son in his mother-in-law's home which is located in Chiclayo district.

Tito provides a public transport service in his motorcycle taxi.  A motorcycle taxi is a motorcycle with a cabin in back for transporting passengers.  This service is very common in the small communities of Peru.  Tito's work enables him to support his family and make daily income.

Tito is requesting a loan for 700 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he will use to repair his motorcycle as it has been experiencing problems lately.  This has decreased the number of hours that Tito can work and therefore his profits.

Tito has a great desire to become independent and form his own household.  He feels that he will achieve this as a result of his effort and hard work.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Safiatou

texts.fr:
Madame Safiatou est une mariée de 43 ans et mère 4 enfants qui réside  avec  son époux dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Kaboïla II, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école pour des raisons sociales, il s’est vite initiée depuis plus de treize ans  aux activités de petit commerce (achat-vente de pagne wax, des tissus brodés, de chaussures, de produits de beauté etc). Elle est beaucoup sollicitée surtout de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement de femmes) pour la qualité de ses produits. Elle reçoit beaucoup de commandes des localités environnantes et son activité marche en merveille et la clientèle est très satisfaite.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ trois ans. Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel, le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
Elle compte acheter avec ce deuxième prêt 15 pièces de pagne wax, 15 complets de tissus brodés, 20 paires de chaussures plastiques, etc. Elle s’approvisionne à Bobo Dioulasso (au Burkina Faso) ensuite elle les revend de façon ambulante à Sikasso et souvent dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 170 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en: Ms. Safiatou is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She resides with her husband in a large, traditional extended families in Kaboïla II, the downtown of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having had the chance to advance in school due to societal reasons, she soon started working in small-scale commerce about thirteen years ago. She buys and sells Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), embroidered fabrics, shoes, beauty products, etc. She is in high demand, especially by her customer base (essentially of women), for the quality of her products. She receives many orders from surrounding towns. Business is booming, and her customers are very satisfied. Concerned about further satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about three years ago. She is now on her second individual loan. The previous one was properly repaid. She intends to spend her second loan on: 15 lengths of Wax pagne cloth, 15 outfits of embroidered fabrics, 20 pairs of plastic footwear, etc. She gets her supplies in Bobo Dioulasso (in the Republic of Burkina Faso) and will sell them door-to-door in Sikasso and often in towns surrounding Sikasso. With this loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 170,000 francs CFA that will essentially be used to increase her working capital, to help cover family expenses, and to pay the interest on the loan.

loans.use: to buy various goods

loans.name: Felibert

texts.en:
Felibert is 32 years-old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Felibert has a pigpen that raises pigs to sell. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy animal feed for the sow pig.

Felibert has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Felibert hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the sow pig.

loans.name: Be Honest Ii Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Be Honest II” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Waterloo, a town near Freetown. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mohamed. Mohamed is age 55; he was born in the northern town of Lunsar. Currently, he is residing in Waterloo together with his wife and nine children. His wife is a businesswoman and two of his children are attending primary school. For many years now, Mohamed has been a businessman. He sells used clothes. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his business inventory.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his business inventory.

loans.name: Pro Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRO FORTALEZA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Candelaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de salchipapas, panadería, venta de carne chancho, venta de guitarras y zampoñas, comedera, venta de café, venta de artefactos.

La señora Candelaria,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja con Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de sus amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de radios desde hace un año atrás, aprendiendo este negocio de su familia. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra aumentar su capital (compra de radios) que comprará por mayor de la calle Uyustus y que posterior a lo venderá en la Plaza 16 de Julio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.

En la fotografia se encuentra una amiga de una de las socias.
texts.en:
The A.C. Pro Fortaleza Community Bank will begin its first loan cycle with Kiva partner Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional office. There are nine members in the group with a board of directors headed by Sra. Candelaria. The members have a variety of businesses: selling hot dogs and fries, bakery, pork butcher, guitar and panpipes sales, cafe, coffee sales, and crafts.

Señora Candelaria says this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer and she joined the institution after being invited by her friends. She’s had a business selling radios for one year and learned the trade from her family.

The loan she is seeking will be used to buy radios at wholesale prices in Uyustus Street, and she will then sell them in the Plaza 16 de Julio. Her job allows her to earn money to support her family; she is single and has two children.

When she was asked what she most likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she enjoys the training program. 

In the photograph a friend of one of the members can also be seen.

loans.use: to buy radios

loans.name: Amos Group

texts.en:
Lisnah and her husband have been running a fried bread business for four years. They sell fried bread from their home and in the surroundings. 

Lisnah has asked for 3,000,000 Indonesian Rupiah to pay for white bread. She and her husband are doing well in this business with the aim to send their five children to school. Lisnah hopes to fulfill her family's daily needs, send her children to school and to someday also open a voucher kiosk.

loans.use: to pay for white bread.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Bernadette has a retail shop where she sells ready to wear clothing, like blouses & t-shirts. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional clothing to sell.

Bernadette is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Bernadette hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ta

texts.en: Ta is 26 years old, and is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a worker, and their income is $4 per day. She has two children, they are twins and are three years old. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $650 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work with her husband. She hopes to have enough money to repair her house, and able to send all of her children to study at least through high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Feliciano de cincuenta y seis años de edad vive con su compañera de vida. El posee una carpintería muy conocida en la localidad donde reside,es una artesano de la madera desde hace mas de 20 años, elabora excelentes muebles y de muy buena calidad por los tipos de calidad de madera usada, como mesa, sillas, sillones entre otros; Feliciano siempre les ofrece el mejor servicio además de los precios más accesibles del mercado, el se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador dispuesto a trabajar duro para lograr sus metas, está dispuesto a sembrar una acción y cochechar un habito, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima, madera de diversa calidad por mayor, pegamento, herramientas entre otros. Feliciano tiene confianza de que con su esfuerzo logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
56-year-old Feliciano lives with his life partner.  He owns a very well-known carpenter's workshop in the town where he lives.  He has been working as a wood craftsman for more than 20 years.  He makes excellent furniture which is very good quality because of the quality of the wood that he uses.  He makes tables, chairs, armchairs, etc.

Feliciano always offers his customers the very best service and some of the most affordable prices on the market.  He is noted as being a hard-working man who is prepared to work hard to achieve his goals.  He is prepared to sow an action and harvest a habit.

Feliciano is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow him to buy raw materials: different qualities of wood (wholesale), adhesive, tools, etc.  Feliciano believes that, through his efforts, he will manage to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy different qualities of wood wholesale, adhesive and tools

loans.name: Ubaydulo

texts.ru: Убайдуло проживает в районе А. Джоми. Ему 48 лет. Он женат. У него 10 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Трое его сыновей находятся в России на заработках. Сам он имеет средне - специальное образование, по специальности он бухгалтер. В этой области он проработал 14 лет. Кроме того у него имеется грузовая машина, на которой он предоставляет услугу жителям района. Еще Убайдуло занимается животноводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 8 лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Ubaydulo lives in the A. Jomi district.  He is 48 years old, married and has 10 children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Three of his sons are in Russia for work.  Ubaydulo has a secondary specialized education and is an accountant.  He spent 14 years working in that field.  Besides this, he owns a truck, which he uses to provide a service to the district residents.  Ubaydulo is also involved in animal husbandry.  He breeds livestock for future sale.  He has been in this business for 8 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Kalemkash's Group

texts.en:
Kalemkash is the treasurer of this group. She is 45 years old. With her husband, she is raising two sons and a daughter. The sons study at university and the daughter is in school. Kalemkash works as a loan officer in the Financial Group “Kompanion.” She also breeds cattle. At the moment she keeps a cow, a bull, and three calves. Her husband helps her in running the business. Kalemkash applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to purchase feed for the cattle. In the future she wishes to build a house for her sons.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase feed for cattle

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. Lourdes has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and rice per kilogram. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and rice. Lourdes has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Lourdes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and rice to sell

loans.name: Alicia Fotunata

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Alicia; es  casada, la socia tiene 46 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos,la socia sigue trabajando en su restaurant,ella prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,ella quiere seguir ampliando y mejorando el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo,carne y verduras y tambien para implementar el restaurant comprando ollas y sartenes.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en: Alicia, 46, is married and has two children.  She continues working in her restaurant.  She prepares breakfasts, lunches and dinners from 9am until 7pm.  She wants to continue expanding and improving the restaurant.  She’s asking for a loan to buy ingredients to cook like chicken, meat and vegetables and also to buy restaurant equipment like pots and pans.  She is very grateful for the loan and commits to make her payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her meals and also to buy equipment, like pots and pans, for the restaurant.

loans.name: Félix  Serafín

texts.es: Félix  Serafín es una persona increíble, habita en casa propia y con muchos esfuerzos y con la ayuda de Dios ha logrado salir adelante. Él realiza reparaciones electrónicas desde hace muchos años. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que trabaja duramente para siempre estar un paso delante de la competencia y seguir manteniendo su negocio activo. Félix es un hombre carismático, trabajador y emprendedor. Para él lo más importante es que sus clientes estén satisfechos con el trabajo que realiza por lo que cada día se levanta muy temprano para hacer todas las reparaciones posibles con suma delicadeza de tal manera que los clientes no encuentren razón para estar insatisfechos. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar herramientas que le permitan hacer más fácil el trabajo tales como: alambre, cajas térmicas, dados térmicos, etc. de esta manera espera mejorar su situación económica y poder aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Félix Serafín is an incredible person.  He lives in his own home and, with a lot of effort and God's help, he has managed to get ahead in life.  He has been providing electronics repairs for many years.  This business is his main source of income and he works hard so that he can always remain one step ahead of the competition and continue keeping his business active.

Félix is a charismatic, hard-working and entrepreneurial man.  The most important thing, as far as he is concerned, is for his customers to be satisfied with the work that he does.  For this reason, he gets up very early every day to make as many repairs as he can, with extreme delicacy, so that his customers can find no reason to be dissatisfied.  He has taken the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL to buy tools that allow him to do his work more easily such as wire, thermal protection devices, circuit breakers etc.  In this way, he hopes to improve his financial situation and aspire to a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wire, thermal protection devices, circuit breakers, etc.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa sigue participando en el banco comunal “Ricchary  Runa” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, Carmen Rosa sigue dedicándose a brindar servicio de sastrería en unos de los centros comercial más populares de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

Carmen Rosa paga puntual sus cuotas no tuvo ningún problema con el anterior crédito sino al contrario le fue muy bien.   

Carmen Rosa requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de sastrería como por ejemplo telas, hilos y otras cosas más.
 
Carmen Rosa se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa continues participating in the “Ricchary Runa” communal bank of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  She also continues working as a tailor in one of the most popular shopping centers in Cusco. She has worked in this business for several years and she is doing very well.

Carmen Rosa makes her payments on time and had no problems with a previous loan. In fact, that loan was promptly and fully repaid.

Carmen Rosa needs a new loan to buy tailoring material such as fabric, thread and other items. She is grateful for the opportunity provided in this way and is committed to making all of her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy tailoring material such as fabric, thread and other items.

loans.name: Miriam Adriana

texts.es:
La Señora. Miriam es socia del banco del banco comunal El Control, vive por una comunidad que pertenece a la parroquia de Turi en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta parroquia es conocida como el mirador de la ciudad de donde se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Doña Miriam tiene 23 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 6, 4 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que vive es  propiedad de un familiar. 

La Señora Miriam se dedica a la cría y venta cerdos, cuyes y pollos, también trabaja labrando la tierra y lavando ropa ajena.

Este es su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y  alimento para los mismos.
 
Su meta es construir su casa.
texts.en:
Miriam is a member of El Control Communal Bank.  She lives in a community in the parish of Turi in the city of Cuenca.  This parish is known as the viewpoint from where you can observe a large part of the city.  The people there work in agriculture and raising animals, and preserve the culture and traditions of their parents.

Miriam is 23 years old and married, and from her marriage has three children, ages 6, 4, and 2.  Her two oldest children study in a school in the city.  Her husband works as a building worker.  The house they live in belongs to a relative.

Miriam works raising and selling pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens.  She also works farming the land and washing clothes for people.

This is her third loan with the communal bank and she is going to invest it in buying pigs and feed for them.

Her goal is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Philomene

texts.en:
Philomene is 45 years old and is married. She has five children, aged between 7 and 31 years old. She takes care of one dependent who is 12 years old. Philomene sells various goods such as: colgate, lotions, pens, etc. Her business is well known and well organized and she has 12 years of experience in this business. She currently employs six people to help her and she works from 6am to 7pm daily, all week except on Saturday. 

Philomene has requested her loan from Kiva, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase various goods such as: Colgate, lotions, pens, etc to sell. With any profits, Philomene will be able to save money for her future, reinvest in her business and she will be able to pay children school fees.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as: colgate, lotions, pens, etc to sell.

loans.name: Vutha

texts.en:
Vutha (in the photo), age 32, is a scarf weaver. Her husband, Nen, age 36, is a farmer. They have been married since 2008 and have no children yet. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Vutha is requesting her first loan in the amount of $400 to help fund capital for her her husband to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain his tomato and eggplant farm.

loans.use: To help fund capital for her husband to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Raki

texts.fr: Madame Raki  vit au Sénégal et est âgée  de 61 ans. Elle est veuve et s’active dans le commerce de thioubs, friperie  et encens. Elle a une expérience de plus de 20 ans dans son activité. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou elle habite depuis février 2004. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits qu’elle commercialise. Elle envisage de redémarrer  son activité  qui avait connu un arrêt  suite à la maladie de son mari qui est finalement décédé. Son objectif est de développer son commerce pour acquérir des revenus qui l’aideront  a obtenir un épanouissement sur le plan social, matériel et financier.
texts.en: Raki lives in Senegal and is 61 years old. She is a widow and has an activity trading in "thioubs" (pieces of specially tinted fabric), second-hand clothing  and incense. She has more than 20 years experience in her business. She is a member of a U-IMCEC branch in the town where she has lived since February 2004. She is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs, which will be used to buy the products that she sells. She is planning to restart her business which came to a halt as a result of her husband being ill and finally dying. Her aim is to develop her busness in order to acquire sufficient income to bring her personal fulfilment not only socially but also materially and financially.

loans.use: to buy "thioubs", second-hand clothing and incense for resale

loans.name: 04.07.8 Nam Ngạn Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase pork to resell.

Thủy is 41 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a six-member group, the 8 Nam Ngạn solidarity group. Thủy lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thủy has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thủy has been involved in her business for five years. The main hardship that Thủy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase pork to resell.

loans.name: Lesina

texts.en:
Lesina is thirty-six years of age and is married with four children. She sells a variety of different products to the local community and has five years of experience doing so. 

Lesina joined SPBD to gain access to its financial services. (Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.) This is her third loan with SPBD.

Lesina needs a loan of 2,000 WST to purchase freezer goods or meat such as mutton flaps, chicken, and sausages to sell. She plans to use the profits which are estimated to be 600 talas per week to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase freezer goods or meat such as mutton flaps, chicken, sausages to sell.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en: Ly is 52 years old and a villager from Battambang province.  She deals with the financial burden in her family via rice farming and her paid-working.	Nowadays, she can earn for almost 33,000 KHR per day. Now, she is shortage of working capital to support her crop. Therefore she teams a group of two to get a new loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farm. She also hopes that her farm will get better so her family have more income too.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Racheal's Group

texts.en:
Rechel is 67 years old and has 6 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group made up of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Rechel has been farming with One Acre Fund for several years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to access the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. And, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have an even better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Rechel also decided to purchase a solar light with part of her loan, which she is very excited about as this will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Rechel's Group will be able to receive a total of 5 solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5 acres.

loans.use: to buy a solar light and access cost-efficient maize seed and fertilizer for the coming planting season.

loans.name: Koern

texts.en:
Koern is a 47-year-old and married father with four children. To make a living, he has been farming rice and working as a paid worker. She is able to earn about 40,000KHR per day, but he can manage to earn around 20,000KHR each day after daily expenses. 

This is Koern’s first loan with VisionFund. Now he is seeking a loan to buy a solar lighting for using in his house. He hopes that this loan will enable him to have enough electricity using in his house.

loans.use: to buy a solar lighting for using in his house

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Mónica S., 39 years old, was born in the province of Manabi. She is married with 2 children that are in school. The bakery which is located downstairs from her house is in a part of town where there is not an overabundance of bakeries. Also, the business lies along a main thoroughfare, so plenty of traffic passes by their store. From 6am until 10pm Monica and her husband sell bread and other bakery items. They know how to run their business efficiently, but they lack the capital to expand.

loans.use: Monica and her husband, who helps the run the bakery, would like to use the $600 to be able to buy ingredients including flour, sugar, butter, and oil. Both she and her hasband run the business, while one of them typically handles the finances. They would like lenders to know they are excited.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Born in 1984 in Aného, Miss Jeanne S. inherited her mother's small business. Currently, she is in her final year of high school and lives with her parents. Highly gifted and blessed with know-how, she runs her business and pursues her studies simultaneously. For the needs of her business, Miss Jeanne S. goes to Lomé every weekend to obtain supplies. She runs her small business by selling these supplies to her classmates and other students at her school.

Today, Miss Jeanne S. has found a young woman who would like to join her in opening a kiosk selling supplies. She is asking for $450 in financial support to open this kiosk. The benefits of such a business will allow Miss Jeanne S. to take charge of and suitably carry through her studies.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1984 à Aného, Mlle S. Jeanne a hérité le petit commerce de sa mère. Actuellement, elle est élève en classe de terminale et vit avec ses parents. Très douée et avec son savoir faire, elle exerce simultanément le commerce et continue les études . Pour les besoins de son activité, Mlle S. Jeanne se rend chaque fin de semaine à Lomé pour s’approvisionner. C’est un petit commerce qu’elle tient, car elle se permet de fournir ses produits à ses camarades de classe et autres élèves de son établissement.

Aujourd’hui, Mlle S. a trouvé une jeune demoiselle qui voudrait s’associer à elle pour ouvrir un kiosque pour la vente des fournitures. Elle sollicite un appui financier de $450 pour ouvrir un kiosque .Les bénéfices d’une telle activité permettra à Mlle S. Jeanne de se prendre en charge et d’effectuer convenablement ses études.

loans.use: To open a kiosk selling school supplies

loans.name: Antonia Guadalupe

texts.en:
Antonia is married and for seven years she has sold groceries. She began her business in order to help with household expenses and with a lot of hard work she has managed to run her business for a long time, and she also has her husband's help in his spare time. They would like to buy their own home and to have an inheritance they can pass down to their future children, which is why they have worked so hard to make their business a success.

At this time, Antonia and her husband wish to expand their business in order to increase their earnings, but to do this, they need a loan of $375.00 which they will use to buy shelves and merchandise in order to have a wider variety of products to offer to their customers. You can be an important part of Antonia and her husband's lives,please choose to help them, they sincerely appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Antonia es casada y desde hace siete años se dedica a las ventas de abarrotes, inició este negocio para ayudar con los gastos de su hogar y con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado mantenerlo por tanto tiempo, recibe la ayuda de su esposo en su tiempo libre. Ellos quieren poder comprar su casa propia, para tener un patrimonio que ofrecerles a sus futuros hijos, por lo que han trabajado arduamente en su tienda. Ahora Antonia y su esposo quieren hacer crecer su negocio para poder obtener mayores beneficios, por lo que necesitan de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 375 dólares que utilizaran en la compra de estantes y de mercancía para poder ofrecer una mayor variedad y permanecer en la preferencia de sus clientes. Tú puedes ser parte importante en la vida de Antonia y su familia, decídete a apoyarlos, ella agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: To purchase shelves and merchandise.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is a farmer who has worked in agriculture for over 10 years with his parents. He has been able to be successful farming rice which is the main crop in the area because of its fertility and investment price. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides that will help cultivate the rice that he has already planted. He also hopes to put in a new patch of rice.

Willy is 20 years old and has not yet had children. He hopes to start his family when he feels more secure about his future and has constructed a home out of cement. His goal is to accumulate profits and begin to purchase land so his business may continue to grow.

loans.use: Farm Rice

loans.name: Muyssar

texts.ru:
Muyssar B. is 34 years old. She is divorced and has 1 daughter. She has graduated from high school. She alone has to take care of her family. Her business is sale of women's clothing and shoes. She has been in retail business for 9 years.

In 2006, she took her first loan from MicroInvest. The loan was for $150 while her savings were $300. She used the loan to expand her business and add more different varieties of women's clothing and shoes to her assortment. Currently, her sales are $1,300. In the future, Muyssar plans to acquire a second retail location.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

Бобочонова Муяссар – 34года. Разведенная, имеет одну дочь. Образование среднее. Все заботы о семье лежат на её плечах. Она занимается продажей женской одежды и обуви, вот уже 9лет. Начала свою деятельность с продажи женской одежды. В 2006 году начала кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест» с 150$, тогда её активы составляли 300$. После получения займа и целевого использования она расширила товарооборот, добавила в свой ассортимент женскую обувь. Сейчас её товарооборот возрос до 1300$. В будущем планирует приобрести ещё одну торговую точку.

loans.use: To open a second retail location

loans.name: Matias

texts.pt:
Matias is not married, but he lives with the mother of his 3 children. He works for the Provincial Command of the Police of the Republic of Mozambique. He started the loan program with FDM just this year. His first loan was $125. Because his business is running smoothly, he is now requesting a $250 loan to increase and diversify the inventory in his small tobacco shop. His children study and his wife looks after the shop.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Matias e solteiro mas vive com uma mulher com quem tem 3 filhos. Ele e trabalhador do Comando Provincial da Policia da Republica de Mocambique. Ele entrou para o programa de credito do Fundo de Desenvolvimento da Mulher ainda este ano. inicialmente ele tomou $125 para investir no negocio. Porque o negocio esta a correr bem agora ele tomara $250 para aumentar e diversificar os artigos a meter na sua pequena tabacaria.Os filhos de Matias estudam. Quem toma conta do negocio e a sua esposa.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his tobacco shop.

loans.name: Mohammad Zahar

texts.en: Mohammad Zahar lives in district 7 of Kabul Afghanistan and is married with four children: two sons and two daughters. His daughters are at University and his sons are no longer in Afghanistan so he is the only one supporting his family.  Mohammad operates a retail shop in one of the more crowded areas of Kabul. He would like to expand his business so he is requesting a loan in order to have a better range of stock to attract more clients. This loan will help him earn more income to help his family and this would make him happy.

loans.use: To purchase more comprehensive goods for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her product diversity and offerings

loans.name: Eva Mercedes

texts.es:
Mrs. Eva H. is a woman worthy if emulation. Seven years ago she started her business selling cough drops, chewing gum, cookies and cigarettes outside the Terminal market in Leon. Despite the difficult circumstances she has been going through for a long time, she decided to apply for a sales stall inside the market and persevered until she had successfully acquired one. She has been fighting for years to support her two small children and give them all the support she can for their educations.

It's extremely important to point out that during the past 3 years, Eva has received 64 loans from Ceprodel, and has known how to very wisely take advantage of investment in her business. As a result, her sales have increased and her earnings, as well. Her greatest wish is that her children finish school and go on to graduate from college.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Eva H. es una mujer digna de imitar, desde hace 7 años inició su negocio de venta de bisuterías (pastillas, chicles, galletas, cigarrillos, etc.) en las afueras del mercado la Terminal en León. Sin embargo a pesar de las difíciles circunstancias que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado, decide solicitar un local en el interior del mercado hasta obtenerlo. Ha venido luchando por muchos años para mantener a sus dos pequeños hijos y brindarle todo su apoyo en sus estudios.

Es de muchísima importancia destacar que desde hace tres años, ha obtenido con Ceprodel 64 créditos que los ha sabido aprovechar sabiamente en la inversión de su negocio por lo que ha aumentado sus ventas y por ende sus utilidades. Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos se preparen y coronen una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Purchase the snack items she sells

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 47 years old. She is married and has three children who are 22, 23, and 19 years old. Flora has been a member of the “Chontaca” community bank for one year. She likes the community bank because the process is less complicated than at other banks. Since joining the bank, she has learned to work efficiently and to save.

Flora owns a bakery where she makes a variety of traditional sweet breads. She has owned her bakery for six months, but has been making bread for much longer.

Flora needs a loan of 1500 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy flour in bulk, as well as eggs, sugar, and yeast.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Flora plans to use has savings to further develop her business. Her dream is to eventually own a home and to open a second store.

loans.use: Flora needs a loan of 1500 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy flour in bulk as well as eggs, sugar, and yeast.

loans.name: Noreyba Altagracia

texts.en:
Noreyba lives in the Río Arriba community of Baní where she runs a small business selling pants to men and women. Noreyba is forty years old and mother of seven children, four of whom still live with her. She explains that a large family is hard to keep up, but she says she’d move heaven and earth to provide food and good education for them.

The entrepreneur wants to enlarge her business. She plans on using her loan to buy a collection of fashionable shirts to add to her stock. Noreyba wants to work better and increase her income for the sake of her family.

loans.use: To invest a collection of shirts to add to her stock

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 32 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her children are 14, 7, and 3. Asha sells charcoal, and began in 2006. She works everyday from 6 AM to 8 PM, and earns around $230 a month from her sales.

Asha would like a loan to increase the charcoal she purchases to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Thi Tinh

texts.vi:
Ms V. thi Tinh (MS13050013) is thirty four year old. She has two children, one is still in school and the other already is working. They laboriously work in the fields, raise hogs, and sell pork to the villagers. They also support her sister-in-law (her husband’s older sister) who is single and who lives with them. The latter, due to weak vision cannot support herself. She requests a loan of $ $VN2.006.000 to buy feeds. Ms. Nghiem thi Hanh (MS 13050014) is twenty seven years old. She requests a loan of $VN.2.600.000 to buy and sell scraps. Ms. To thi Xinh (MS 13050015) is thirty-two year old. She requests a loan of $VN.2.006.000 to start a business in straw mats. Ms. Bui thi.Lam (MS 13050016) is forty-year old. She requests a loan of $VN.2.006.000 to buy rice to start a business in rice paper. Ms. V. thi Hien (MS 13050017) is thirty-four year old. She requests a loan of $VN.2.006.000 to buy rice to start of business in rice noodle. Ms. Bui thi Thanh (MS) is twenty-five year old. She requests a loan of $VN.2.006.000 to buy breed hogs. Ms. To thi Lan (MS) is thirty-three year old. She requests a loan of $VN.2.006.000 to start a fruit and vegetable stand in the local market.

Translated from Vietnamese by a Kiva volunteer Chị Vũ Thị Tình (MS:13050013), năm nay 34 tuổi. Chị có hai con, một con chị đã đi làm, còn một con chị hiện còn đang đi học. Gia đình chị rất chăm chỉ : làm ruộng, nuôi lợn. và bán thịt lợn cho dân trong thôn. Ngoài việc chăm sóc các con, anh chị còn chăm sóc người chị của chồng không lập gia đình, mắt kém không có khả năng tự nuôi sống bản thân. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để thêm vốn mua thịt lợn bán, và mua cám lợn Chị Nghiêm Thị Hạnh (MS: 13050014), năm nay 27 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn đi buôn bán phế liệu. Chị Tô Thị Xinh (MS: 13050015), năm nay 32 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để đi mua chiếu về bán. Chị Bùi Thị Lam (MS: 13050016), năm nay 40 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND mua gạo làm bánh đa nem. Chị Vũ Thị Hiền (MS: 13050017), năm nay 34 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua gạo làm mì. Chị Bùi Thị Thành (MS: ), năm nay 25 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua lợn giống. Chị Tô Thị Lan (MS: ), năm nay 33 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để buôn bán hoa quả ở chợ.

loans.use: Chăn nuôi và buôn bán

loans.name: Saturnina's Group

texts.es:
Saturnina, Dina and Nicolaza are members of the Sumacc Huayta communal bank, which means "beautiful flower" in Quechua.

Saturnina is single and 26 years old and studied tailoring. Saturnina sells CDs from a stand in the Nery García market; she buys her products in Lima.

Dina is a single mother, 27 years old and has 1 son. Dina sells a variety of clothing on credit to friends and family.

Nicolaza is a widow, 77 years old and has 10 children, 5 of whom live with her. Nicolaza does beautiful handiwork, such as weavings and embroidery and has a few women who help her with this. She sells her work to intermediaries.

Saturnina, Dina and Nicolaza need loans for 1000, 600 and 750 soles respectively, money which will be invested in purchasing CDs, stockings, lingerie, corsets and a variety of wool.

Saturnina, Dina and Nicolaza dreams include: producing greater quantities, having a dressmaking workshop, and having their own store.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Saturnina, Dina y Nicolaza son socias D. Banco Comunal Sumacc Huayta que significa Bella Flor en quechua.

Saturnina es soltera y tiene 26 años, estudio corte y confección, Saturnina vende CDS en un puesto D. mercado Nery García, sus productos los compra en la ciudad de Lima.

Por otro lado Dina es madre soltera, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Dina vende ropa variada, sus ventas los realiza al crédito a amigos y familiares.

Mientras que Nicolaza es viuda, tiene 77 años y 10 hijos de los cuales solo 5 viven con ella, Nicolaza realiza bellos trabajos artesanales, como tejidos y bordados, para lo cual cuenta con mujeres que le ayudan, sus productos los vende a intermediarios.

Saturnina, Dina y Nicolaza necesitan un préstamo de 1000 soles, 600 soles, 750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de discos, medias, ropas interiores, fajas y lanas variadas.

Los sueños de Saturnina, Dina y Nicolaza son producir en mayor cantidad, tener un taller de confección de prendas de vestir, una tienda propia y estable.

loans.use: Invest in CDs, stockings, lingerie, corsets and a variety of wool.

loans.name: Ovidio

texts.es:
Ovidio works in agriculture. For this, he leaves his home to head for his distant farmlands that he must care for and fertilize at certain times. His wife (in the photograph) tells us that, beyond the hard work Ovidio does for the good of his family, she feels that her husband tries to help her and to be a suitable help to her so that she gets ahead with her plans, like their family. They are asking for a loan to purchase fertilize with the goal that, in the coming harvest, they will have quality and profitable products. Both hope that you can meet their request for the good of their agricultural production.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ovidio es un hombre dedicado a la agricultura, por ello se ausenta de su hogar para ir rumbo a sus alejados terrenos de cultivos los cuales tiene que cuidar, abonar y fertilizar cada cierto tiempo. Su esposa (en la foto) nos comenta sobre la ardua labor que Ovidio realiza por el bien de su familia, siendo ella su pareja trata de ayudarlo y ser su ayuda idónea para seguir adelante en sus proyecciones como familia. Ellos están solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abonos con el fin de que en la venidera cosecha obtenga productos de calidad y altamente rentables.Ambos esperan que usted pueda atender a su solicitud en bien de su producción agrícola.

loans.use: Purchase Fertilizer for his Farmland

loans.name: Savriniso

texts.ru: Раджабова Савриниссо проживает в городе Яван. Разведена , имеет пятерых детей. Сразу после развода занялась бизнесом. Торгует на рынке «Мехргон» тканями. Опыт в данном деле уже 16 лет.Обратилась к нам за кредитом в размере 1200 долларов США для того , чтобы завезти товар. Обновление товара связано с приходом нового сезона. Не смотря на тяжелые условия она смогла выйти из трудностей и наладила свой бизнес , благодоря терпению и выносливости.Кроме того товар , продаваемый ею пользуется большим спросом , так как национальная одежда шьется именно из этих тканей. Погасить кредит она сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Savriniso R. lives in Yavan. She is divorced and has 5 children. Savriniso started her business right after her divorce. She sells fabrics at the “Mehrgon” market and has 16 years of experience in this area. She turned to us for a $1200 loan in order to purchase additional products for sale. Savriniso needs new products due to the start of a new season.

Despite difficult circumstances Savriniso was able to overcome challenge and to build her business via patience and endurance. In addition, Savriniso’s products are in high demand as they are used to make national costumes. Savriniso will pay back her loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new products for sale

loans.name: Hamis Hussein's Jenga Grp Group

texts.en:
Hamis H., 32, is married with an 8-year-old daughter. He started a business eight years ago selling glass. His store is in an area known as Tabata. He works daily from 8:30 a.m. until 5 p.m. and earns a monthly profit of about $174.

Hamis has previously taken five loans from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the loans to purchase land, build a house and increase the stock of his shop. With the loan he hopes to receive now, he plans to open a second glass shop in an area called Kariakoo, which is in the city center.

Hamis is the leader of Jenga group (meaning "build" in Swahili), which has 25 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Hamis is in the front row, second from the right in a blue shirt.

loans.use: To open a second glass shop in Kariakoo.

loans.name: Alexa Doris

texts.es:
La señora Alexa Doris pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Bellavista. Se dedica a la venta de jugos de frutas naturales, sándwiches y refrigerios. El negocio lo realiza en un lugar muy concurrido llamado Brisas del Huallaga, lugar donde espera a sus clientes para atenderlos con mucha amabilidad.
 
Con este crédito de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de frutas para la preparación de los jugos como papaya, naranja, manzana, guineos, maracuyá, betarraga, azúcar en saco, así como panes, huevo, jamón y queso. También comprará vasos descartables, servilletas, sorbetes, entre otros, para poder dar una buena atención a sus clientes.

La señora Alexa Doris tiene 30 años de edad, es una mujer muy optimista, y sobre todo muy trabajadora. Le gusta el negocio, el cual desea ampliar más adelante, colocando más mesas, y de esa manera dar una buena atención a los clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Alexa Doris belongs to the community bank "Virgen del Rosario" and lives in the region San Martín, province and district of Bellavista. She is dedicated to selling natural fruit juices, sandwiches, and snacks. The business is conducted in a popular place called Brisas del Huallaga, a place where she waits for her clients to take care of them with lots of friendliness. With this loan of 1000 Soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will invest in purchasing fruits for the preparation of juices like papaya, orange, banana, passion fruit, beets, and sugar, and also bread, eggs, ham, and cheese for sandwiches. She will also buy disposable cups, napkins, among other things, to be able to offer good service to her clients. Señora Alexa Doris is 30 years old, a very optimistic woman, and above all a hard worker. She likes the business, which she wants to make bigger by acquiring more tables, and in this way offer better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruits like papaya, orange, apple, etc. Also disposable cups, napkins, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Elizabeth G. from Mwanza, a beautiful city on the shores of Lake Victoria. (Lake Victoria is famous not only for being one of the largest lakes in the world, but also because it feeds the Nile River, a very important source of life for Africa.)

Elizabeth is married and has one child who is 3 years old. She has been running a maize business since 2005. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day and is assisted by her husband. Elizabeth currently earns about US$10 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase maize in bulk. Elizabeth thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase maize in bulk

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Monsieur G. Koffi est né à atchanvé dans la préfecture de Zio. Il est divorcé de sa femme ANGLO Adjo avec laquelle il a eu un (01) enfant, il habite dans le quartier d’Agoè Kitidjan. Il fait le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale et s’approvisionne au marché d’Agoè Atchanvé pour revendre son stock en détail à ses clients d’Agoè Atchanvé.
Monsieur G. n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES, il demande un prêt pour pouvoir satisfaire la demande augmentée surtout en ces périodes de fêtes de fin d’année. Avec ce prêt il va acheter 20 sacs de riz GINO, 4 bidons d’huile et 9 paquets de sucre.
texts.en:
Mr. Koffi G., born in Atchanvé in Zio Prefecture, is divorced from his wife Adjo ANGLO with whom he had one child. He lives in the Agoè Kitidjan district and does commerce in grocery items. His supplies come from the Agoè Atchanvé marketplace and are sold retail to customers of that area. Having never been the recipient of a WAGES loan, he is requesting a loan to satisfy the increased demand, especially during this year-end holiday season. With this loan, he is going to buy 20 sacks of GINO rice, 4 drums of oil, and 9 packets of sugar.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in food items

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. is married and has a child. She has received junior high education. Since 2004, she has been selling groceries like biscuits, canned products, and other items at Intarbeton, Cape Coast. Esther uses her income to support her husband in paying utility bills and covering other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to buy additional groceries to meet the increasing demand by her costumers. She hopes to use the extra profit to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries for sale

loans.name: Zoila Del Socorro

texts.es:
La microempresaria Zoila del Socorro E. tiene 36 años de edad, es  madre soltera de 5 hijos de los cuales 3 estudian y 2 son menores de edad, desde hace 20 años se dedica a la actividad de costura haciendo principalmente lo que son uniformes de estudiantes y de algunas instituciones como la policía nacional.

Con esta profesión la señora E. a podido sufragar los gastos de alimentación y educación para sus hijos ya que su marido los abandono desde hace varios años viajando fuera del país.

Esta actividad la microempresaria Zoila la realiza comprando la tela y entregando la prenda de vestir terminada, para tal fin ella no cuenta con un capital suficiente para la demanda actual que tiene de pedidos, por tal razon esta solicitando se le financie para comprar los siguientes materiales:

80 Yardas de tela Sincatex la cual compra a US$ 3 dólares cada yarda, 80 yardas de tela gabardina Strech la cual compra a US$ 1.50 dólares cada yarda, 50 yardas de tela Dacron Tico la cual compra a US$ 1.40 dólares cada yarda y 50 yardas de tela burbuja (colores variados) la cual compra a US$ 1.40 dólares cada yarda.
texts.en:
The small-business woman Zoila del Socorro E. is 36 years old and is the single mother of 5 children. Of her 5 children, 3 are students and 2 are younger in age. For 20 years, she had dedicated to the work of sewing, making mainly student uniforms and some institutional uniforms such as the national police. With this profession, Ms. E. has been able to provide food and education for her children since her husband abandoned them many years ago, traveling outside the country. Her job involves buying fabric and turning in the finished clothing garment. She doesn't end with enough capital for the actual pending demand. For this reason, she's asking for a loan to buy the following materials: 80 yards of Sincatex fabric which can be bought at $3 per yard, 80 yards of stretch raincoat fabric which can be bought at $1.50 per yard, 50 yards of Dacron Tico fabric which can be bought at $1.40 per yard and 50 yards of fabric in a variety of colors which can be bought at $1.40 per yard.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 80 yards of Sincatex fabric, 80 yards de stretch fabric, 50 yards of Dacron Tico fabric and 50 yards of fabric in a variety of colors.

loans.name: Rakhila

texts.en: Rakhila B. is a 53-year-old teacher who breeds calves for meat production in the small village of Imishli City. She is married and has three children who are studying at the university and at school. Rakhila needs $1200 to purchase two calves to improve the life conditions of her family. She will be grateful for your help.

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es:
S. D. P. NORMA ISABEL, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Almendras” con domicilio en el Jr. 29 D. Mayo Mz. 206 Lt. 25  del distrito D. Calería, tiene 62 años, 04 hijos, y su cónyuge se dedica a la agricultura y pesca.

El primer préstamo fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, y empezó a comprar productos que provienen D. la chacra y a revenderlos, y también empezó a vender en las mañanas mazamorra D. maíz con maní, plátano y leche.

Con el préstamo D. S/.1,200. Nuevos Soles, se invertirá en la compra D. maíz, maní, plátano, también comprará trampas para pescar y vender pescado en el mercado La Hoyada.

Se encuentra muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos ya que tiene préstamos a mujeres D. acuerdo a sus necesidades, y si una socia quiere sacar más le dan y si quiere poco también le dan.
texts.en:
Norma Isabel S. D. P. belongs to the communal bank, "Las Almendras." She is 62 and has 4 children. Her husband works in farming and fishing. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, and she started to purchase products from the farm to resell them. In the mornings, she also started to sell a corn pudding along with peanuts, plantains, and milk. With this loan of 1,200 nuevos soles, she will invest in the purchase of corn, peanuts, and plantains, and she will also buy traps for fish and sell the fish in La Hoyada market. She is very thankful to Manuela Ramos since they loan to women in accordance with their needs. If a member wants to receive either more or less, they give it to her.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer
