loans.use: To purchase corn, peanuts, and plantains.  To purchase traps to fish with and sell the fish in La Hoyada market.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret A. is a 24-year-old mother of two children ages 9 and 1. The older child is currently in school and Margaret plans on sending her youngest when ready.  She works as a tailor while her husband sells shoes, both in the Nyamasaria slum where they live and work. She is requesting 10,000 KSH which she will use to expand her business, purchase livestock and poultry to increase her food security. In her free time, she takes care of the poultry she currently owns.

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena N. is divorced and has five children. She is a trader in Accra selling, primarily, plantains to her customers. She is a fairly new businesswoman having started her enterprise in 2006. Abena uses her income to pay for the utilities and bills and feeding her family.

Abena will use the loan to purchase more plantains to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to increase her capital which will further increase her profits.

loans.use: To purchase more plantains to sell

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Eusebia tiene 48 años, es una mujer muy alegre y segura de sí misma, vive en su propia casa la cual con mucho esfuerzo logró construir, desea mejorar su vida y tener una vejez digna. El servicio que brinda Eusebia a sus clientes es de mucha utilidad para su barrio, puesto que se encuentra en el negocio de los locutorios y la mayoría de sus clientes utilizan sus teléfonos para realizar llamadas urgentes y de suma importancia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y tratarlos bien, pero lo que menos le gusta es permanecer todo el día dentro de su locutorio sin poder salir a ningún lugar. Lleva 4 años en esta actividad y espera más adelante hacer crecer su negocio y tener más cabinas, las cuales le brinden un mejor ingreso económico y así pueda salir adelante. Eusebia se encuentra en su primer préstamo con MFP y está muy feliz de haberlo obtenido, por ello está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy solidaria con el resto de socias. Con los 1000 soles mejorará los muebles de su locutorio, además pondrá más cabinas para atender a más clientes.
texts.en:
Eusebia is 48-years old and is a very happy and self-assured woman. She lives in her own proper house which took much effort to construct. She desires to have a better life and wants to grow old with dignity.

The service Eusebia offers her clients provides much utility for her neighborhood as it is a phone booth call center. The majority of her clients utilize her phones to make urgent calls of vital importance. The part of her job that she enjoys the most is conversing with her clients and treating them well, but what she likes least is having to be in the call center all day without a break. It’s been 4-years that she’s been at this business and she expects to expand the business with more cabins, which will bring in more profits and cause her business to succeed.

This is Eusebia’s first loan with MFP and she is very happy to obtain it and she is willing to pay it on time. Her community bank is very supportive of its members and with this 1000 soles she will improve her call center’s furniture and build out more cabins to serve more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve the furniture at her business

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Mrs. Elisa S., is a resident of Gampis, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 52 years old and married and has 5 children. Her main source of income is a "sari-sari" store (mini grocery store) in good status. Her husband is engaged in the fishing business; it serves as their other source of income.

The income from these businesses is the one that sustains the education of her children and their family needs. Though her business is in good status, due to financial crisis they have encountered now, she has limited stocks and cannot cope with the needs of her customer. She decided to come into Paglaum MPC to borrow money to support her business as additional capital. And through this, she can only make her business more profitable and can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: Additional capital for her mini grocery store

loans.name: Anarkul Saypidinova’S Group

texts.en:
Anarkul S. is the leader of a group of four people. She lives in the small village of Kochkor in the very heart of Kyrgyzstan and she needs the loan to purchase livestock, which is her family's essential source of income and livelihood. By purchasing cows and several rams, she hopes to increase her income. She plans to sell their milk, meat, and wool at the local market. With the money from selling the products of her livestock, she hopes to buy necessities for her family. 

Anarkul has three sons and two very sweet daughters. Her husband is a teacher at the local technical school. Because Anarkul has a large family, she works hard to feed and raise her children.

The other three members of Anarkul’s loan group are also occupied with livestock breeding. Mostly they breed sheep, cows, hens and geese. Kulsayra, Halisa, and Kulkayir are married and have children, most of whom are graduating from primary and secondary schools this year and need to continue their education. All the women hope to increase their family budget by selling the livestock products so they can pay for their children’s education. 

They say that “no matter that will happen tomorrow in the world, they will be always protected, because the livestock is their only hope and support.”

loans.use: To buy livestock to increase her family's income

loans.name: Malumalusa

texts.en: Malumalusa F., 27, is married with 2 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the Elei Printing business.  She sells to the general public 6 days per week.  She has one previous loan with SPBD.   Malumalusa expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala. SPBD loans are Malumalusa’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase fabric materials, fabric paints, glitters, designed stencils, etc.

loans.name: Gulchamol

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Гулчамол – молодая женщина 33 лет, замужем и мать 1-го ребенка. Её муж занимается купле -продажей скота на скотном рынке. А она откармливает крупнорогатый скот дома. Гулчамол помогает мужу в развитии его бизнеса, потому что хочет иметь больше прибыли, чтобы расширять семью, так как в сельских местностях принято рожать больше 3-х детей.  За счет займа они хотят увеличить количество скота и  получить больше прибыли.
texts.en:
Gulchamol is a young 33-year-old woman, who is married and is a mother of 1 child. Her husband is involved in buying and selling livestock at a livestock market. She feeds cattle at home. Gulchamol helps her husband in developing his business because she wants to make bigger profits in order to expand their family. It is expected to have more than 3 children in the rural areas. Gulchamol and her husband want to use this loan to increase their livestock quantity and make bigger profits.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock purchase

loans.name: Dante

texts.en: Dante S. is a 42-year-old entrepreneur from Maricaban, Pasay City. He lives with his wife Anna, 44, and their two children. Dante owns and manages a computer shop catering to Internet surfers, gamers and even students. He has been in this business for eight years and he has six employees. Dante makes P50,000 a month. He enjoys dealing with customers of all ages and from different walks of life. Customer traffic peaks on weekends, he says. Dante joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007 and has since been enjoying many benefits from being a member. He is currently in need of funds to buy computer units for the expansion of his computer center and to upgrade some of his PC units. He applied for a P50,000 loan with CCT to augment his business needs. Dante optimistically claimed that it will not be long before he will be opening his second branch. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To buy new computer units and upgrade older PCs

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Mrs. Sumitra T. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishipati, Lalitpur. Sainbu-Bhaishipati is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

Mrs. Sumitra T. lives in single family with her husband and three children. Her husband, Mr. Rajkumar T., is a farmer. She has two sons and a daughter. Both her sons and daughter are now studying.

Mrs. T. is engaged in selling cow’s milk. Now she already owns one cow and sells the cow’s milk in her neighborhood. In that region, the demand for cow’s milk is increasing constantly. So to meet the demand of the customers, she needs another young milk-giving cow. So she is requesting Rs 20,000.00 to buy a young milk cow.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Jalia

texts.es:
Jalia tiene 41 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus 3 hijos, quienes estudian y la apoyan mucho. Desde hace 3 años tiene una pequeña bodega, la cual implementó en un espacio al frente de su casa; allí vende abarrotes, productos comestibles de primera necesidad y bebidas. Jalia atiende durante todo el día y le va muy bien, debido a encontrarse en una zona muy transitada y concurrida de su localidad. Por ello, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a todos sus clientes y sobre todo, aprender cada día más sobre el comercio. Para el futuro, Jalia desea ampliar su tienda y convertirla en un minimarket donde no falte nada y pueda abastecer a sus clientes con lo necesario.
Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos sus compañeros son puntuales en sus pagos y no le gustaría dejar de trabajar con ellos. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de más productos para seguir incrementando el stock de su bodega.
texts.en:
Jalia is 41 years old and is a single mother. She lives with her 3 children who are in school and who help her out a lot. For the last 3 years, she has had a small store in the space in front of her house. There she sells groceries, basic staples and drinks. Jalia keeps the store open all day and it does very well since it is in a high traffic area. Because of this, what she likes the most about her work is treating her customers well and, above all, learning more each day about running a business. For the future, Jalia would like to enlarge her store and convert it into a minimarket that has everything and that can supply her customers with what they need. This is her 7th loan with MFP. What she likes about her Village Bank is that all of her companions are punctual with their payments and she would like to keep working with them. The loan will be used to purchase more products to continue increasing her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
“Time is Gold, don’t waste it” said Rosalia Q.. She is an industrious housewife of Johnny and they are living in Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. They are blessed with a child, John Carlo, he is already 13 years old and he is now a second year high school student. The couple has a great ambition for their son, thus doing their best to give him his desired profession someday. They promise to support him in all his endeavors. 

Her husband is a government employee in their Provincial Capitol of Nueva Vizcaya  while she manages their poultry raising business. She is borrowing additional business capital from KIva lenders amounting to PHP12, 000 as additional capital to her raise poultry and also to support some of their farming needs. Rosalia loves what she is doing in her business and she hopes to improve it for her family especially in sustaining the financial needs of their child in the pursuit of his studies. She hopes also to generate the sympathy of lenders to her current business.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Vasyl

texts.en:
Vasyl is married. He has two daughters. His family of four lives in a town of Khoost, Western Ukraine. Small towns and villages have little to offer to people in Ukraine. Many have hard time finding a decent paying job and remain unemployed. Vasyl realized he had to find a way to feed his family. This is how he ended up being a small market businessman selling household items in the central marketplace of his home town. Vasyl grew his business a lot in the past 7 years due to his scrupulousness and professional accounting skills. Currently, he has 5,000 Grivnyas of income each month.

Vasyl is requesting a loan of 8,000 Grivnyas to increase his turnover capital and diversify his inventory. He realizes retail household items are always in demand which is why they always sell well. Vasyl is hoping to open additional vending location if his business continues to expand at the same pace.

loans.use: to increase turnover capital

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa I. is now 38 years old. She is happily married to Lenito I., who is 39 years old and currently works as a carpenter. They have several children: Melanie, 18 years old, Mary Anne, 15 years old, Abegail, 14 years old, Lenito Jr., 11 years old, and Nicole, 3 years old. Ma. Luisa and Lenito are distressed because their oldest daughter only has a low level of education due to poverty, which forced Melanie to stop her studies and help her parents to work so that all of her youngest siblings could continue to go to school. She is the oldest so she needs to make sacrifices for her siblings. Now Ma. Luisa doesn’t want this to happen again, so she is striving hard to earn enough income to cover all of their expenses.

Their sources of income are: Lenito I.'s salary and the sewing business that Ma. Luisa I. personally manages. It has been active for 10 years now and is still continuing to grow. When she joined the Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), she always used the loans that she received to improve her business. This time, she will once again buy what she needs to make her business more productive.

Ma. Luisa’s dream is to make it possible for all of her children to complete their studies; to do this, she must make sure that her business grows. Consequently, she hopes that you will lend her money, with which she will buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: purchasing a new sewing machine

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 30 years old and married with a three-year-old daughter. He sells kitchenware, such as thermo flasks, cups, house slippers, and plates. He says he has a good business environment in Machakos because it is in the interior and has few local competitors. He has run his business for three years and makes some extra income growing and selling vegetables. 

He is requesting a loan for Kes. 20,000 to purchase more stock of kitchenware. He hopes to increase his sales and own permanent premises instead of the mobile business he has been operating. He describes himself as very hardworking and a visionary, and he would like to expand his business to create employment for other people in his village.

loans.use: Add stock of kitchenware

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros O. is from the village of Nailon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Milagros owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Milagros joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Milagros is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Sylvester

texts.en:
Sylvester has a grocery store where he sells groceries at retail prices. He sells for long hours to enable him support his home.

He is 43 years old and married with four children. His youngest child is 6 years old. Sylvester’s wife is a trader.

Sylvester has been in this business for a long time. He hopes for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. He says thanks to all who make the loan possible

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anta

texts.en:
Mrs. Anta L., aged 47, is a trader in Bambey, a rural community some 100 km east of Dakar.  UIMCEC opened a branch in the area in July, 2009 to better serve its' rural clients.  Ms. L. is always looking for special items, which can add to a woman's elegance. She is asking for a credit of 100,000 FCFA to purchase bracelets, earrings, loincloths and pearls for her clientele.  She has been active in her trade for twenty years, as her mother also sold women's products. Ms. L. is married and the mother of three children. She is also in charge of another child. This will be her first loan.  

Madame Anta L., agée 47 ans, est une commerçante à Bambey, une communauté rurale environs 100km vers l'est du Dakar.  UIMCEC y a ouvrit une caisse en Juillet 2009 pour mieux servir les clients ruraux.  Madame L. est toujours à la recherche de ce qui fait l'élégance féminine, donc elle sollicite une crédit de 100,000 pour acheter des bracelets, boucles d'oreilles, pagnes et perles aphrodisiaques pour sa clientèle.  Elle pratique le commerce depuis 20 ans, sa maman était aussi dans le commerce de produits féminines.
Madame L. est mariée et mère de trois enfants, et en charge d'une autre.  Le crédit sera le premièr pour elle.

loans.use: To purchase various products for women.

loans.name: Matale Group 2, Lugazi.

texts.en:
A. Christine is a hard-working lady who runs a general store. She is married with four children, all of whom are in secondary or primary school. She also takes care of her other siblings. 

She is able to use her loans to restock her shop with more goods, and it is the profits she makes out of the shop that help her take care of almost all her family needs. She hopes to transform her shop further with a hope to turn it into a wholesale shop, where she will be able to make more profit out of it, for her children’s continued education. Christine needs a loan to be able to restock her shop with more goods.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Doto

texts.en: Doto R. H. is an entrepreneurial woman who is married. She runs a grocery store at Kigamboni district in Dar es Salaam. She sells a variety of soft and alcoholic drinks including soda, juice, drinking water, and beer. She purchases the goods from the wholesalers and retail suppliers and sells to the final consumers. She has been in the business for three years and the business income enables her to meet her family's daily demands and business expansion. She plans to expand her business by buying more goods to meet the market demand. She is requesting a loan of TSH 1,000,000 to buy more goods for her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods.

loans.name: Charito Roxana

texts.es:
Charito es una madre de familia de 26 años de edad que vive junto  su esposo y sus dos hijos de ocho y seis años de edad en el sector Macabi del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace seis meses instaló en su vivienda una bodega en la que ofrece a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite), abarrotes, golosinas y bebidas. Ella nos comenta que inició su negocio en casa de su madre, que queda cerca al colegio del lugar, allí ella vendía golosinas y algunos útiles escolares a los estudiantes y poco a poco fue ahorrando e instalando su negocio.

Charito desea implementar su bodega con la compra de útiles escolares ya que se acerca el inicio de clases en los colegios del país. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería para lograr su objetivo.

Charito es una madre trabajadora y responsable, es muy entregada a su familia y da todo de si para sacarlos adelante. Su mayor anhelo es bridarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad que les garantice un próspero porvenir.
texts.en:
Charito is 26 years old, married, and a mother of two young children, age 6 and 8. She and her family live in Macabi, Paijan, in the province of Ascope, which is part of the La Libertad region. She lives about three hours from the city of Chiclayo. About six months ago, Charito opened a canteen in her home. She sells staples like rice, sugar and oil, as well as snacks and drinks. She started her business in her mother's home, near a school. She sold candy and school supplies while saving up to move her shop. As the school season approaches, Charito wants to add school supplies to her canteen. This is why she has asked for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa. Charito is a hard-working, responsible woman who nothing more than to help her family. She hopes to give her children the kind of education that will ensure them a bright future.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying school supplies

loans.name: Yuliana Elena

texts.es:
Yuliana tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el distrito de Santa Rosa, una zona predominantemente pesquera que se ubica a veinticinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de pasamanería (regalos, juguetes, adornos de cerámica y ropa) en su domicilio desde hace cuatro años, este negocio le está brindando ingresos para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia.

Ella compra la mercadería en la ciudad de Lima y la ofrece a sus vecinos, en algunos casos atiende pedidos. Su negocio goza de muy buena acogida por la calidad de los productos y el buen trato que ofrece, por ello, Yuliana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más adornos de cerámica. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Yuliana es una joven bastante trabajadora y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo con su negocio para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Yuliana is 24 and single. She lives in her parents’ house, which is located in the Santa Rosa district. It is predominantly a fishing area located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has been selling general goods (watches, toys, ceramic decorations, and clothes) in her home for four years. This business is giving her income to pay for personal expenses, and it helps support her family. She buys the merchandise in Lima, and she offers it to her neighbors. In some cases she takes orders. Her business is well-received because of the quality of the products and the good service she offers. Yuliana wishes to expand her business by purchasing more ceramic decorations. To achieve this objective she has seen the need to request, for the first time, a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 1,000 PEN. Yuliana is a very hard-working and responsible young woman. Her greatest desire is to keep growing with her business in order to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ceramic decorations in order to expand her business

loans.name: Mt Magorot Group

texts.en:
Koku D., age 27, is single.  She has had a pharmacy business since 2007.  She works from 8:30 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to earn a monthly profit of about $45.

This will be Koku’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more medicines for the pharmacy and has paid back the loan successfully. She hopes for a new loan to improve on her stock and to pay for the shop rent.

Koku will share this loan with her loan group Mt Magorot, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture,  Koku is in the middle of the front row.

loans.use: To increase stock and to pay rent for the pharmacy shop

loans.name: Sanjsuren

texts.en:
Sanjsuren is 29 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Zavhan province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. They have been living together in their current home for six years. His daughter, Bolor-erdene, is nine years old and attends a local secondary school. His wife operates a sewing business at her home.

Currently, Sanjsuren operates a transportation business with his car. He has been transporting local residents between the provinces with his car and has loyal customers because of his goO. service. In addition, he has been expanding his business and he has been planning to purchase a truck with a capacity of 3.5 tonnes for a trucking business.

He is a very hardworking person and his business is very important to him. He says, “I would like to expand my business and increase my business profit.” Sanjsuren is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~ 352 USD) loan for fuel cost and contribute money to purchase a truck for his business.

loans.use: To purchase fuel and to put towards a new truck

loans.name: Encuentro Con Jesus Group

texts.en:
Sonny is the coordinator of her group 'Encuentro con Jesus' (Encounter with Jesus), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial area north of the capital where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her longterm partner and their child.

Sonny is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing as well as other assorted items by purchasing clothing, shoes, pasta and soap to sell to her customers. She will use the profits in finishing her education as well as saving money for the future of her child and future children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Clothing, shoes, pasta and soap for resale

loans.name: Bou's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Bou H. is 54 years old and the village bank president who has been selected by the thirteen members located in Sla Village in Takeo province. In this village loan, the members will each use their loan to support their different purpose.

Mr. Bou H. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice for a living. For his farm, he decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticide, and rice seed and to hire a laborer to plow his farm.

Mr. Bou H.’s wife, Mrs. Vov Phorn, is a congee (a type of rice porridge) seller who is able to earn a little income to support her family. This couple has four children: two are on the staff of a casino club and two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide and to hire a laborer to plow his farm

loans.name: Romnick

texts.en:
Romnick M. is from the village of Palutan. He is 20 years old. Romnick is single. To make a living, Romnick plants, harvests, and sells corn. Romnick has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 50000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Romnick joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romnick has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Romnick is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be Romnick's third loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Melanio

texts.en:
Melanio A., from the city of Stimpson Abordo Ozamz City, is 40 years old, married, and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Melanio owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport services in the local community. Engaged in his business for over 3 years, he earns approximately 20000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Melanio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan of 20000 PHP from GDMPC, he is now requesting a new loan, his third, of 30000 PHP to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Melanio plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 69 years old and married with 5 children who are all adults. He is a farmer from Murang'a town in Central Kenya where he has been farming for over 30 years. He mainly deals in horticultural produce which he sells to Frigoken Company in Murang'a town. He also earns income from his rental houses in the same area.

His biggest challenge in farming is the unstable prices for horticultural goods, high prices of farm inputs, and lack of enough capital to expand his business.

Peter recently completed his first loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 KES and has requested this loan for 60,000 KES to purchase dairy goats. The extra income from this loan will enable him to expand his farming activities and improve the family's living standards.

In future, he would like to build more rental houses. He says that through the first loan, he has been able to know how a loan can uplift one's living status.

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats

loans.name: Maria Elsi

texts.es:
María Elsi, tiene 50 años de edad, Viven en  Caserío El Monte, del Municipio de San Jorge, departamento,  San Miguel, es Casada, vive solo con su esposo y no tiene hijos, tiene una tienda y venta de Pupusas (tortilla de maíz con queso y carne).
El negocio de venta de pupusas tiene más de 20 años de funcionar, sus padres se dedicaba a la venta ganado y la madre ama de casa, este negocio fue por iniciativa propia, las ventajas es que hay mucha gente que la conoce por la zona y por eso le va bien en las ventas. Ella está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de materia prima como son: maíz, aceite, queso, carne de cerdo, especies que son utilizados para elaborar las pupusas.
Este préstamo le servirá para aumentar el negocio lo cual le permitirá generar ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares. Las aspiraciones de María son cubrir los compromisos del crédito, seguir generando ingreso para cubrir sus necesidades, para mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
María Elsi is 50 years old and lives in the village of El Monte in San Jorge Township, Department of San Miguel. She is married, but she and her husband live alone since they do not have children. María Elsi has a store and sells “pupusas” (corn tortillas filled with cheese and meat).

Her pupusa business has been in operation for more than 20 years. María Elsi’s parents sell cattle and her mother is a homemaker. She started this business of her own initiative. The advantages are that there are many people and she has personal knowledge of the area. For this reason she has done well with her sales. María Elsi is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of supplies such as corn, oil, cheese, pork, and spices used in making pupusas.

This loan will help to increase her business, which will enable her generate income to cover her family expenses. María’s aspirations are to fulfill her loan obligations, continue generating income to cover her needs, and improve the quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, oil, cheese, pork, and spices

location.town: Caserio El Mogote, San Jorge, San Miguel

loans.name: Ndeye

texts.fr:
Madame Ndeye D. est une femme mariée, elle  habite dans la localité de Bambilor et elle âgée de 46 ans.
C’est pour soutenir son mari qu’elle s’est lancée dans l’activité de commerce. Mais par la même occasion elle parvient à satisfaire ses quelques besoins personnels par le biais de son activité.
Depuis 10 ans elle exerce l’achat et la vente d’objets d’art au lac rose. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Bambilor depuis février  2010. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 150 000 frs dans le but de renforcer  son commerce par l’achat d’avantage d’objets  d’art  mais aussi de la diversifier car elle voudrait démarrer  la vente de robes et autres articles divers. Ce crédit  pourra contribuer a l’accroissement substantiel de ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndeye D. is a married woman; she lives in the town of Bambilor and is 46 years old. It was to support her husband that Mrs. D. went into business. At the same time, she manages to meet her own small personal needs by means of her business. For 10 years, Mrs. D. has been practicing the purchase and sale of objets d'art from Lake Retba (Lac Rose). She has been a member of the Bambilor credit association since February 2010. She is seeking a loan of 150,000 CFA francs with the goal of strengthening her business by buying more objets d'art but also by diversifying since she would like to begin selling dresses and other various goods. This loan could contribute to the substantial growth of her income.

Translated from French by Jessalyn Pinneo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing working capital

loans.name: Juvilyn

texts.en:
Juvilyn V., from the village of Punit, is 30 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Juvilyn owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over a year, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Juvilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan, her third, of 10000 PHP for the same purpose. Juvilyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen P., 42, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. P. is a farmer and earns an income of USD 2.5 per day. Her husband produces rice wine, earning an income of USD 3 per day. P. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more rice to produce rice wine product. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. P. appears in the photograph with her husband while she is helping her husband to produce rice wine.

loans.use: To buy rice to produce rice wine product.

loans.name: Celso Fernando

texts.es: El señor  Celso Fernando P. P. se dedica a brindar servicios como Operario de Construcción Civíl hace diez años aproximadamente, el solicitante vive con su menor hija en su domicilio ubicado avenida Acomayo Ica ya que se encuentra separado de su conyuge hace quince años. El cliente solicita el cédito para mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que con su trabajo y esfuerzo a logrado construir su casa, se propone otorgarle el crédito por que presenta experiencia acrediticia en tiendas comercialesbuenas y buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Celso Fernando P. P. has been a civil construction worker for approximately ten years. He lives with his minor daughter in his house on Acomayo Ica Avenue. He has been separated from his wife for 15 years. He is requesting the loan to improve his house. With his work and effort he has managed to build his house. It is suggested that he receive the loan because he has good credit experience in commercial stores and good personal and work references.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve his house

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som S., 54, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known for its business with Vietnam. Som sells porridge for an income of 5 USD per day. Her four children are employed at different workplaces, earning an income of about 2 USD per day to help cover the family expenses.

Som is requesting a loan, her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia, of 1000 USD to purchase construction materials to help with one of the children’s businesses. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for one of her children

loans.name: Fredesvinda

texts.es:
Fredesvinda es una madre D. familia D. 48 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito D. Pacasmayo, una zona comercial que es a su vez la capital D. la provincia del mismo nombre situada en la región La Libertad, a dos horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desD. hace quince años a la venta D. abarrotes en un puesto D. venta ubicado en el mercadillo D. su distrito. Ella depenD. D. esta actividad para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a su familia. Por ello se esfuerza diariamente para conseguir más clientes y aumentar su nivel D. ventas.

Fredesvinda desea adquirir más productos para poder ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas. Por ello ha creido conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y honrada. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Fredesvinda is a 48 year old mother who lives with her husband and children in the Pacasmayo district, a commercial zone that is also the capital of the province by the same name, located in the La Libertad region, two hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque.

For the past 15 years she’s been selling groceries from a stall in the marketplace in her district.  She depends on this business to help her husband move the family ahead.  She works hard every day to attract new customers and increase her sales.

Fredesvinda wants to acquire more products to be able to expand her business and increase her sales, so she has seen fit to request a loan of 1,500 PEN ($550) through Edpyme Alternativa, to help her reach her goal.

She is a very hard working and honest woman.  She has had previous loans through our institution and has proven herself to be punctual and responsible with her payments.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 39 years old. Elizabeth is married and has four children. Her eldest child is 8 years old while the youngest is only 2. She is a farmer and a hog-grower. She helps her husband, who is also a farmer, maintain their rice farm. She also helps in selling their harvest. Elizabeth also does her best to keep the pigs she grows healthy. 

Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from CEVI to be used for her farm. She will buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs with her loan. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris is 24 years old and has been in business running a retail shop for the last 6 years in a very busy environment. His main customers are the local residents and his neighbours. 

In his retail shop, he sells sukari (sugar), Unga (both maize and wheat flour), mahindi (maize), mchele (rice), and mkate (bread), among other products. 

He has requested for a loan of KES 50,000 to buy a plot of land to develop a business premise, since he is now renting.

He is married and they are parents to one child. He describes himself as focused and active, and plans to enlarge his business and invest in real estate in order to have a good living and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy a plot land to develop a business premise

loans.name: Kanygul's Group

texts.en:
Kanygul S., 44, is the treasurer of this group. She is a resident of Kadamjai, a small town in the southern part of Kyrgyzstan. Just like most of the  residents, Kanygul raises cattle. For many years, Kanygul raised cattle just for family purposes but her husband advised her to try starting a business in this sphere. Now, she has two heads of cattle and runs a slow business. Her husband is a cab driver, her oldest son is in Russia to earn a good income, her second son is in the army, her daughters live separately and her youngest son helps to take care of the cattle. Twenty years ago, the business was started from only 2,000 soms and since then, the family has managed to make major repairs to the house and arrange wedding ceremonies for their daughters. Now, Kanygul would like to start a dairy business and she has applied for this loan in order to do so. She hopes to get a loan and to use the proceeds to purchase a car for her son so that he can work as a cab driver. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Lyra

texts.en:
Lyra L. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 40 years old. Lyra is married and has 5 children. Her eldest child is 16 years old and the youngest is 9. To make a living, Lyra owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lyra also helps her husband till their rice farm. She said that her farm needs additional rice seeds.

Lyra joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lyra has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Lyra is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase rice seeds and additional products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and additional products to sell

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa tiene 34 años de edad, es separada y reside junto a sus cuatro hijos en una casa de familiares, situada en el sector Callanca del distrito de Monsefú, una zona agrícola situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a trabajar en la venta de verduras en un puesto ambulante situado en el mercado de su localidad, ella ofrece en venta a sus clientes diversos productos frescos a buen precio y brindándoles un buen trato, estas prácticas le han valido obtener siempre una buena clientela. Su mercadería la compra en el mercado Moshoqueque y en el mercado Los Pathos (mercados mayoristas). Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para sacar adelante a sus menores hijos.

María Teresa desea realizar algunas implementaciones previas para instalar una vivienda en un terreno que tiene en la localidad, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales planea lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María Teresa, 34, is separated and lives together with her four children in a house belonging to relatives located in Callanca, Monsefú district, a farming zone located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For the last three years she has been selling vegetables from a stand in her local market.  She offers fresh produce at good prices and with good customer service.  These practices have led to her having a regular customer base.  She buys her merchandise at the Moshoqueque and Los Pathos markets (wholesale markets).  Income from this activity helps her support her minor children.

María Teresa wants to do some preliminary work leading up to building a house on a piece of property she has in the location.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan that she plans to use to reach her objective.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 43 years old, married and has 12 children who range in age from five and 22 years old. Seven of his children are currently in school. For the last 25 years, Jean has made a living as a carpenter. His wife adds to the family's income by selling sorghum. Jean has applied for this loan to buy more lumber to use to make his goods. With the profits made possible by this loan, he plans to continue expanding his business.

loans.use: To buy more lumber to use in his carpentry business.

loans.name: Roth

texts.en: Roth N. is a 48-year-old widowed woman who is a local farmer. She lives with her five children, three of whom are single and two of whom are married. She always weaves baskets for additional income besides that which she receives from farming. Roth N. is good at making bamboo baskets for the market. She and her children sometimes go through the village looking for bamboo, which they take home and soak in water for almost a week. After that, they dry it in the sunshine for three days. They split the bamboo into smaller pieces, and after that she and her children start making it into baskets. Recently, Roth N. has not been comfortable, because her house often needs to be repaired. She would like a loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing fast food

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Emiliana es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito – Juli, departamento de Puno, tiene 53 años de edad, está  casada y tiene 6 hijos (4 a su cargo).  Ella pudo estudiar solo primaria incompleta.
Emiliana tiene un puesto en el mercado Juli donde se dedica a la venta de verduras, y nos cuenta también que hace bordados en telas, donde plasman las costumbres de los  habitantes de la isla URUS, isla que se encuentra ubicado en el lago Titicaca. Viene trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace once años, la primera vez que solicito su préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó para comprar tela y lana para hacer lindísimos bordados.
Ahora solicitará nuevo préstamo de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que utilizara para comprar verduras como lechuga, cuatro arrobas de zanahoria, dos arrobas de cebolla  y otros para seguir operando con su negocio.  
Su sueño es seguir trabajando con el negocio que tiene. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la ganancia generada por sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Emiliana is a member of the “María Asunción Galindo” community bank which is located in Juli district, in Chucuito - Juli province, in Puno department.  She is 53 years old, married, and has 6 children (4 of whom are in her care).  Emiliana did not finish elementary school.

Emiliana has a stall in Juli market where she sells vegetables.  She tells us that she also embroiders on fabric, capturing the customs of the inhabitants of URUS island, an island that is found in Lake Titicaca.

Emiliana has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for eleven years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she used that money to buy fabric and yarn for making her beautiful embroideries.  On this occasion, she is requesting 300 Peruvian soles to buy vegetables such as lettuce, four 11kg sacks of carrots, two 11kg sacks of onions and others so that she can continue running her business.

Emiliana's dream is to continue working in her business.  What she likes about her community bank is the interest that she makes on her savings.

loans.use: To buy vegetables such as lettuce, four 11kg sacks of carrots, two 11kg sacks of onions, etc.

loans.name: Godofredo

texts.es:
Godofredo Bermúdez Q., está casado, tiene 68 años y vive con su esposa. El quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para la fertilización de su cafetal. El pretende tener su cafetal en una mejor condición de producción y así poder obtener mayores cosechas este año al igual que una mejor calidad de café. El cuenta con el terreno y la plantación en buenas condiciones lo que quiere es fortalecerlo.  También él quiere crecer como un caficultor de la zona y ser ejemplo para las personas para que sigan con sus proyectos y los fortalezcan aun más. El pretende obtener mayores ganancias de  esta próxima cosecha para seguir creciendo y tener un futuro más seguro para él y su esposa.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Godofredo Bermúdez Q. is 68 years old, married, and lives with his wife. He wants to buy the necessary supplies for cultivating his coffee crop. Godofredo intends to have better conditions for producing coffee so that he can obtain better crop yields this year as well as a better quality product. He possesses farmland and planted crops in good condition that he wants to strengthen. Godofredo wants to grow as a local farmer and set an example for others to continue with their agricultural projects and become even stronger. He intends to obtain better earnings with this next harvest so that he can continue growing and build a more secure future for himself and his wife.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Godofredo has not taken out any previous loans with other state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better services and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for growing coffee.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” COMUZONE III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Delia; la socia tiene 57 años D. edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia es profesora cesante ella trabajo años en el magisterio y actualmente está dedicada a su hogar y a sus hijos, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas D. seguir adelante, la socia  está apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios universitarios que están por culminar.

La socia solicita el préstamo para los estudios universitarios D. sus hijos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Delia, 57, is a member of the “COMUZONE III” communal bank located in Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is married and has four children.  She is a retired Teacher.  She worked in teaching for years and now is dedicated to her home and children.  She is quite a cheerful person with quite a bit of drive to continue further.  She is supporting her children who are about to complete their university studies.

She is asking for the loan for her children’s university expenses.

She is happy about the loan and commits to repay.

loans.use: to pay for one of her children's university studies.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 53 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 9 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de bar y también vende comida en la plaza de armas de Urcos desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m y en las tardes se dedica al negocio de bar vendiendo bebidas y gaseosas venta de animales como chancho y cuyes, la socia también vende comida y pan en el distrito de Urcos, la socia realiza diferentes tipos de negocios y saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar los negocios. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los animales y comprar productos para vender comida.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana, 53, is a member of the “LAS AMISTOSAS” (The Friendly Ones) communal bank located in Urcos District which belongs to Quispicanchis Province, Cusco Department.

She is a widow with nine children.  She alternates her daily chores with running a bar and also sells food at the main square in Urcos from 8am until 1pm.  She spends afternoons tending to the bar selling beverages and soft drinks.  She also sells farm animals like pigs and guinea pigs.  And she also sells food and bread in Urcos district.  She carries out all kinds of jobs to support her children.  She wants to expand and improve her businesses and is asking for a loan to buy feed for her animals and also to buy ingredients for her food sales.  She is happy about the loan and committed to paying her installments.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma S. is from the village of Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 47 years old. Emma is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap, biscuits & coconuts in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Emma is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & coconuts. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & coconuts.

location.town: Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som C. I. is 47 years old. She is a local farmer who lives with her family in a wooden house in Kompong Tom province. Som is a married woman who has given birth to six children, all of whom are single. Two of her children work as sewers in a factory. Som and her husband help each other plant and harvest rice and vegetables on their own fertile land. 

Som recently completed rebuilding her house. She would like to invite her relatives and neighbors for a housewarming party, but she lacks the funds to hold this party. Therefore, she is requesting a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to have a housewarming party

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is married to a farmer and has four children. She has been smoking various kinds of fish for sale in Abura, near Brasi, for 15 years. Adjoa uses the income she makes from her sales to help her husband pay utility bills. She will use this loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for resale. Adjoa plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Discapacitados En Accion Group

texts.es: La Señora Alberta es una mujer muy trabajadora y tiene mucho entusiasmo, ella se dedica a la venta en su bodega que se encuentra en su propio domicilio, a la vez tambien tiene un puesto D. lavado D. autos, aunque aun tiene poco tiempo con ese negocio, pero ella pone un gran optimismo en hacer crecer su negocio. La señora Alberta es parte D. la Alcancia Comunal "DISCAPACITADOS EN ACCION" grupo formado inicialmente en su totalidad por personas con alguna discapacidad fisica, ahora son solo algunos socios del grupo que aun representan el nombre D. la alcancia, pero todos ellos son personas muy emprendedoras, que sueñan con hacer crecer sus negocios, y dar lo mejor para sus familias.
texts.en:
Alberta is a hard-working woman who has a great deal of enthusiasm.  She dedicates herself to commerce from her store, which is located right in her own house.  She also has a car wash and, although she has not had a lot of time in this business yet, she is very optimistic that she can make the enterprise grow.

Alberta is a member of “THE DISABLED IN ACTION”, a group originally comprised entirely of members with some type of physical disability.  Currently, there are only a few members left who still represent the group’s name.  However, they are all very entrepreneurial people who dream of making their businesses grow and proviD. a better life for their families.

loans.use: purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Dockers Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her late 20s, is married with two children, both of whom attend school. She has been selling bricks for 6 years. She works from 3 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Fatuma's 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to open a shop containing cosmetics and undergarments in the Shinyanga District (almost 300 kilometers from Dar es salam). She also bought and sold bricks. Fatuma has repaid all her loans successfully and wishes for a new loan to buy and sell more bricks. Her dream is to one day own a nice house and a business car like a pickup.

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group "Dockers", which consists of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable in repaying their loans.

loans.use: To buy and sell more bricks.

loans.name: Kalim

texts.en: Kalim is 48 years old, married and blessed with three children who range in age from 22 to 27. For the last 10 years, she has made a living selling electrical supplies and earns about KES 15,000 a month, all of which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her second loan from KADET after repaying her first one off successfully. She will use this loan to expand her business and buy more electrical bulbs, switches and cable to sell to her customers. Her long-term goals are to open a wholesale electric supply center and buy her own business vehicle. She believes that doing this will allow her to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy electrical bulbs, switches and cables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Arcos De Miacatlan Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Arcos de Miacatlan"  porque cerca de donde esta el grupo hay unos  arcos que identifican a la poblacion, esta ubicado en el estado de Morelos, en Mexico. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes y es la cuarta vez que solicitan un prestamo. Mayra es integrante del grupo, tiene 33 años, estudio una carrera comercial en secretariado, es comerciante, tiene un total 2 hijas; ella se dedica a la venta de ropa negocio que inicio hace 5 años, solicita el prestamo para comprar calcetas, calcetines, y algunos uniformes para el ingreso de los niños a las escuelas. Sus clientes la prefieren porque les lleva los articulos hasta sus hogares, al momento de solicitar el prestamo se siente contenta porque tendra mercancia para la temporada de regreso a clases. Tambien espera con las ganancias comprar los utiles escolares de sus hijos ya que son caros y quiere que vayan muy preparados a el nuevo ciclo escolar, comenta que para ella es muy importante la educación de sus hijos ya que les abre la oportunidad de tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
This group is called “Arcos de Miacatlan” (Arches of Miacatlan). The name reflects a set of arches that are located near where the group meets and help to identify this town which is located in the State of Morelos in Mexico. There are nine members in this group and this is the fourth time they have requested a loan.

Mayra is a member of the group. She is 33 years old and studied to pursue a business career as a secretary. Mayra works as a merchant and has two daughters. She sells clothing at her business which she started five years ago. Mayra is requesting a loan to buy stockings, socks, and a few school uniforms for children. Her customers prefer to do business with her because she delivers her merchandise to their homes. Upon requesting her loan, Mayra was pleased because she would be able to obtain merchandise before the school season started again. She also hopes to earn enough money to buy school supplies for her children since they can be expensive. Mayra wants her children to be prepared for the new school year. She says that it is very important that her children have an education because it will open opportunities for them to have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase stockings, socks, and a few school uniforms.

loans.name: Mansueta

texts.en:
Mansueta is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Mansueta has a retail shop that sells dried fish of different kinds. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of dried fish.

Mansueta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mansueta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dried fish.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Lea is providing motorela or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.
Lea is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lea hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for motorbike services

loans.name: Macdonald

texts.en:
Macdonald is a married man with one girl who attends school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills, school fees and electricity. 

For the past four years, he has operated a tailoring business, selling in a shop to his neighbors and passersby. Macdonald faces a major challenge of competition from other tailors in the area. He dreams of purchasing another sewing machine in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to purchase cloth materials for his tailoring business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for his tailoring business

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Kossiwa est une femme âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée à un jardinier. Elle a 4 enfants dont 2 à l’école. Le premier a 11 ans et le dernier a 2 ans. 
Kossiwa travaille comme  revendeuse depuis 1992. Elle vend des produits maraichers aux voyageurs à l’aéroport de Lomé. Elle travaille avec 1 employé. Sa difficulté principale est l’inondation.
Kossiwa a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits maraichers. Elle veut réinvestir dans son activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Kossiwa voudrait développer son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kossiwa, age 30, is married to a gardener. She has four children, out of whom two attend school. Her firstborn is eleven, while the youngest is two.
She's been working as a reseller since 1992. She sells garden produces to travelers at Lomé Airport. She works with one employee. Her major hardship is flooding.

Kossiwa is seeking her first loan from Kiva's parter, WAGES, in order to buy garden produces. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the forthcoming years, she would like to expand her business. She says that she intends to use her profits to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy and sell garden produces

loans.name: Milaz

texts.en: Milaz is 56 years old, married and has six children!  He has more than 20 years of experience in cattle breeding and dairy selling. His primary source of income is selling dairy and dairy products to the local people. His monthly income is about 70 USD and he would like to expand it to 150 USD. His dream is to save money and purchase a car one day. He says if he had a car, he could sell milk in other villages and take his dairy products once a week to the city.  Now he applied for 1500 AZN, which he will use to purchase two milk cows.

loans.use: to purchase two milk cows and fodder

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is married and her husband has a business selling bed sheets. He puts the bed sheets on his bicycle and visits different places & markets. He is very experienced in his work and has been operating his business for many years. 
Khursheed is a housewife and also helps her husband in arranging the bed sheets on his bicycle. 
She has given birth to 6 children. Her eldest son also has a business selling bed sheets while the youngest one is studying. Her remaining children stay at home and do not work. 
Khursheed has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy bed sheets in larger quantities for sale. 
Khursheed hopes that an investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and will help her family to live better financially.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets for sale

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 38 years old. He is married and has four children who are in school. He does mixed farming, including rearing sheep and farming wheat, which he has been doing for the past seven years.

Henry learned about KADET LTD through a KADET staff member. He is a good client and has applied for his first loan, which he plans to spend partly on farming and partly to purchase more sheep for fattening.

He hopes to make a profit and use the anticipated income to educate his children. He dreams of expanding his farming business.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for fattening.

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: Maria De La Concepción de 46 años, una mujer que tiene aspiraciones de crecimiento en su negocio. Su negocio es una brindar el servicio de fotocopiadora está ubicada en vivienda. Inicio hace 11 años con su negocio y con la ayuda de su esposo, pero lamentablemente el falleció y ella busco la forma de sobrevivir. Tiene dos hijos uno mayores de edad, Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de papel, tinta, pago de luz entre otros. Su sueño es incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
María De La Concepción is 46, and has ambitions of seeing her business grow. Her business is providing photocopying services from her home.

She started her business eleven years ago, with her husband's help; but unfortunately he passed away, and she looked for a way of supporting herself. 

She has two adult children. She is applying for the loan in order to buy paper and ink, to pay the electricity bill, and for other expenses. Her dream is to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy paper, ink, and pay for electricity.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 55 years of age. She is married with six siblings. She presently lives at Barangay Lourmah, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She has had this gardening business for more than 10 years, and she used this business to support her financial needs. She requested a loan amount of 14,000 pesos to purchase more fertilizers for her farm.

Alberta has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for almost three years. In the future, Alberta hopes that through the help of PMPC, she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Erika Maria

texts.es: Erika Maria tiene 32 años. Tiene 3 hijos que están bajo  su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta mercadería en general. Ella tiene más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Ella es una mujer muy responsable y dedicada con su familia, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar muy fuerte. Inicio por cuenta propia ya que empezó vendiendo pantalones y ropa interior  por lo que ofrecía sus productos de manera ambulante, fue aquí en donde inicio con este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de camisetas, pantalones, cosméticos, perfumes, polvos, lápiz labial. Su deseo es establecer su propia tienda.
texts.en:
Erika María is 32, and has three children to look after.  She sells general merchandise, and has been doing this for five years. She is a very responsible woman, who is devoted to her family; so she has always liked to work very hard.  

She started being self-employed by selling pants and underwear, and sold her products in the street. This was where she started this business. The loan she is applying for is for working capital to buy T-shirts, pants, cosmetics, perfumes, and lip pencils.  

Her wish is to set up her own store.

loans.use: To buy T-shirts, pants, cosmetics, perfumes, powders, and lip pencils.

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children.
 
Ricky has a computer shop that provides computer games and internet.  He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy tools and pay for the electricity of his computer shop.

Ricky has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ricky hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the electricity of his computer shop.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is a 29-year-old woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in seaweed farming for 2 years. She earns 4000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month with this business. Cristina does her best to improve her business. She requested a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, straw, and other materials. Cristina hopes to earn better and be able to save for her future family.

loans.use: To buy seaweed seedlings, straw, and other materials.

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Thmor Koul district, Nat is a 31-year-old married mother of three children. Two of them are still in school while the last one has a job. She is a farmer who has been farming on her rice field for five years. She supplements her income by weaving mats and sometimes she works for others to raise additional income. She earns less than five U.S. dollars per day from her current business to feed her family. 

Nat started taking out loans in 2004. The previous loans have helped her have regular income and make a better living. Having utilized traditional electricity, Nat leads a group of five female members who have been with VisionFund for eight years applying for another with VisionFund. She will use this loan to connect the electricity to her house. This loan will enable her and her family to have electricity and also to increase her business.

loans.use: To bring electrical power to her house

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes, pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco, Departamento del Cusco. Es csada, tiene 37 años de edad, y tiene 4 hijos de 17, 14, 12, 5 años de edad. 

La socia se dedica  la atencion de sus pequeño hospedaje y en esta ocasion la socia desea invertir en la compra de accesorios para los acabados del segundo piso o nivel de su hospedaje, la socia fue ahorrando por muchos años y con lo que saca mediante el banco comunal y los ahorros la socia fue invirtiendo en su casa y acomodando la shabiataciones y baños para darlos en hospedaje, ahora ya tiene clientes y a ampliado el segundo piso y mejorado en general la casa, la socia desea invertir en la compra de accesorios para los acabados del segundo nivel, como comprar mayolica, pintura, accesorios para baños, cortinas entre otros.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mercedes belongs to the "Nueva Luz del Mañana" communal bank, of the Asociación Arariwa in Cusco province, Cusco department. She is 37, married, and has four children, ages 17, 14, 12, and 5.

The borrower runs a small guest house, on this occasion, wishes to invest in the purchase of fittings, for finishing work on the second floor or level of her guest house. She has been saving for many years, and with what she gets from the communal bank, and her savings, she has been investing in her house, and fixing up the rooms and bathrooms to rent out as lodging. 

Now she already has customers, and has expanded the second floor, and made general improvements to the house. The borrower wishes to invest in the purchase of fittings, needed for finishing work on the second level, such as buying ceramic tiles, paint, bathroom fittings, curtains and other things. 

The borrower is grateful for the opportunity she has been given, and promises to make her instalment payments in accordance with the loan schedule.

loans.use: To buy fittings for the finishing work on the second level of her guest house, such as buying ceramic tile, paint, bathroom fittings, curtains and other things.

loans.name: Sheway

texts.en:
Sheway is a 35-year-old man who lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He is a father of one son & one daughter only. He has a shop for selling basic grocery products in a small public area. He is not literate but has 10 years experience in this field. He started his business by opening a small shop with a simple amount of capital. As his business is small and a far distance from town, he uses that to help old families so they don't have to go to the market in the city and attempts as much as possible to provide his customers needs himself. So the store is not just a source of income and profit.

Then, the shop burned down and the wholesalers hesitate to provide him with the required goods  dealing with him as a lower class person, which became a challenge for him.
