In spite of that, he was able to return his shop back to usual but he could not buy all the items he had before as he needs financial support.  

So, Sheway applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to buy grocery items for his business. This loan would help him remodel the shop and meet the demands of his clienteles in bringing in all that they require.

In the future, Sheway would like to increase the size of his shop and purchase a small vehicle to use for transporting materials for his business from market easily.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for his grocery shop

loans.name: Ana Teresa

texts.es: La señora Ana Teresa es madre de familia y es muy responsable con sus obligaciones de casa y trabajo. Tiene 3 hijos un de 6 años que está en primaria el cual en este momento le están exigiendo el uniforme de tiempo de frio y algunos útiles escolares que de acuerdo a la temporada le solicitan. Para Ana es muy importante que su hijo lleve el uniforme ya que lo cubrirá del frio y le permitirán la entrada a la escuela y no perderá clases. De esta manera el podrá tener una mejor educación.
texts.en: Ana Teresa is the head of her household and she is very responsible about her home and work obligations.  She has three children.  Her six-year-old is in primary school and they are requiring that he have the cold-weather school uniform and some school supplies that he will need for this time of year.  It is very important to Ana that her son have his uniform because it will protect him from the cold and they will let him go to school so he doesn't miss his classes.  This will allow him to get a better education.

loans.use: to buy uniforms

loans.name: Jose Cesar

texts.es: José tiene 54 años de edad es casado y tiene hijos que son mayores de edad por lo que son in independientes. Su esposa tiene una pequeña boutique. José  a raíz de perder su empleo el trato de buscar empleo en otra empresa pero nadie le abrió las puertas para trabajar es por eso que decidió alquilar un taxi para conducirlo y llevar dinero a su casa. En la actualidad de lo había ahorrado el pudo comprarse un carro y ahora es conductor de su carro realiza fletes dentro y fuera de su ciudad. Con el préstamo comprar llantas nuevas y arreglara el carro, y invertirá dinero en el boutique de su esposa. Su meta trazada es comprarse otro carro y mejorar el boutique de su esposa
texts.en:
José is 54 years old, married, and has grown children. His wife has a small boutique shop. José lost his job a while ago and as he was having difficulty finding work, decided to rent a taxi in order to work as a taxi driver and bring money home. He has currently saved enough to buy himself a car, and he provides services both within and outside of the city. 

With this loan, he will buy new tires and make some repairs to the car, as well as invest some of the money in his wife's shop. His goal is to be able to buy another car and improve his wife's business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and fix his car, as well as to invest in his wife's shop

loans.name: Josefa Ferreira

texts.en:
Josefa Ferreira, 47, is married, has 4 children and 1 grandson who she raises. Since small she interested to learn sew, her mother encouraged a lot, she become dressmaker buying magazines and looking patterns.
Josefa, was born in north Brazil, cames too early to state of São Paulo for improve their life.
She got to buy her first sewing machine after much struggle and with her own job.
That time she had supports family alone, due to divorce of first marriage.
Today she makes doll clothes for a company, she needs to buy a machine embroidery, thread and cloth for complement her clothing business and sell for other people and companies, she intends with the loan to double her production and hire an employee.
She teaches her  daughters who are 12 and 14 years to stir in the sewing machine for in the future they may work in family.

loans.use: To buy a machine embroidery, thread and cloth

loans.name: Kai

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Kai.  She is married and has two children, aged 5 and 3 years old. In 2000, Kai established her clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in the running of the home. Working 7 days a week and 16 hours  a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

Kai would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Kai requires a loan in order to buy more cotton and lace clothing for resale. In the future, Kai plans to build a house to live in and to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cotton and  lace clothing for resale.

loans.name: Bong's Group

texts.en:
Aged 48 years, Bong is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Sangke district of Battambang province. She is a mother of six children, one of whom is still in school. She earns a living through farming rice and raising cows. Together, she and her husband can earn about KHR60,000 per day from the current business and is able to save about KHR40,000 each day for the future. 

This is the first loan for Bong with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to fertilizers and rice seeds for support her rice paddy. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice farming production to better off her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to use her portion to fertilizers and rice seeds for support her rice paddy

loans.name: Cleotilde

texts.en:
My name is Cleotilde B.. My store is in the municipal market, I sell clothes, book bags, pañaleros ( a type of clothing), baby clothes and other things, for five years, with my earnings I get from my business, I pay for my personal expenses, now that I am advanced in age, it is the only income I have.

Descripción del Negocio: Mi nombre es Cleotilde B., tengo mi negocio de venta de variedades en el mercado municipal vendo ropa, mochilas, pañaleras, ropa de bebé y otros hace cinco años, con los ingresos que percibo de mi negocio pago mis gastos personales ya que soy una persona de edad avanzada y es el único ingreso que tengo.

loans.use: Buying underwear for men, women and children, book bags and briefcases.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca has a year's experience in clothing sales. Previously, because her husband died, she began to work doing domestic chores. Later she worked as a packer. When her sister saw her doing the packing work, she encouraged Blanca to start her own business selling clothes. She was able to finance her business with money loaned by her sister. She has succeeded in moving her business forward, selling to people she knows and to family members from Monday to Saturday, 9 am to 6 pm.

Blanca wants the loan in order to invest it in the business. She has lots of orders for beach clothing since it's that season, but because she lacks capital, she's unable to satisfy those client orders.

Blanca is 53 years old, with 6 children. Four of her children are now adults and help her with what she needs; the other two are still in school. In the future she wishes to fix up her house, and to give a better life to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Blanca tiene una experiencia de 1 año en el negocio de venta de ropa, pero ella desde antes por motivos de que su esposo falleció comenzó a trabajar en quehaceres domésticos. Luego paso a trabajar a una empacadora y al ver esto, su hermana la motivo para que se inicie con su negocio propio y le propone vender ropa. Se logra financiar con dinero que le presto su hermana y hasta hoy a logrado sacar adelante el negocio vendiendo a personas conocidas del sector y familiares de lunes a sábado en horario de 9 a.m. hasta las 18 p.m.

Blanca desea el crédito para invertir en el negocio ya que tiene bastantes pedidos de ropa de playa por ser la temporada y ella por falta de capital no puede satisfacer a sus clientes.

Blanca tiene 53 años, 6 hijos de los cuales 4 ya son adultos y le ayudan en lo que necesita, los otros dos todavía estudian. Ella desea a futuro comenzar a arreglar su casa y darles una mejor vida a sus hijos.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in beach and warm weather clothing

loans.name: Heng Srey

texts.en: Heng Srey M. is just 21 years old and already owns 1 home that she rents out to local factory workers.  Her husband works as a goldsmith and earns $5/day.  Heng Srey M. currently makes $3/day, but with this new loan she will be able to repair a second home for rental and double her income.  The extra income will be most helpful, as her and her husband support their 2 children, Heng Srey M.'s mother, and two of her nephews that have moved in from the provinces.  In the future, Heng Srey M. wants to continue building more houses for rent, and wants to send her children to university.

loans.use: To repair a home for rental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her fruit-selling business

loans.name: Dogood

texts.en: Mr. Dogood O. specializes in the milling of rice.  This is a business he learned from his father as a child, and has been in this business since then.  He is 30 years old and married.  He is requesting the above loan amount to buy another milling machine to enable him to serve his customers better.

loans.use: To buy an additional milling machine

loans.name: Marcelle

texts.en: Marcelle is a hairdresser living in Ain Ata in the region of Rachaya,  in Southeastern  Lebanon. She is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase beauty creams for her salon business. These new products will increase her customer activity and generate more revenue. She is the mother of two children, and she works hard to be develop her business and help support her family.

loans.use: To purchase of beauty creams

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ever since she joined TYM fund, the living condition of Ms Quế's family has improved significantly. Her first loan was 125 USD and in later rounds, she was able to qualify for maximum amount. Her weekly repayment toward the loan is 6 USD. This time she's requesting 625 USD which will be used to buy material (sedge) for mat weaving. Since the selling price of a mat is high, mat weaving has become a popular profession in the region. Ms Quế is 48 years old, she thinks that she can continue to work for another 10 years.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Từ ngày tham gia Quỹ TYM đến nay kinh tế gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị Quế phát triển lên rõ rệt. Sau khi vay thử vòng đầu với mức 125USD, các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị đều vay mức tối đa. Mức trả hàng tuần của chị Quế lúc nào cũng trên 6USD/tuần. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay 625USD để sử dụng vào mục đích mua thêm cói để dệt chiếu. Với giá chiếu như hiện nay nghề dệt chiếu là một trong những nghề phổ biến nhất tại địa phương. Ở tuổi 48, chị Quế tin rằng mình còn khả năng tiếp tục công việc 10 năm nữa.

loans.use: Buy sedge to make mat

loans.name: Saida's Group

texts.en:
Saida N. sells Matooke (mashed and cooked bananas) and has a restaurant. She has an investment of 400,000 shillings and makes a profit of about 1,600 shillings ($13) a week. She has 3 children and looks after I orphan. She plans to use the loan to enlarge her fresh food sales.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To enlarge her fresh food sales

loans.name: Lomessi

texts.fr:
Born in 1963, Lomessi A. is married and the mother of six children, all of whom are in school. A very dedicated woman, she buys cassava which she transforms into "gari" flour for the market. This is very tough work, which requires more manual labor than she has the means for. So, she has to do the work all by herself. She is requesting a loan of $200 to buy more cassava and a grater in order to make her work less taxing. This will enable her to increase her production and to meet her customer expectations better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1963, Madame A. Lomessi est mariée et mère de six (6) enfants tous scolarisés. Très dévouée, elle achète du manioc qu’elle transforme en farine « gari » pour la commercialisation. C’est un travail très pénible et qui nécessite plus de main d’œuvre mais les moyens de Madame A. ne le lui permettent pas et elle est seule à faire la tâche. Elle sollicite un financement de $200 pour s’acheter plus de manioc et une râpeuse afin de rendre moins pénible le travail. Ceci lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy cassava and a grater

loans.name: Emilia's Group

texts.en:
Emilia, Lea, and Elizabeth are members of the “Virgen del Rosario” community bank. They have belonged to the bank for 10 years, 2 years, and eight months, respectively. In that time, they have learned not to depend on their husbands, to help each other, and to save.

Emilia is 48 years old. She is married and has two sons. Emilia sells set breakfasts in the morning and roasted chicken in the afternoon. She also takes borders into her home. In addition, Emily sells cosmetics from a catalogue.

Lea is 32 years old. She is married and has three children. Lea sells groceries, such as rice, flour, and sugar, from a stand in the central market of the small town of Huanta. She has had her stand for the past three years. In addition, Lea sells candies in the high school cafeteria during the school season.

Elizabeth is 27 years old. She is married and has two children. Elizabeth raises animals, such as sheep. In addition, Elizabeth has a job as a housekeeper.

Emilia, Lea, and Elizabeth need loans of 300, 600, and 300 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to invest in rice, sugar, pasta, oil, lentils, peas, and meat.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Emilia, Lea, and Elizabeth plan to use their savings to buy land, build a home, and to pay for their children’s education. Their dreams are that they will have successful businesses and that their children will be happy and, eventually, be professionals.

loans.use: Emilia, Lea, and Elizabeth need loans of 300, 600, and 300 soles (3 soles = $1) to buy rice, sugar, pasta, oil, lentils, peas, and meat.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi L. is 50 years old, and her husband is 52 years old. She joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) in 2006. She uses her loans to buy piglets to breed. Besides that, she also makes alcohol (from rice) and sell to gain extra money for her weekL. payments. She uses the distiller's grain to feed the animals. Her first two loans (200-300USD) bring good, yet limited improvement to the quality of her life. In 2008, TYM Fund has changed some policy, so Mrs. L. wants to borrow 575USD to buy piglets and rice (to make alcohol). She hopes her famiL.'s immediate income of 150USD/month will increase this year.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Lý năm nay 50 tuổi còn chồng chị 52. Anh chị có 2 con đều đã ngoài 20 tuổi. Chị Lý tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2006. Vốn vay được chị đầu tư mua lợn giống. Kết hợp với nuôi lợn chị cũng nấu rượu để có tiền hoàn trả tuần và tận dụng bã rượu làm thức ăn gia súc. 2 vòng vốn đầu chị sử dụng mức vốn 200-300USD mang lại hiệu quả nhất định. Sang năm 2008, khi Quỹ có quy chế mới, chị Lý xin vay 575USD về mua lợn con và gạo để nấu rượu. Chị hi vọng mức thu nhập 150USD/tháng của gia đình sẽ được nâng lên trong năm nay.

loans.use: Buy pigs and rice

loans.name: Festa

texts.en:
Festa is 28 years old and is a single woman. Festa has sold soft drinks since 2005. Everyday, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more soft drinks items (soda, juice and water) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks items (soda, juice and water) for her business.

loans.name: Theong

texts.en:
Theong N. is 38-years-old and a traditional subsistence rice farmer in Kampong Cham. Her husband labors in the fields along side her day-by-day. Their combined income is around three dollars per day on what rice does not go towards feeding their family. They have four children, only one of who is married. One of their children works collecting recyclable items earning four dollars per day. Two of the daughters help their parents work crops and their work counts for an additional two dollars per day.

They want to take out a loan to first of all provide one of their children with a motorbike which he can use as a taxi. Besides using this as a taxi, their son who collects recyclable items will hook the motorbike to his cart to transport his daily stock up to the factory which will buy the items.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for business use

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina Blandón is a native of the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. With much effort, she looks for ways to improve her financial situation with the goal of continuing to manage the schooling of her three small children.

Today, she faces the need to make improvements to her home, which after starting to deteriorate, she began with its reconstruction but due to lack of funds, has had to do in phases until she can finish it. Today, she turns to Ceprodel with the goal of receiving a loan for the purchase of construction materials to continue with the maintenance of her home and offer the best possible living conditions to her children, who she loves dearly.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Agustina Blandón es originaria del municipio de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega y con mucho esfuerzo busca la manera de mejorar su situación económica con el propósito de continuar con el mantenimiento de los estudios de sus tres pequeños hijos.

Hoy en día atraviesa la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda por lo que al haber estado en deterioro comenzó a reconstruirla pero por falta del recurso económico lo ha venido haciendo por etapas hasta finalizar. Hoy en día acude a Ceprodel con el propósito de obtener el crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción para continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar y proporcionarle las mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos que tanto ama.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia, thanks to fruit and coffee production has been able to fulfill her role as a mother and sustain her home, give her family security, nutrition and care for her children. Now she wants to dedicate herself to the purchase and sale of fruit and for this she needs an adequate environment and to purchase fruit at wholesale. For this she requests a loan to acquire a store where she can begin her business without leaving her position producing fruit in the fields. She hopes for your support to begin her business that she thinks will better her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Celia, gracias a la producción de fruta (cítricos) y café ha podido cumplir con su rol de madre para el sostenimiento de su hogar, brindar seguridad, alimentación y cuidado a hijos. Ahora ella desea poder dedicarse a la compra y venta de frutas y para ello tienen que contar con un ambiente adecuado y la compra de fruta al por mayor.Para ello solicita un préstamo de dinero para el alquiler de una bodega donde pueda empezar su negocio sin dejar de lado su producción de cítricos en sus terrenos de cultivos. Ella estará esperando su apoyo para así iniciar su negocio con el que espera mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To obtain a place to sell her fruit.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Née en 1952, Monsieur G. Kodjo  n’a pas fait de brillantes études par manque de support financier. il s’est lancée dans la production de pépinières de café, cacao et la culture de palmier à huile dans le milieu. Le maigre revenu qu’il tire de ses activités ne couvre pas les charges des neuf personnes qu’il a en charge. Dynamique et travailleur il gère biens ses activités et sollicite un financement qui va lui servir d’acheter des graines pour les pépinières et des palmiers. Par ce crédit, il pourra augmenter son revenu pour mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1952, Mr. Kodjo G. was not able to succeed in school because he lacked financial means. He began to plant coffee and cocoa nurseries, and to grow palm nut trees in his fields. The meager income he makes from this business does not cover the expenses of the 9 people he is responsible for.

Dynamic and hard-working, he manages his businesses well and is asking for a loan that will serve him to buy seeds for his nurseries and his palm trees. With this loan, he will be able to increase his income so as to better contribute to the improvement of living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of seeds for coffee, cocoa, and oil palm plants

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr: Née le 20 novembre 1982 à Cotonou, dame A. Louise est célibataire sans enfants. Elle vit avec ses parents et n'est plus à leur charge. Elle vend des habits, des layettes et des chaussures qu'elle achete au Nigeria et au Togo. Pour augmenter son stock et pour repondre  à la demande sans cesse croissante de ses clients à la veille des fêtes de fin d'année, elle a sollicité ce prêt qui l'aidera à dynamiser son activité.
texts.en:
Born on November 20, 1982 in Cotonou, Ms. Louise A. is single and without children. She lives with her parents and is no longer in their care. She sells clothing, baby clothes, and shoes that she buys in Nigeria and in Togo. To increase her stock and to respond to the ever-growing demand of her customers on the eve of the year-end holidays, she has requested this loan, which will help her to pep up her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 100 outfits for chldren and 50 shoes

loans.name: Estaurofila

texts.es:
La Señora Estaurofila es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Cucardas II”, vive en la región y  provincia de San Martín, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, ya tiene 2 años en esta actividad y le esta yendo muy bien. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Prudencio Mendoza C-01 y sus clientes son mayormente los vecinos de su barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6  meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, juguetes, papel higiénico en paquetes, detergentes, jabones de diferentes marcas y tamaños, entre otros, para poder surtir bien su negocio y que sus clientes encuentren  lo que buscan. 

Estaurofila tiene 55 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 02 hijos que ya son independientes y quienes la apoyan en lo que ella se propone. Es una mujer trabajadora, que quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio. Su meta es la surtir más su negocio y poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Estaurofila is a member of the "Las Cucardas II" community bank. She lives in the region and province of San Martin, in the district of La Banda de Shilcayo. She runs a convenience store and she has been doing so for the last 2 years with great success. The business is located in her house in Jr. Prudencio Mendoza C-01 and her clients are primarily the neighbours from her area.

With this loan of S./1000 (which will be repaid in 6 months) she will pruchase basic needs products such as rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, preserves, toys, bathroom tissue, detergents, and soaps among others. She wishes to stock her business so that her clients always find what they are looking for.

Estaurofila is 55 years old and she lives with her husband and 2 children. Her children are independent now and provide her with the support that she needs. She is a very hard working woman and she wants to keep expanding her business. Her goal is to stock up her business so that she can meet her clients' demands.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic needs products (rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil etc.)

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

loans.name: Zrawarshah

texts.en:
This young man is Zrawarshah K.. He is married and the father of four children. He lives in Behsood, Jalalabad and is an educated man. He is the one active person supporting his family, and he works by farming on his land in the village.

Zrawarshah has three daughters and one son. His son is 5 years old. Zrawarshah is a working man. He grows different vegetables on his land, and he sells them in the bazaar. Now he wants to expand his business, but he needs a 40,000AF ($850 US) individual loan for 27 months to increase his business. For this, he requested that AFSG lenders give him 40,000AF so he can buy some seed and another things for his land.

He says, "Thanks Kiva lenders who support poor people in Afghanistan."

loans.use: To buy seeds and insecticide for his land.

loans.name: Ana Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is a member of the Amor y Esperanza (“Love and Hope”) Village Bank. She sells traditional ice cream from the Muyuchi region, which is maD. with milk, sugar and sesame seeds. She also sells a variety of chichas (traditional homemaD. wines) maD. from corn, peanuts and other fruits in the city's central market.

Nieves needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy sugar, sesame seeds and peanuts.

Nieves’s dreams are to save up for old age, for her children to graduate with professional degrees, and to have her own investment capital.

loans.use: Buy sugar, sesame seeds and peanuts

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La señora Teodora, socia del  B.C. “Santa Ana”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia y distrito de Moyabamba, ella tiene su salón de belleza  en su propia casa, en la que se dedica a cortar  y teñir  el cabello de damas, caballeros y niños, asimismo da servicio de manicure, pedicure y vende productos de belleza de la línea LIFE, actividad para la que esta capacitada, por lo que su trabajo es bien reconocida en la ciudad. 

Con este préstamo de  S/. 2 500.00, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará materiales que utiliza diariamente como: tintes en diferentes colores y marcas por docenas, shampoo, cremas para cuerpo y manos por docenas, y productos para el cuidado del cabello de la línea LIFE, asimismo parte del dinero lo invierte en la construcción de departamentos que piensa alquilarlos mas adelante una vez terminados. 

La señora Teodora tiene 47  años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijo quienes aun dependen de ella, anhela terminar de construir los departamentos así como mantener su salón bien arreglado.
texts.en:
Ms. Teodora, a member of the “Santa Ana” microfinance institute, lives in the San Martin Region of the province and district of Moyabamba. She has her own beauty salon in her house. She does haircuts and dyes for men, women and children. She also provides manicures and pedicures, as well as sells LIFE beauty products. She is qualified for this business, which is why she is well-known in the city.

With this 2,500.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 6 monthly installments, she will purchase supplies that she uses daily, such as: hair dye in different shades and brands by the dozen, shampoo, hand and body lotion by the dozen, and LIFE hair care products. She will also invest some of the loan in building apartments that she plans on renting out once they have been finished.

Ms. Teodora is 47 years old, and lives with her husband and 4 dependent children. She wishes to finish construction of the apartments and have a well-kept beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty supplies and invest in construction of apartments

loans.name: Adjété Kokuvi

texts.fr: Monsieur A. kokouvi vit dans le quartier de sagbado à adjidogomé, il a pour activité génératrice de revenus la vente d’huile à moteur à Adjidogomé, il fait ce commece depuis 2005.il n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES et il demande son premier prêt pour acheter de  en grande quantité de l’huile à moteur. Il est célibataire mais il a un enfant à sa charge
texts.en:
Mr. Kokuvi A. lives in the Sagbado neighborhood of Adjidogomé. To earn money, he sells motor oil in his neighborhood. This has been his occupation since 2005. He has never had a loan from WAGES, and is requesting his first one to purchase a large quantity of motor oil. He is a bachelor, but he has a child to support.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of motor oil

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en:
Dilshod A. is 27 years old and is married. His wife stays at home but is currently training to be a hairdresser. She wants to open a salon so that she can supplement her husband’s income. Dilshod sells hay for animals at his house and at the market. He buys the hay wholesale from local farmers. Having been working on this business for 9 years already, he has become a well-known seller of hay in his village and has many customers who buy hay only from him. The price he charges for hay is based on the quantity that his customer buys.

Dilshod also offers a discount to his regular buyers, to those customers who come to him often. With a loan from IMON International, Dilshod plans to increase his stock in order to fully meet the demand of his growing customer base. He says that the demand is there and his problem is being able to supply enough hay. The well-being of this young family is in your hands.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: buying more hay for re-sale

loans.name: Catalina Sobeyda

texts.es:
En el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Catalina R. con gran esfuerzo se dedica a su actividad de venta de productos de madera como canastos y sombreros y a la vez vende almohadas y panas de plástico.

Es muy visitada a diario y como mujer muy trabajadora y sabia ha acudido a Ceprodel porque requiere de un crédito para la compra de los productos y así continuar comercializándolos en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the Chinandega city Central market Mrs. Catalina R., with great effort, sells her wood products such as baskets and hats and also sells pillows and plastic items. She has many customers every day and as a very hardworking and wise woman she has approached Ceprodel because she needs a loan to buy her products and in this way continue selling them in her locale.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of products

loans.name: Diouma

texts.en: Diouma is married and has been a member of the Bayof Pout village bank for three and a half years.  She sells fruit in season, which depending on the season, could be mandarins, papayas, oranges, mangoes, and/or melons.  She intends to use the loan to purchase fruits in bulk and to strengthen her business.  The profits will be used to pay for the care of her children.

loans.use: Purchase frut in bulk.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es: Leoncio tiene 55 años, es viudo y vive con su hija en su casa propia. Desde hace 4 años se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en motocarro, recorre todas las calles  de su localidad ofreciendo este servicio a todas las personas que le soliciten. Se levanta temprano para poder captar más clientes, de esta manera obtener los ingresos necesarios para solventar los gastos de los estudios del menor de sus hijos. Leoncio está muy pendiente del estado de funcionamiento de su movilidad, pues de ello depende su buen trabajo, actualmente hay gran demanda de este servicio, y aunque han aumentando los motocarros en su zona, él sigue trabajando confiado en su capacidad para superar la competencia. Para el futuro, Leoncio está pensando adquirir otra movilidad del mismo tipo que pueda alquilar a otro chofer e incrementar sus ganancias. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, fue invitado a formar parte de su actual equipo porque conocen de su persona y tiene buenas referencias de él. Por su parte, Leoncio se compromete a ser un compañero más que aporte positivamente a su banco comunal. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de un nuevo cobertor para su movilidad y pagar el manteniendo de su motor.
texts.en:
Leoncio is 55 years old, is a widow, and lives with his daughter in his own house. For 4 years, he has dedicated himself to transporting passengers in a “motocarro” [a vehicle with 3 wheels]. He travels through all the streets of his town, offering this service to anyone who requests it. He gets up early in order to gain more clients. This way he obtains the income necessary to cover the expenses for his youngest son’s education. Leoncio is very devoted to the functionality of his vehicle, on which his work depends. Currently, there is a lot of demand for this service, and although the number of “motocarros” in his area has increased, he continues to work, confident in his ability to beat the competition. For the future, Leoncio is thinking of a acquiring another vehicle of the same type that he can rent to another driver and increase his earnings. This is the first time that he has had a loan with MFP. He was invited to be a part of its current team because they knew of him and he had good references. For his part, Leoncio promises to be a partner and to positively support his community bank. The money that he is requesting is to buy a new cover for his vehicle and to pay for the maintenance of his “moto”.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain his vehicle and to buy a new cover

loans.name: Mavila

texts.es:
La señora Mavila tiene 55 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen del Carmen y  vive en el sector Santa Rosa del sector de Cochaya  caserío de Salpo,  provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudio hasta quinto grado de primaria, pero no continuó estudiando debido a que no contaba con el apoyo de sus padres, pues su situación económica era muy precaria.
Se unió con su pareja a los 35 años y actualmente tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales solo uno trabaja independientemente.
Su actividad económica consiste en la venta de gaseosas, galletas y compra-venta de quesos.
Su primer crédito fue de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas lo que invirtió en su negocio.
Con este crédito de 500 soles, el cual cancelará en 6 cuotas, comprará quesos e insumos para la implementación de su bodega.
Mavila sueña con tener un negocio muy grande.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mavila is 55 years old. She belongs to the Virgin of Carmen Community Bank and lives in the area of Santa Rosa in Cochaya in the hamlet of Salpo in the province of Otuzco, La Libertad, Perú. She has studied until fifth grade of primary school, but she didn’t continue studying because she didn’t have the support of her parents, because their financial situation was very precarious. She has been married with her husband for 35 years and, at present, she has 5 children, of whom only one works independently. She sells sodas, cookies, and buys and sells cheeses. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she repaid in 4 installments, and she invested it in her business. With this loan of 500 soles, which she will repay in 6 installments, she will buy cheese and supplies to stock her store. Mavila dreams of having a very big business.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheese and supplies to stock her store

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en: Mrs. Lucena O. is a 53-year-old married mother of 3.  She currently lives in Dipolog City.  She raises pigs while her husband drives their motorcycle for hire.  Lucena has been an active member in Paglaum MPC for years and has already received several loans for her pig raising.  She is requesting what will be her 7th loan, which amounts to 14,000 Phillipine pesos (or about $300 US), to purchase spare parts and labor for their motorcycle.

loans.use: Spare parts and labor for motorcycle repair

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Hà Nguyễn Thị (1803070677) is a 40-year-old female living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has two adult children.

Hà owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2007, Hà joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

Hà is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 4th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en: Rasela A., 47, is married with 6 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the plantation business.  She sells to the general public 5 days per week.  Rasela has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala.  SPBD loans are Rasela’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, fertilizer, knifes, wheelbarrow, weed killer.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is 56 years old. She is widowed and is the mother of six children. Currently all her children are schooling.

Anastasia is a trader who deals in assorted products like cooking utensils and plastic bowls like lunch boxes, etc. She mostly sells through hawking - that is, house to house selling. She has been trading for ten years now and has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her.

Anastasia treks to Kumasi to purchase her stock of cooking utensils. Recently she has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock. She requests a loan to buy more supplies of the products she sells like cooking utensils, etc. With the loan she believes she will be more resourced to make lots of profits in order to build a store to reduce the frequent walking on the street to sell. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To increase her stock of cooking utensils to sell

loans.name: Aleta

texts.en:
Aleta V. is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Salamumu Tai.  She is married with one school-aged child.  To make a living, Aleta raises crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from planting and harvesting bananas for sale.  Aleta has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 800 WST a month.

Aleta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Aleta has successfully repaid a previous loan, to purchase general farm supplies and equipment, of 750 WST from SPBD.  Aleta is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used for the same purpose.  The loan will be her fifth loan from SPBD.  Aleta plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion I. is from the village of Westfield, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 60 years old. Adoracion is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Adoracion owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Adoracion has been engaged in her business for over 45 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Adoracion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adoracion is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Adoracion from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Westfield, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Orienta

loans.name: Zuely Del Pilar

texts.es:
Zuely es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Caña”  que esta ubicado de el distrito de Plateria, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 24 años de edad, estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos y estudio educación superior incompleta (Contabilidad ultimo siglo), vive en Plateria.

Zuley trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de golosinas. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 700.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de galletas, chocolates, caramelos, gaseosas, etc. Para vender en su tienda.

Su mayor sueño es terminar su carrera.
A ella le gustan los ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos
texts.en:
Zuely es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Caña” que esta ubicado de el distrito de Plateria, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 24 años de edad, estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos y estudio educación superior incompleta (Contabilidad ultimo siglo), vive en Plateria. Zuley trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para la compra de golosinas. En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 700.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de galletas, chocolates, caramelos, gaseosas, etc. Para vender en su tienda. Su mayor sueño es terminar su carrera. A ella le gustan los ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos Zuely is a member of the Community Bank "Senor de la Cana" that is located in the Plateria district, Puno Province, Puno Department. She is 24, single, with no children. She didn't complete her high school (last term of Accounting). She lives in Plateria. Zuely has worked with the Manual Ramos organization for 2 years. Her first loan was 300 new sols to buy candy. Presently she is requesting a loan of 700 new sols to buy cookies, chocolates, candy, soft drinks, etc, to sell in her store. Her greatest dream is to finish her studies. She likes the savings and the loan terms.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cookies, chocolates, soft drinks, etc to sell in her store

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is 27 years old and married to Ginalyn. He is a bread vendor in their village, and mainly sells pandesal, a bread famous in the country. Aside from selling pandesal, Dennis would like to buy additional baked breads and pastries to further increase his income. He also works as a part-time driver to meet the needs of his family, and is doing his best to lift his family out of poverty.

Dennis is requesting additional business capital of 4,000 PHP. In his daily vending routine, Dennis is able to sustain the needs of his family with his daily income of 200 PHP. With the loan he is taking from Kiva lenders, Dennis hopes to improve his bread-vending business. One day, he dreams of having his own baker's shop.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Peter Ndungu

texts.en:
Peter is married to Faith and they have three children, Samuel, Elizabeth and Irene.

The client has been in the herbal clinic business for three years and he was introduced to KADET by an existing client group. He has no previous credit history. The loan that Peter wants will be used to increase his stock of food supplements which are in high demand.

Peter's area of business is densely populated with middle level residents; he relies on the sick who have been advised by the doctors to depend on specified food supplements. With the extra profit the client intends to open another shop at an already identified business location.

The client hopes to become a reliable supplier of food supplement and he describes himself focused and determined.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: The loan will be used to increase Peter's stock of food suppliments which are in high demand.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta D. C. is from the village of San Antonio. She is 39 years old. Julieta is married and has 12 school-aged children. To make a living, Julieta owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Julieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used for additional working capital for the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Julieta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and improve the living conditions of her family.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly A., 35, is a married mother blessed with one teenage child who is studying at the local public school. She currently makes a living selling various cooking supplies from her home. She usually buys her produce items in bulk on credit, which she pays from her income after she finishes selling. She typically generates an income of $3.50 each day to help contribute to her family’s insufficient daily needs. Her husband assists with her in the business (he appears in the picture). Ly A. will be using her loan to accumulate the necessary quantity of cooking supplies to sell.

loans.use: To buy cooking supplies for resale

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en:
Melvin, 49, is a farmer from Norala, South Cotabato. He works very hard on his one hectare (2.5 acre) rice field in order to have a good harvest.

Melvin is married to Ailyn and they have three children. His eldest child is only 9 years old.

Melvin heard about Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and that it offers financial support for entrepreneurs. He joined CEVI and is requesting a loan of 15,000 Php. This amount will be very helpful to him, enabling him to invest more in his rice-farming business.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia JUSTINA tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Ella es natural D. la ciudad D. Cusco. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO” D. la Asociación Arariwa. 

La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el negocio D. venta leña. Ella distribuye leña a restaurantes, picanterías, pollerias y hornos. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio D. compra y venta D. leña.         
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Justina is 49, married, and has five children. She is from Cusco. She belongs to the Ricchary Cusco Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association. She alternates her activities between the home and her business of selling firewood. She distributes the wood the restaurants, specialty restaurants, poultry shops, and outdoor ovens. She has had the business for several years. It has been going very well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. She is an enterprising and hard-working mother who gets her family ahead. She needs the loan to increase the capital in her business of buying and selling firewood. She is happy for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital in her business of buying and selling firewood

loans.name: Carmen Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Carmen del Socorro C. tiene 36 años de edad, vive en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, es casada y su esposo trabaja como técnico y brinda un aporte a la economía del hogar. Los planes a futuro de la señora C. es la adquisición de un Local en San Carlos Rio San Juan, para invertir en un negocio y que los dos hijos mayores lo administren. La señora Carmen se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 16 años y desea solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de materales agricolas para mantenimiento a sus cultivos de piña, esta inversión traerá mayores ingresos que harán que la señora C. obtenga los recursos económicos para darle a sus hijos el negocio para que ellos lo administren brindándole un trabajo fijo que se convertirá en la fuente de ingresos para estos y la familia de ellos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen del Socorro C. is 36 years old, she lives in Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, she is married and her husband works as a technician and provides economic support for the home. Mrs. C.'s future plans are to buy premises at San Carlos Rio San Juan to invest in a business to be administered by her two elder children. Mrs. Carmen has been dedicated to agriculture since she was 16 years old and wants to apply for a loan to invest in the purchase of farming material to maintain the growing of pineapple. This investment will provide higher income and Mrs. C. will have economical resources for the business to be administered by her children thus providing them with a stable job that will create income for them as well as for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural material.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Mrs. Tha N., who lives in Sophi village in Takeo province, is 40 years old. She is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land on which she cultivates rice to support her family's living costs. Her husband, Mr. Mory Khoeum, is a palm juice collector. He is presented on the right of the photo. 

Mrs. Tha N. has obstacles in her rice farming as she has to spend more money on hiring a laborer with two cows to plow the field. Thus, Mrs. Tha N. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows so they could plow the field themselves. Mrs. Tha N. is the mother of three children two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy two cows so they can plow their field themselves

loans.name: Avaz

texts.en: Avaz is 50 years old and lives with his wife and their two children. He has the best intentions for his children and this allows him to continue improving as a father and farmer. Avaz is a man who, from an early age, was characterized as a hard-worker who is very dedicated to his agricultural work raising cattle. He saw this as an activity that would enable him to have additional income due to the high demand for these animals in the markets. His son (pictured) is also engaged in this business. The challenge is to improve the breed but in order to do so, Avaz must feed them properly. This farmer yearns to expand his business so that he will be able to improve his family’s standard of living. In order to do so he is asking for a loan which will allow him to buy animals of a better breed in order to improve their quality. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle of a better breed

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María A. de 25 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, es soltera.

María empezó con un restaurante pequeño pero no le resulto y decidió poner una pequeña tienda en su casa vendiendo sus primeros productos como arroz, azúcar.

Ahora María trabaja desde las 06h30 hasta las 23h00 todos los días vende en su tienda bebidas, confitería, arroz, azúcar, artículos para papelería etc. Trabaja en conjunto con su mama, no ha tenido inconvenientes hasta ahora en su tienda. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, bebidas, vegetales para su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener su propio Minimarket y ya tener su propia familia.
texts.en:
María A., 25, lives in "El Suburbio," an urban neighborhood in Guayaquil. Her home is made of cement and has all of the basic services. She is single. Maria started out with a small restaurant, but this business did not work out, so she decided to put a small store in her house where she sells basic necessities such as rice and sugar. Now Maria works from 6:30 in the morning until 11 at night every day selling drinks, sweets, rice, sugar, paper products, etc. She works along with her mother, and so far she has not had any difficulties with her store. With the loan she wants to buy rice, drinks, and vegetables for her store. In the future, when she has her own family, she wants to have her own Minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, drinks and vegetables

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites C. is from the village of Lunao in Gingoog City. She is 35 years old. Marites is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over four years, and she earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marites is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be the second loan taken out by Marites from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Alima Farida Group

texts.en:
Anis Gull is the group leader of the Alima Farida group. She lives in District 15 of Kabul Afghanistan. She is married with six children who are all school students. She is a hard working woman and has a shared business with her husband. Her husband sells vegetables and fruits in a cart in the market. 
She buys the fresh vegetables and fruits at low prices and then cleans them all and packs them too. Then her husband sells them at a very good price.
They are very glad to be working together and supporting their children. She needs the loan to purchase different kinds of vegetable and fruits, especially the ones that are more in demand in the market. She hopes this shared business will grow in the future and she will be able to give her children a better education.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Archival

texts.en:
31-year-old Archival is a hardworking father to three children. He is married to Melania. He is involved in fishing and just started a small store that his wife manages. He says that he prays to God for his business to prosper and for strength to withstand all the challenges he faces. Like other fathers, he wants to give his children proper education.

Archival applied to CEVI and asks for a loan of PHP 9,000. He will use it to buy an engine for his boat and hopefully other fishing materials. This loan will help him catch more fish to sell.

loans.use: Engine for boat

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, tiene 25 años y es soltera. Su principal actividad económica es ayudar a su tía Danila en la compra, distribución y vender artefactos en los mercados y centros comerciales como por ejemplo, al mercado “Molino I” y a los  Centros Comercial “Confraternidad” y “Paraíso” de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella nos cuenta que viaja a la ciudad de Tacna a traer los artefactos junto con su tía. Ya son 5 meses que ayuda a su tía en el negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

Mercedes es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para comprar artefactos y de esa forma independizarse de su tía.   

Mercedes pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” de la Asociación Arariwa es socia nueva. El banco comunal tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, la socia manifiesta, que se encuentra contenta y satisfecha con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación que brinda la Asociación. 

Mercedes se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 25, is single. Her main economic activity is helping her aunt Danila to buy, distribute and sell artifacts in markets and shopping centers like the “Molino I” market and the “Confraternidad” and “Paraíso” shopping centers in Cusco. She tells us that she and her aunt travel to the city of Tacna to get the artifacts. She has been helping her aunt with the business for 5 months and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Mercedes is a young, hard-working, enterprising woman who is always looking for opportunities to get ahead in life and, through her own daily efforts, help her family. She needs funds to buy artifacts for herself so that she can become independent from her aunt. Mercedes is a new member of Asociación Arariwa’s “LOS DIAMANTES” (The Diamonds) communal bank. The bank has been in 10 operational cycles. She states that she is happy and content with the credit services, the savings and the training she gets from the association. Mercedes is grateful for the opportunity offered through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy artifacts.

loans.name: Nhey

texts.en: Mrs. Nhey T. is 44 years old. She is a villager who lives in Prey Ta Mau village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Mos Toun, are farmers who own a four-hectare piece of land to cultivate rice for a living. Mrs. Nhey T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to hire a laborer to plow her farm. Aside from farming, Mr. Mos Toun is a duck breeder who earns a small income to support his family. This couple has three children who all are students. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to hire a laborer to plow her farm.

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people comprise a village bank that is located in Preak AncH. Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Vanna P., who is 36 years old, was selected by the members to be the village bank president. The members of this village bank will use their portions of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Vanna P. sells vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Varng Parng, is a fisherman. With these businesses, they can earn a small income to support their family. Mrs. Vanna P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to support her business and to buy fishnets and fix up her husband's fishing boat to support her husband's business. This couple has four children. Three of the children are students who also support their parents' businesses. The youngest one is 4 years old.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fishing nets, and repair her husband's fishing boat

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria B. is from the village of Magsaysay Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Maria is married and has two adult children. Maria owns and operates a specialized retail store that sells daily use products such as coconut wine ("tuba"), some food for snacks, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Maria has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Maria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from GDMPC, which was for 5,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital.

Maria is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to purchase additional products to sell

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.es:
Las Sras: Petra que se dedica a la venta de perfumes por catalogo, Margarita Hdez a la venta de artículos para el hogar y ropa,  Micaela a la venta de artículos por catalogo y prendas de oro, Margarita M. y Roberta M. tienen una tiendita de abarrotes y Lina Cortés vende en la cooperativa de la secundaria de su localidad comida y refrescos, ellas  conforman el grupo SAN MIGUEL (FLAT),  todas acordaron en ponerle este nombre por que el día 29 de mayo le festejan a su ángel san miguel arcángel y para ellas es muy importante este día especial en su localidad, san  miguel Atlacahualoya, axochiapan, Morelos.
Esta vez hablaremos de doña Mago como le llaman sus amigas a la señora Margarita Hdez, ella lleva mas de 20 años vendiendo sus artículos para el hogar y ropa para dama y niño (a), tiene 62 años de edad esta casada con el sr. Jesús Gutiérrez, desde hace 46 años, tiene  4 hijos los cuales llevan por nombre: Maria azucena de 33 años (casada), roció de 28 años (casada), cesar de 27 años (soltero), Idalia de 26 años (casada). 

Platica que los créditos le han sido muy útiles para su negocio, y ahora con este crédito quiere surtir mucho mas su negocios y para un futuro necesita levantar un local y condicionarlo para que ahí ella pueda vender, por que donde ella tiene su mercancía es adentro de su casa en la sala y por esta razón le gustaría tener su local.

Ella inicio con el grupo desde hace 4 ciclos a todas las invito la sra. Petra. 
"Petra busco nuevamente a  Fundacion Realidad, para que pudieramos tener la oportunidad de trabajar con sus créditos, ésto es muy bueno para todas, de echo gracias a los créditos recibidos yo he podido ampliar mis negocios que me ayudaron a sacar adelante a todos mis hijos que ahora ya son grandes" comenta Mago.

Todas dan gracias a Fundacion Realidad y a kiva por ser  empresas humanitarias, por confiar en ellas y por la oportunidad, no los defraudaremos.
texts.en:
The women who make up the communal bank "San Miguel" are: Mrs. Petra, who makes a living selling perfume from a catalog, Mrs. Margarita Hdez, who sells home-goods and clothing, Mrs. Micaela, who sells merchandise from catalogs and gold jewelry, Mrs. Margarita M. and Mrs. Roberta M. have a small grocery store, and Mrs. Lin C. sells food and drinks in the local high school. The whole group agreed on the name "San Miguel" because they celebrate the arc-angel Saint Michael on May 29th and this is very special day for them and in their area -- Saint Michael Atlacahualy Axochiapan Morelos. This time we will talk about Mrs. Mago, which is what Margarita Hdez's friends call her. She has been selling home-goods and women's and children's clothing for twenty years. She is sixty-two years old and has been married to Mr. Jesus Gutierrez Idalia for twenty-six years. She tells us that the loans have been very useful for her business and with this loan she wants to really stock her business. At some point in the future, she needs to get a stall and set it up somewhere so she can sell because right now she has her merchandise in the living room of her home (which is why she wants to have her own stall). She joined the group four cycles ago because she was invited by Mrs. Petra (who invited everyone). "Petra looked at Fundacion Realidad so we could have the opportunity to work with their loans; this is very good for everyone. In fact, thanks to the loans I have received, I have been able to grow my businesses which has helped me get all of my children ahead now that they are big," Mago said. Everyone is grateful to Fundacion Realidad and to Kiva for being humanitarian organizations, for trusting in us, and for the opportunity. We will not deceive you.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise, home-goods, and women's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Deysi Liliana

texts.es:
Deysi tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres, una familia de agricultores, en el sector San Pablo, una zona rural que pertenece al distrito de Pomalca, sus principales actividades con la agricultura y la crianza y venta de animales menores.

Deysi se dedica a la crianza y venta de cuyes, ella cuenta con varios ejemplares de este roedor oriundo de la serranía del Perú y de carne muy estimada. Cría a sus animales en un ambiente despejado, ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio y los vende principalmente a sus vecinos, aunque también los  vende a personas que viven en lugares aledaños. Con esta actividad ella solventa sus gastos personales y apoya a sus padres con el mantenimiento de la economía familiar.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta de animales con la compra de aves de corral, para ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Deysi es una joven emprendedora y que siempre trata de dar lo mejor de si para salir adelante. Sus amigos y conocidos de la zona le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Deysi is a 19-year-old woman who lives with her parents, a family of farmers, in the San Pablo sector, a rural zone that belongs to the Pomalca district. Her main activities are agriculture and raising and selling small animals.

Deysi raises and sells guinea pigs for a living. She has several of these rodents, which are native to the mountainous region of Peru, and whose meat is greatly esteemed. She raises her animals in an open environment, located to the rear of her house. She sells them mainly to her neighbors, but she also sells them to people who live in the surrounding communities. With this business, she is able to cover her personal expenses, as well as help her parents with the family expenses.

She hopes to expand her animal breeding business by purchasing fowl. In order to do so, she needs to request a 500.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time, which will help her reach her objective.

Deysi is a young entrepreneur who is always trying to give her best so that she can get ahead in life. Her friends and acquaintances in the area esteem her and are very fond of her.


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fowl to expand animal business

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Madame Aissatou N. est une femme mariée. Elle habite dans la localité de Bambilor. 
Elle a choisi l’activité  de commerce pour soutenir son mari.  Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus c’est l’aspect lucratif de cette activité  qui lui permet de gagner des revenus. Elle pratique depuis 10 ans l’achat et la vente de légumes .Elle est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis le mois de mai 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 150 000 frs qui est prévu pour l’achat de  piment, choux et carottes  dans le but de renforcer son activité. 
Madame N. a un projet d’achat d’une armoire c’est la raison pour laquelle elle pense que l’accroissement de son fond de roulement pourrait lui générer  des bénéfices plus  consistants ce qui lui permettra de réaliser  son rêve. Madame N. souhaite améliorer le cadre de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Aissatou N. is a married woman who lives in the town of Bambilor. She chose this business to support her husband. Of greatest interest to her is the lucrative nature of this business, which allows her to earn an income. She has been buying and selling vegetables for ten years. Ms. N. has been a member of the Bambilor branch since May 2010. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs CFA for buying chili peppers, cabbage, and carrots with the goal of bolstering her business. Her plans are to buy an armoire. This is why she thinks that the increase in her working capital will be able to generate steadier profits for her. And this will enable her to realize her dream. She wishes to improve her family's living situation.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her working capital

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha U. (pictured) is 31 and has been a silk weaver since 1995. Her husband, Mr. Rayut Choun, 35, has been a construction worker for more than six years. They have been married since 2002. 

Chantha is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma D. J. is from the village of San Juan, Alicia, Isabela. She is 41 years old. Norma is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Norma owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4000 PHP when she sells her raised animal.

In 2010, Norma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Norma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Djamilzade

texts.ru:
Djamilzade E. 24 let. Ona ne zamujem i jivet vmeste so svoyey semyoy v Absheron regione. E. zakonchila shkolu a potom postupila v universitet.

Molodoy chelovek kotoroqo vi videte na fotoqrafii eto Brat Elvini Mahammad. Uje 7 let kak oni zanimayutsya etim biznessom perevozki stroitelnix materialov. Eto semeyniy bizness eyo otec toje zanimayetsya perevozkoy stroy materialov on i nauchil svoyeqo sina etomu biznessu. Seychas oni nujdayutsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kuput zapchasti dlya mashini.
texts.en:
