E. Djamilzade is 24 years old. She is single. She lives with her relatives in the Absheron Region. She has finished high school and is now a university student. The young man you see in the photo is E.’s brother Mahammad. He has been in the business of transporting construction materials for 7 years. This is a family business; his father also transports construction materials, and taught this business to his son. At present Mahammad needs 2,000 AZN in order to purchase automotive spare parts.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts

loans.name: C2354 Twiyubake Group

texts.en:
Leatitie is 33 years old and married with four children. The oldest one is 11 and the youngest one is 3 years old. Leatitie's husband is a driver and both work hard to develop their family, In addition to that, Leatitie is group leader of the group called TWIYUBAKE in their local language. All members of this group have different business such as a store selling various products, a pub, selling clothes and so on. Leatitie sells cow meat. 

Leatitie is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business through by purchasing more products. With the expansion, the group members expect to be able to satisfy their customers.

loans.use: To purchase cows for their meat

loans.name: Pat

texts.en:
Mr. Pat K., age 36, and his wife, Mrs. Horm Vat, age 37 (pictured) have a furniture-making business. In addition to assisting her husband in his business, Mrs. Horm Vat works as a local farmer. Mr. Pat Pheng makes his products from wood and rattan, which he purchases from middlemen at a reasonable cost. His finished products are primarily such items as beds and cupboards. 

His business is thriving because he sells his items to his customers at a reasonable price. In order to better satisfy current demand, Mr. Pat K. seeks a loan to purchase wood in order to build rattan cupboards for sale.

Mr. Pat K. and his wife are residents of Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. They have three school-aged children who help their parents make furniture when they have time available from studying.

loans.use: To purchase wood in order to build rattan cupboards for sale

loans.name: Jumaboy

texts.en:
Jumaboy is married with four children. He owns a business selling household goods. Jumaboy is full of ideas. He has rich experience working in this business. Moreover, he is very enthusiastic about his own small enterprise and has a good attitude. Jumaboy sets high goals and takes daily action to achieve them. He has been in this business for 10 years. Jumaboy would like to get a loan of $3,000 USD to increase his working capital. He believes financial assistance will support him in his endeavors. He is determined to work on his entrepreneurial dreams to make them a reality, understanding that real success and wealth take time. Jumaboy is hoping to generate more profit and provide for his children, who study in school now. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing household goods in order to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is 30 years old. She is married and has three children between the ages of five and ten. Two of her children go to school. She is married and her husband sells various commodities in the local market. 

Frida sells goats and has had this business for five years. With this loan she will buy more goats to sell. With the profit from this business, she will renovate her house. 

Because her business is successful, Frida has been able to build a house and install electricity in it. She would like to make 92% return on her investments.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
From Kitale town in western Kenya, 36-year-old Joseph C. has been farming for seven years. A married father of four school-aged children who all attend school, he produces on his mixed farm milk, maize and beans, all of which are sold locally. He is also a casual worker at Kenya Seed Company in Kitale town.

Joseph is requesting this loan of 65,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle. He says that the income obtained from this added source of income will make life more comfortable because he will be able to afford the basic needs of his family and some small luxury. He hopes to purchase another motorcycle in the future to enable him to take a contract for transporting the milk of those farmers in the interior region of Kitale.

Joseph says that his biggest challenge arises during the rainy season when the roads are sometimes very poor, causing him to lose business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Parbati L.. She is married and has two children, aged 14 and 12. In 2004, she established her cow-raising business. Working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and will use her most recent to buy a young, milk-giving cow. In the future, Parbati plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI (microfinance institution), Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates by joining the BPW Kiva lending team.

loans.use: To buy a young, milk-giving cow

loans.name: Benoite

texts.en:
Benoite is 48 years old and is married with 5 children aged between five and 26. Her husband is a driver, while Benoite owns a general store. She has been in this business for 10 years and her store is open daily from 6 in the morning until 9 at night.

Benoite has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via the Vision Finance Company to purchase more products for her shop. This loan will help her to increase profits and Benoite hopes to pay school fees for her children and save money for the future.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia R. is from the village of Mangga. She is 45 years old. Inocencia is married and has three school-aged children.

Inocencia owns and operates a business growing crops, with the main source of income coming primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 7000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2010, Inocencia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by her from ASKI. Inocencia is requesting a new loan of 23000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops

loans.name: Ayde

texts.es: Ayde tiene 29 años, vive en casa de sus padres, en compañía de ellos y de su hijo. Hace más de 3 años se dedica a vender productos de segunda mano como ropa, muebles  entre otros artículos, en la feria comercial de su ciudad, sus padres le enseñaron a vender estos productos y en la actualidad se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos. Desde entonces cada fin de semana, se abastece de mercadería, en donde se dedica a recolectar cualquier producto en desuso para luego llevarlos a vender. Por otro lado, vende algunos artículos agrícolas como semillas y fertilizantes, en donde viaja a zonas rurales para ofrecerlos a los campesinos. Considera  que la venta de artículos usados es más rentable porque le genera buenas ganancias y en adelante desea seguir trabajando en este negocio y adquirir más puestos de venta. Es su crédito numero 13 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en artículos en desuso.
texts.en:
Ayde is 29 years old and lives in her parents' home with her parents and her son.  She has been selling second-hand goods such as clothes, furniture and other products for more than three years in her local market.  Her parents taught her to sell these products and it is currently her main source of income.  Every weekend she stocks up with merchandise.  She collects any used products that she can later sell.

Ayde also sells agricultural supplies such as seeds and fertilizers.  She travels to rural areas to sell them to farmers.  She considers selling second-hand goods to be the most profitable business.  It makes her good profits.  In the future, she would like to continue working in this business and acquire more sales locations.

This is Ayde's 13th loan from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She has always proven herself to be responsible in making her loan repayments and she likes being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She is grateful to those who will help fund her loan as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan in buying more used products to sell.

loans.use: To buy more used products

loans.name: Ligia Celestina

texts.es:
La Señora Ligia C. es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Porvenir, vive en la comunidad de San Capac en la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura. Muchos han migrado en busca de mejor trabajo para entregarle un mejor futuro para sus hijos.

Doña Ligia tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 20, 19, 13, 8 y 5 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja solo para sus gastos, su segunda hija trabaja y estudia a distancia, su hija de 13 años ayuda en casa y también estudia a distancia, su hijo de 8 años estudia en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo labora como jornalero, con el trabajo en conjunto han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Ligia se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos ya que pasa en casa al cuidado de sus hijos pero también cría  animales como: cerdos, cuyes y pollos  que los vende en su comunidad.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 9 años, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más pollos. Su meta es  crecer en su negocio y que sus hijos se superen en la vida.
texts.en:
Ligia C. is a member of the 'Nuevo Porvenir' (New Future) community bank.  She lives in San Capac community, in Cumbe parish.  This area has a cold climate.  Its people work in sales, raising livestock and farming crops.  Many have migrated in search of a better job so that they can provide their children with a better future.

Ligia is 36 years old, married, and has 5 children aged 20, 19, 13, 8 and 5.  Her eldest child (a son) works to cover his expenses, her second child (a daughter) works and is taking a distance-learning course.  Her 13 year-old daughter helps in the house and her 8 year-old son is attending a local elementary school.  Her husband works as a laborer.  Through their joint work, they have managed to build their own home.

Ligia takes care of her housework as she stays at home looking after her children.  However, she also raises animals such as pigs, guinea pigs and chickens which she sells in her community.  She has been a member of her community bank for 9 years.  She will invest her loan money in buying more chickens.  Her goal is to grow in her business and for her children to do well in life.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Libelulas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Las Libelulas" se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de México esta integrado por 10 clientas una de las integrantes es la señora Maria Teresa M., tiene 45 años de edad, estudio la educacion secundaria, tiene 25 años de casada con el señor Sergio V. con quien tiene 4 hijas el señor es chofer desde hace mas de 10 años, ella comenta que el prestamo lo utilizará para poder incrementar sus ventas en su negocio de loncheria comprando insumos para la elaboracion de comida y muebles para la comodidad de sus clientes, ademas de poder ofrecer una variedad de comida, así lograr obteniendo mas ingreso y apoyor a su marido con los gastos de su familia. La señora Maria esta muy agradecida por el apoyo para cumplir sus sueños. Observaciones la señora que no se ve bien en la foto se llama Rita M..
texts.en: This group is called "Las Libelulas" [The Dragonflies]. It is located in the state of México. It is made up of 10 clients. One of the members is Ms. Maria Teresa M.. She is 45 years old and went to junior high school. She has been married for 25 years to Mr. Sergio V., with whom she has 4 daughters. He has been a driver for more than 10 years. She says that she will use the loan to be able to increase her sales at her business, which is a lunch place. She will buy ingredients to make food and furniture for her customers' comfort, in addition to being able to make a variety of foods. Tthus she will obtain more income and support her husband with the family expenses. Maria is very grateful for the support to make her dreams come true. Note: the woman who can't been seen very well in the photo is named Rita M..

loans.use: to buy ingredients and furniture for her lunch place.

loans.name: Adelsa

texts.en:
Adelsa P. is from the village of Palayan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old. Adelsa is married and has 2 very young children. To make a living, Adelsa owns & operates a specialized retail store selling products for daily use, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Adelsa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Adelsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from GDMPC.  She is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP, which will be used to purchase rice and corn grits, bagoong and dried fish for sale. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Adelsa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits, bagoong and dried fish for sale.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna M. is 49 years old and lives in the town of West Point.  She is married and has eight children: three boys and five girls.  Three of her children are currently in school, two are doing business, and three are employed.

For 24 years Anna has been selling provisions in the local market, where she enjoys the location of her business since its situated in a very good position not far from the road. She has many customers and the need for her products is very high, although sometimes business is slow, but almost all of the time she makes good money.

Anna is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, flour, etc. which will enable her to earn more money since the demand from her customers is very high. In the future her plan is to expand her business not only in the local market but internationally.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Kulmai's Group

texts.en:
Kulmai T., 53, is the leader of this group. She is married to a worker in a local state inspection and has four grown children. The younger kids along with her husband help her in preparing fodder for their livestock. Following the example of most of her friends, she took a loan from a local bank and started up her business of cattle breeding. That helped Kulmai to buy her first cow and equipment for work on a small plot of  land that she owns and gradually build a house. Unfortunately, 2,000 soms of monthly income is not enough to purchase the planned five head of livestock. With this purpose, Kulmai turned to Kiva lenders in search of support.

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Buth

texts.en:
Buth E. is a farmer residing in a rural area of Kompong Tom province. She feeds some piglets in a pigpen behind her house. Eventually, she will sell her pigs to a slaughterer in four-month cycles. Beside this work, she has also been planting rice which is her annual business. Her husband works in construction. 

Buth E. is looking for a $1100 loan as capital to buy a piece of fertile land and also purchase a pumping machine. She will use the rest of her loan funds to buy more pigs to raise. Buth E. has only one daughter and she is in the photo with Buth E. as well.

loans.use: to buy a piece of fertile land and also purchase a pumping machine.

loans.name: Santa María Group

texts.es:
El comité de Mujeres de nombre Santa Maria se conformó en la fecha 10 de julio del 2008 con mucho esfuerzo y esmero. Ya se encuentran en el 8° ciclo, trabajando en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también   reúnen fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que son los de trabajar para apoyar económicamente  a sus familiares en especial.
Una historia muy conmovedora es la de la Sra. Angela: ella es una señora que está en silla de ruedas y  se dedica a hacer crochet. Cuando comenzó con la fundación ella no contaba con la mencionada silla de ruedas y no podía salir por la incapacidad que tenía y gracias al crédito y a sus compañeras del comité pudo adquirirla y así mejoró bastante su actividad y su administración. Ella  nos comenta que mediante este crédito podría mejorar la economía de la familia, actualmente poseen además del ingreso de su trabajo, un ingreso como humorista en la radio.
Según la Sra. Angela mencionó, las actividades que realizan con la Fundación Paraguaya son muy importantes ya que pudieron desarrollar sus capacidades de trabajo, además de levantar su autoestima como madres trabajadoras.
texts.en:
The committee of women named Santa Maria was established on July 10, 2008 with hard work and dedication. They are in their 8th loan cycle. They work together and in solidarity within the program. 

In addition to their individual work, they also raise funds with the goal of having some capital within the group and they help themselves mutually to achieve their objective of economically supporting their families. 

A very moving story is that of Angela: she is in a wheelchair and she dedicates herself to crocheting. She did not have a wheelchair when she first became involved with the foundation and she could not leave her home because of her disability. Thanks to the loan and her colleagues in the committee she was able to acquire her wheelchair and thus greatly improved her business and management. She tells us that with this loan she will be able to improve her family's economy. Currently, her family only has the income from her work as a comedian on a radio show. 

Angela mentioned that their activities with field partner Fundacion Paraguaya are very important since they were able to develop their work skills in addition to improving their self-esteem as working mothers.

loans.use: to purchase thread, crochet needles and other necessary supplies to make embroidered products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vitamins, antibiotics,analgesics, and injections to sell.

loans.name: Shaigul's Group

texts.en:
Shaigul, 55, is a leader of this group. In recent years, Shaigul's only income has come from the annual harvest, but she has been dreaming of trying something new. Ten years ago, together with her husband, who has also been a farmer for his entire life, Shaigul sold a rich harvest and obtained a couple of young calves. Shaigul says that the fixed costs of feeding and fattening livestock are not very high, so she can generate more profit. Shaigul is a mother of four and can proudly boast of raising good kids and giving them an education. Since her monthly income is only 1,400 soms, Shaigul was forced to think of additional ways of broadening the business. When she found out about Kiva, she said, “Such projects could improve the lives of many entrepreneurs like me.”

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco “CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA”; el Banco Comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, Provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; la socia tiene 55 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos varones y una mujer, la socia se encarga de apoyar al último de sus hijos que tiene 17 años de edad, la socia se dedica la compra y venta de artesanía ella elabora textiles, ella misma se encarga de tejer las mantas, guantes, ponchos, chalinas, todos los textiles, pasadizos muñecas de trapo, ente otros, la socia trabaja en la puerta del hotel ecoanden en el valle sagrado, la socia requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de materiales así como lanas de diferentes texturas como alpaca, oveja, sintética, la socia también desea comprar cierres, hilos, tintes para teñir las lanas, botones y otros materiales. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la realización de textiles.

La socia agradece el préstamo que se le otorgara y se compromete en cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas de manera disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sra. Gregoria is a member of the Communal Bank “Cristo Asencion de Rumichaca”. This Communal Bank is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 55 years old, married, and has four sons and a daughter. Gregoria is in charge of supporting her youngest child, who is 17 years old. She buys and sells handicrafts. Gregoria produces textiles that she uses in making blankets, gloves, ponchos, shawls, all types of fabrics, cloth dolls, and other items. She has a business set up at the doorstep of the Ecoandina Hotel in the Sacred Valley. Gregoria needs a loan to invest in the purchase of materials including different types of wool such as alpaca, sheep, and synthetic. She will also buy zippers, thread, wool dye, buttons, and other items. By requesting this loan, she will be able to acquire the materials for making textiles.

Gregoria is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase materials used in producing textiles.

loans.name: Savart

texts.en: Savart is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a scavenger. Their income is $4 per day. She has two children, 7 and 2 years old. One is studying. Every month she has to spend $40 on food, $20 on transportation, $10 on school fee, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to support her husband's business by buying recycle stuff to resell. Before, they were both farmers but they wanted to do something else. Her husband finds being a scavenger is easy and can make a good income if he can buy a lot recycled stuff to stock and resell. In the future, she plans to extend her husband's business if it is running smoothly and making good income.

loans.use: To buy recycled stuff to resell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, single, and lives with two family members. 

Ahmad has owned a market since 2009, selling food and household items. He has a lot of experience in this field and a good reputation. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $3000 loan to pay the annual rent and to purchase additional inventory. He is aiming to make more profit to improve his family's quality life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent and to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Ndoro

texts.en:
Ndoro is a married man with four children who all attend school. He lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three months he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. His greatest monthly expense is high cost of transportation. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Azucena Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó a través D. las Señoras Catalina y Noelia, quienes se habían acercado hasta la Oficina D. la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse más del Programa D. Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras, la misma invitó a sus amigas y compañeras del Barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo D. vida. Actualmente son 20 mujeres, todas trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días.
La señora Catalina se dedica a la venta D. leche, comenta que hace tiempo se dedica a esto, por lo que ya tiene muchos clientes bien formados. Dice que todos los días se levanta a muy tempranas horas D. la mañana para que su producto ya esté en la casa D. sus clientes ni bien entrada a la mañana. Uno D. sus sueños es tener un local donD. pueda vender sus lácteos, como así también los derivados del mismo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. leche, para que D. esa forma pueda abastecerse y cumplir mejor con los pedidos D. sus clientes. Está muy agradecida con la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Señoras Catalina and Noelia, who had approached the office of Fundación Paraguaya to learn more about the Program for the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs.  They invited their friends and colleagues from the neighborhood and decided to join together to work as a group to move ahead in life, and in this way improve their standard of living.  They are currently twenty women, all of whom are hard-working and humble, and who have to earn themselves a living on a daily basis.

Señora Catalina works selling milk.  She comments that she has been doing this for some time, which is why she has a good customer base.  She says that every day she gets up at a very early hour of the morning so that her product is already in her customers' houses well before the morning is underway.  

One of her dreams is to have premises where she can sell her dairy products, and also the things maD. from them. 

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of milk, as in this way she can stock up and better meet the orders of her customers.

She is very grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it is giving her.

loans.use: to buy milk for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: Esta señora es originaria del poblado de telica, actualmente esta jubilada, pero su actividad laboral la ejerció   impartiendo clases en el instituto señor de esquipulas de esta localidad y el colegio san Ramón en la cuidad de león, por espacio de 29 años, su unidad familiar se compone de 10 personas ella su esposo y 8 hijos de los cuales solo 2 están  estudiando carreras universitarias que son los menores el resto son profesionales, meta lograda por sus esfuerzos en el tiempo que laboro como esta descrito anteriormente, esta señora es cliente de la empresa desde el año 2003, ya que dichos créditos le han ayudado a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
This lady, Maria, is a originally from the town of Telica. She is retired, after 29 years working as a school teacher in Esquipulas and at San Ramón school in the city of León. Maria's household consists of 10 people, including her husband and eight children. The youngest two are studying at university and the rest are working professionals. Her goals were achieved during the time she worked, as described above. 

Maria has been a client of this organization since 2003, and the loans she has received have helped to improve living standards and conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: to construct the roof of her home, and purchase metal roofing, beams, nails, blocks, cement, sand and manpower

loans.name: Erlanbek's Group

texts.en:
Erlanbek is a member of this group. He is 31 and married to a nurse. Together they are raising a daughter and two sons. The daughter and the older son are at school, and the younger son is not yet at school because he is preschool age (under seven). 

Erlanbek works as a surgeon; three years ago he saved 12000 soms and purchased three livestock animals for breeding.  Since that time he has been breeding livestock and reselling it after fattening. With money received from the loan, he wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, he wishes to purchase a piece of land in Bishkek to build a house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.
 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Parisa

texts.en:
Parisa is a resident of Karajygach, a nice village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 44 years old and is unfortunately a widow.  She is bringing up three children: two sons and a daughter.  Her sons study at school while her daughter is still of pre-school age. 

Seven years ago, with an initial investment of 5000 soms, Parisa started to sell grocery goods. In this way, she earns 4500 soms to meet the family needs. With the profits gained from the trade, she was able to purchase a calf.  

Parisa has saved some money, but needs additional funds to purchase furniture for her home to improve the living conditions for her family.  For this purpose, she has applied for a loan. In the future, she wants to improve her business and provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: purchase home furniture

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Carlota Irma

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Carlota; es  casada, la socia tiene 65 años de edad; la socia tiene 3 hijos, la socia sigue trabajando en su negocio de panaderia,ella tiene un horno donde elabora panes y luego los vende en forma ambulatoria en la plaza del distrito de Oropesa,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de elaboracion y venta de panes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar pan como aceite y harina al por mayor y tambien para comprar leña para el horno.


La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Carlota is 65 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She continues to work in her bakery.  She has an oven where she makes bread, which she later sells in a plaza in the Oropesa district.  She works from 8am until 5pm, and through this business she provides for her children.  She wants to expand and improve her business making and selling bread.  She requests a loan to buy supplies at wholesale to prepare bread, such as cooking oil and flour, and also to buy firewood for her oven.

She is very grateful for this loan, and she promises to make all of the payments on this loan in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make bread, such as cooking oil and flour, and also to buy firewood for her oven

loans.name: Ngugi

texts.en: Ngugi is 52 years old and married with five children.  He has been farming to earn a living.  He has been in the business for 20 years and has employed two people.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business and his living standards. He hopes to venture into dairy farming in five years.  He has requested 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro, de 53 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de Flora, su esposa desde hace 10 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Aymara.  Todas las mañanas se levanta para ocuparse de las actividades del día, pues es un hombre con múltiples ocupaciones. Durante las mañanas sale a trabajar como albañil, en trabajos eventuales todo depende de los contratos que negocia, cuenta que gana 60 nuevos soles diarios en el mejor de los días. Pero como, no es un trabajo estable, comparte su tiempo con la agricultura, la actividad que aprendió desde niño. Sus principales sembríos constan de tubérculos como papa, olluco, maca y mashua, los que vende en cada cosecha al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Huancayo, por más de 20 años, además su esposa lo ayuda con el cuidado de sus vacas, ovejas y caballos a los que enseba para luego venderlos a un mayor precio. Ahora desea mejorar sus ingresos, ya que quiere brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “los pinos” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Alejandro de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
53-year-old Alejandro is a responsible man.  He lives together with Flora, his wife of 10 years.  The couple have 5 children and live with two of them in their own home which is located in the small village of Aymara.

Every morning, Alejandro gets up to take care of his day's work as he is a man with multiple occupations.  During the mornings, he goes out to work as a builder.  His work in this field depends on the contracts that he negotiates.  He tells us that he earns 60 soles a day on his best days.  However, as this is not a stable job, he also spends time farming.  This is a business that he learned when he was a boy.  His main crops are tubers such as potatoes, olluca, maca and mashua (native tubers).  At harvest time he sells his produce in the wholesale market in the city of Huancayo.  He has been doing this for more than 20 years.  In addition, his wife helps him to take care of their cows, sheep and horses which they fatten up and then sell at a higher price.  

Alejandro would now like to improve his income as he would like to provide his children with a good education.  He belongs to the 'Los Pinos' community bank and this is his first loan from MFP.  He hopes to receive your cooperation so that he can realize his plans.  For his part, he pledges to make his repayments on time.  Alejandro enjoys being a member of his association because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.  With your support, he will invest the money he has requested in buying natural fertilizers to spread over his potato crops.

loans.use: to buy a sack of natural fertilizers

loans.name: Lorgia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Lorgia, de 55 años edad, vive en León,   es comerciante, vende tortillas, ropa y cosméticos la cual tiene ubicada en la entrada de su casa , es casada, tiene tres hijos. Inicio su negocio a los 29 años de edad cuando solo se dedicaba a elaborar y vender tortillas pero necesitaba generar mas ingresos para ayudar a su esposo fue entonces que invirtió en cosméticos y ropa para vender para conseguir otros ingresos para su hogar su esposo la ayudo desde el principio, ya lleva 5 años que vender ropa y cosméticos le ha resultado muy rentable. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa y cosméticos para aprovechar las ventas navideñas. Pues quiere poner una pulpería en la que pueda vender ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en: Mrs. Lorgia, age 55, lives in Leon. She is a merchant and sells tortillas, clothing and cosmetics from her home. She is married with three children. She started her business when she was 29, just making tortillas--but she needed to generate more income to help her husband, so she invested in cosmetics and clothing. Her husband has helped her from the beginning. She has now sold clothing and cosmetics for five years, and this has been very profitable for her. She needs this loan to buy clothing and cosmetics in order to take advantage of the Christmas season. She wants to have a store from which to sell her clothing and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Guzmary

texts.es:
Guzmary pertenece al banco comunal “Choquequirao” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y sus reuniones con sus compañeras del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Cusco de la provincia de Cusco del departamento del Cusco. 

Guzmary tiene 28 años de edad y  es soltera, ella nació en la ciudad Puno y vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realiza sus actividades económicas.  Guzmary  trabaja en una entidad privada en el área de carga y equipaje, ella desempeña la función de supervisora en esta empresa. Gusmary estudio la carrera profesional de Contabilidad y desea el préstamo para los gastos que se necesita para que ella pueda obtener el título profesional de contabilidad. 

Guzmary agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Guzmary is a member of the “Choquequirao” Communal Bank, pertaining to the Arariwa Association of Cusco. Their reunions occur every 30 days in the city, province, and department of Cusco.

Guzmary is 28 years old and single. She was born in the Puno city and lives in Cusco city where she conducts her economic activities. Guzmary works for a private entity in the freight and equipment sector. She is a supervisor in this enterprise. Guzmary is studying for the professional career of accounting and desires a loan to cover the costs of obtaining her professional title in accounting.

Guzmary appreciates and values the loan and is committed to complying with her repayment schedule.

loans.use: cover the costs of obtaining her professional  title in accounting.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a 63-year-old married woman with 4 adult children. Her husband is a fisherman.

Corazon earns a living selling meat products in her community. Corazon cooks the food herself. She also helps her husband sell his catch at the market. Corazon does her best to improve their living situation. She has requested this loan to buy raw ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, vegetables and spices. Corazon hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, vegetables and spices.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba sells kenkey (maize dumplings often used in soups) at Efutu. In front of her in the photo is the dough she uses to prepare the kenkey. Arba has been selling kenkey for eight years. 

She is married and has three children. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their accommodation bills. 

Araba will use her loan to purchase bulk maize for the kenkey. With the new profit, Araba plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bulk maize for the kenkey.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 36 years old, married, and has one child. He sells used shoes to earn a living, which he has been doing for five years. His other source of income is from farming. He describes his business environment as good because there is little competition. 

Stephen is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which he will use to buy shoes. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business. He hopes to further expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Vikie

texts.en: Vikie is 31 years old and lives in Casusan Aloran,Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two children. Vikie has a ready-to-wear clothing  business, earning approximately PHP 15,000 each month from it. She has a requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase more ready-to-wear clothes for her business. Vikie has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to have a large amount of capital and to own merchandise to earn money for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear clothes

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: This is 41-year-old Ibrahim.  He is married and has four children aged 18, 15, 12 and 8. In 2003, Ibrahim established his dry fish business. He began his business just to enable him to solve his domestic problems. His business is located in the center of town and his main customers are mostly women. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,700,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Ibrahim requires a loan to purchase a packet of dry fish for Le 5,000,000. He hopes that this loan will increase his income level and hence his stock. In the future, Ibrahim plans to rent his own store/shop, to build another house and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy Dry Milk

loans.name: Eneti

texts.en:
Eneti is 36 years old and married to Petro, 41 years old. Together they have one child who goes to school, and they also look after school-going orphans. 

She runs a grocery store selling various goods such as sugar, soap, and bread. She is requesting this loan to purchase assorted groceries to attract more customers in her village. 

Eneti is involved in business to support her family and to be financially independent. Her ambition is to educate her child in private schools and satisfy her family’s basic needs when she made enough profits. 

In the future, she has plans to purchase a motor vehicle for her family. As a woman, she is self-reliant, and she believes that the training she received in business management offered by Microloan Foundation will help her to achieve what she wants from her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries.

loans.name: Give It Back Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you members of Give It Back Group, located in Kenema, eastern Sierra Leone. This is a group of hard working traders who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders in order to request for a loan of SLL5,400,000.00. They will use this loan in order to meet their most immediate financial needs – some will use it to buy a plot of land, pieces of furniture, pay school fees for their children, etc. And at the end of each month, the group leader will collect their repayment and repay SMT/Kiva on their behalf.
Kadiatu is the featured leader of this group. Born in Kenema, eastern Sierra Leone, she is 27 years old and has 3 children.  All three are in primary school. Aminata has been in business for 8 years now. She has requested for this loan in order to buy Maggie, onions and dried fish to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy Maggie, onions and dried fish to increase her stock.

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is 23 years old and married.He is blessed with three children and also supports two adult dependents.

Cyrus has been a farmer for the last 5 years and it has been profitable.

He has borrowed loan from VisionFund Kenya which he will use to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer, seedlings and new farming equipment and hopes this will generate additional income so that he can support hi family.

His hopes and dreams in future is to expand the current business,educate his children and buy additional fertilizer for his farm.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer, seedlings and new farming equipment

loans.name: Chhoryi

texts.en: Chhoryi, 18, is a young student living in Kampot province. Besides her studying, she grows rice and sells banana-fry to get more income to support on her living and her study. Her rice have destroyed from insect and the customers who buy her banana-fry also less than before because of the rain. She can earn income about 5 USD per day and it make her save only about 2.5 USD per day after expend. This is first time for Chhoryi with VisionFund to get this loan. She will spend her loan to pay tuition fee for her Bachelor’s degree and to buy school materials to support her studying. She hopes that she can get a good job with higher salary after graduated.

loans.use: To pay tuition fee for her Bachelor’s degree and to buy school materials to support her studying.

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en:
C. Sokhim is one of CREDIT oldest clients. She is cooking and selling food in her neighborhood for quite a long time. She is living with her husband, her mother and four children in a house she ameliorated with her previous loans. “My living standards have been improving steadily since I borrowed for the first time with CREDIT”, she said. “I was never late in my repayments, because I want to deserve CREDIT’s trust in me.

 

C. Sokhim used to borrow small amount in Riel, Cambodia national currency, but this time she is requesting $700.

 

As she heard that a new factory was going to be opened in her village, her plan is to build a house to rent decent rooms to the workers, who will come from the provinces to work in this factory. This is a big investment but Sokhim is planning to go step by step: this first loan will be used to prepare the land before having the house built. Eventually, she is expecting a good income for her family.

loans.use: Build a house to rent rooms

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has 8 months of experience selling encebollado (a sauteed onion dish with spices) and snacks in the small shop that her husband fixed up in their house. She has always worked and has a lot of experience cooking and washing clothes, which she started doing from the age of 10. She started the business thanks to the encouragement of her husband, who lent her the money. She works from 6 am to 10 pm Her shop is located in a heavily trafficked area. Thanks to their efforts in the business, Maria and her husband were able to buy their home.

She needs the loan to buy her raw materials (rice, oil, vegetables) in bulk as well as 2 plastic tables with chairs.

Maria was born in the city of Esmerelda. She is 43 years old. Her husband works and always supports her. At the age of 5, Maria came to live in Quito and later in Guayaquil. From the time she was an infant her mother sent her to work in houses so that she would be working and earning income. When she married, she continued to work at home: mending, washing and caring for children. She has always been a pillar of strength in her home. They are a humble, hardworking, determined family and always are ready to support themselves for the well being of the family. They have their own cement home. Now the most important thing is that Maria keeps her own restaurant so she can generate her income. She stopped working doing domestic work 9 months ago when her father died.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Maria tiene una experiencia de 8 meses vendiendo encebollado y merienda en su pequeño local que su esposo le acondicionó en su casa. Ella siempre ha estado trabajando y tiene mucha experiencia en cocinar y lavar ropa desde los 10 años. El negocio lo puso gracias a la motivación de su esposo, él le presto el dinero. Ella atiende de 6:00AM hasta 10:PM. Su local esta ubicado en un lugar donde circula mucha gente. Gracias a los esfuerzos de ambos con sus ingresos han podido obtener su casa. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar en ciertas cantidades su materia prima: arroz, aceite, legumbres y adicional 2 mesas plásticas con sus sillas respectivas. María nació en la ciudad de Esmeralda. Tiene 43 años, Tiene su esposo que trabaja y la apoya siempre. A la edad de cinco años Maria se vino a vivir a Quito y luego a Guayaquil, desde su infancia su madre la empleaba en casas para que trabaje y genere ingresos. Cuando se caso siguió trabajando en casa: arreglando, lavando, cuidando niños. Ella siempre ha sido un pilar fuerte para su hogar. Ellos son una familia humilde muy trabajadora y luchadora siempre están dispuesto ha apoyarse para el bienestar de la familia. Ellos tienen su casa propia de cemento actualmente. Ahora lo más importante es que Maria se mantenga en su comedor propio para que pueda generar sus ingresos. Ella dejo de trabajar en las casas desde hace 9 meses a raíz que murió su padre.

loans.use: Buy raw materials: rice, sugar, beans and tables.

loans.name: Pharm

texts.en: Pharm T. is a widow with 4 children.  She also has three nephews and nieces that live with her family in Phnom Penh.  Three of her children work as carpenters and make $7/day each.  Her other child sells fruit alongside her mother at the market.  Pharm T. sells soap, and has daily revenues of $43.  She will use this loan to buy more soap for her business, as well as to purchase a wider variety of bathing products that her customers like.  She hopes to continue growing her business, eventually selling her products everywhere in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more soap for selling at the local market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a vegetable shop

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara Lorenzana O. is 29 and has a business selling new clothing on the street. She sells all manner of women's clothing, including pants and skirts. She also sells some beautiful posters, as shown in the picture. She says that now that she has the Friendship Bridge loans she has more to sell, and that makes her more successful. This is her second loan, and she'll use it to increase her inventory once again.

Sara is 29 and is married with four kids. Her dream is for her kids to have "careers", which means here that they'll be educated all the way through high school and then get a real job with perhaps a salary. Although almost everybody in Guatemala is self-employed, many at little tiny enterprises like Sara's, they all dream of their kids having a salary (and helping out their parents too). In keeping with her dream, her kids are in school, although Sara herself never did go to school at all. She can read a bit and can sign her name, but that's about it.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying more basic ingredients and expand her business locale.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José Fernandez is 23 years old and married to 22 year old Sady Fernandez. José has a mechanic shop and car wash for a little over a year and is located in a busy area of the city. Previously he worked as a mechanic in different shops in the area, where he was able to acquire the technical skill and knowledge necessary to open his own shop.

He is seeking a loan to invest in the construction of an artesian well that will provide water as the car wash uses a large quantity of water and this is a very high expense.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

José Fernandez tiene 23 años y está casado con Sady Fernandez que tiene 22 años. José tiene un taller mecánico y lavadero de autos desde hace un poco más de un año y que está ubicada en una zona de mucho movimiento de la ciudad. Anteriormente trabajaba como mecánico en diferentes talleres de la zona, de donde pudo adquirir las técnicas y conocimientos necesarios para abrir su propio taller.

El préstamo solicitado desea invertirlo en la construcción de un pozo artesiano que le proveerá de agua ya que el lavadero utiliza una gran cantidad de agua y esto representa un costo muy alto.

loans.use: To construct an artesian well

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. Rafael L. has sold hardware products for the past 20 years. He started out with products he purchased when the company he worked for was liquidated, and he invested those in his own business.

Mr. L. is a great example of someone who started out with a workbench and a few products that hardly anyone would buy, then with a total of 12 loans from Ceprodel has been able to develop and grow over the past year and a half, diversifying his market and gaining an advantage over his competition.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Rafael López tiene 20 años de tener el negocio de venta de productos ferreteros que se inició con producto de una liquidación de su trabajo y los invirtió en su propio negocio.

El señor López es un gran ejemplo para muchas personas ya que inició con una mesa de madera con pocos productos los cuales casi nadie le compraba sin embargo, con Ceprodel se ha desarrollado y crecido desde hace año y medio con un total de 12 créditos otorgados produciendo un crecimiento de su ferretería diversificando su mercado y ocupando una posición ventajosa con relación a su competencia.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Finnah

texts.en:
Finnah S. started her innovative business in Kabala town of Sierra Leone. She is the only one running a business of selling locally made saucepans in the township. There is high demand for the saucepans because of their durability.

With previous loans, she increased her inventory and profit. As Finnah capitalizes on the saucepan market in the community, she would like to increase her inventory and, therefore, is requesting a loan of about $225.

loans.use: Purchase more saucepans to meet the growing demand in the community for her unique business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a 54-year-old, hard-working entrepreneur who lives in the Santana community of San Cristobal.  Gladys lost her husband a long time ago and, since then, she has operated a small business in order to earn a living.  On a daily basis, many customers, most of whom are men, visit her house for refreshments.  To illustrate, she serves alcoholic drinks (e.g., beer, whisky, and red and white wines), energizing beverages, and even natural juices at times.  In addition, Gladys prepares tasty pieces of toast for her customers.  Gladys explains that she receives monthly a pension from the government, but that such funds are insufficient to cover all of her expenses.  Therefore, Gladys is seeking a loan so that she can purchase wholesale drinks to replenish her store and to generate additional income.

loans.use: To purchase different kinds of beverages (e.g., beer, whisky and other alcoholic beverages) in bulk to replenish her small liquor store.

loans.name: Sali

texts.id:
Sali is a used junk collector. He rents a room in Bedahulu road for $17 per month. He browsed through alleys in housing neighborhood and local market to collect junks that can be resold to recyclers. Sonetimes Sali purchased unused household junk from local housewives. The junks are valued by weight and quality. The loan for DINARI will be used to purchase more junks from junkyard workers. He hopes to improve his family's financial condition.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Sali adalah seorang pemulung yang setiaphari aktifitasnya mencari barang-barang bekas. Tinggal di jalan Bedahulu dengan mengontrak sebuah kamar dengan harga 150.000/bulan. Dengan menggunakan gerobak Sali menjalankan aktifitasnya sebagai seorang pemulung. Dengan menyusuri lorong-lorong perumahan, pasar, gedung-gedung dengan tujuan untuk mendapatkan barang-barang bekas, lebih sering Sali membeli barang-barang bekas dari para ibu-ibu rumah tangga yang suka mengumpulkan barang yang sudah tidak terpakai lagi. Barang-barang bekas tersebut ditimbang dan dihargai sesuai dengan kualitas barang. Dana yang didapat dari DINARI digunakan sebagai modal untuk membeli barang bekas dari para pengepul. Harapannya bersama keluarga semoga keadaan ekonomi keluarga mereka semakin membaik di masa yang akan datang.

loans.use: Purchase more household junk to be recycled/resold

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is married with a 5-year-old daughter. He is a small entrepreneur who sells fish at the local train station market in Melitopol. There are usually many customers in this market as the station is a popular destination for many travelers. Vladimir is not alone in this business. His whole family actively helps him with sales.

Vladimir admits he has benefited a lot in the past 5 years from his relationship with Nadiya Ukraine. Financial assistance he has received has helped him grow and expand his business. Currently Vladimir has about $1000 in inventory. His gross income is about $1400 and his monthly net profit is about $400. Today Vladimir is requesting a loan of 1000 UAH to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Vladimir would like to increase his stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
Mrs. Srun P. and her family have resided in Phnom Penh for many years. She sells fish in a busy market earning approximately $2.50 a day. Her husband, Mr. Prak Moeun, catches fish and provides his catch to his wife to sell in the market.

Their wooden boat used for catching fish has broken and they are requesting a loan to purchase wood to fix it.

loans.use: To repair the family's wooden boat used for catching fish

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea E., age 50, is a widow and has five children. One child is married; one is in security; one is a garment worker and the other two work in the Casino. The rice price is currently good in the market and if the family produces more rice to sell in the market they will have more money to support the family. To reduce the expense that Chea always spends to hire a small tractor to plow her farm, she would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a cow. This will help her a lot with the farming, allowing her to grow more rice to sell to support her family.

loans.use: Chea would like to purchase a cow to plow her land.

loans.name: Ruben Rafael

texts.es:
51-year old Ruben Rafael L. T. is from Guatemala and is a resident of the Cantón Juchanep, Totonicapán. He runs a weaving business. Beforehand he worked as an operator for a neighbour for three years. With the little bit of money he saved, he opened his own workshop. Now he has eight looms producing cortes (long skirts typical of the region) with help from a loan which he obtained from an institution. With the loan he is now seeking from ASDIR, he wants to increase both production and his income so that he can pay for the basic necessities of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

Ruben Rafael Lacán T.: Casado, guatemalteco, de 51 Años se identifica con su número de del Cantón Juchanep, Totonicapán. Esta persona labora en la tejeduría en un principio trabajó como operario para un vecino durante 3 años, con un pequeño dinero que el tenía ahorrado se propuso colocar un taller propio lo cual le funcionó. Ahora tiene Ocho telares en función de la producción de cortes típicos para dama con la ayuda de un crédito que adquirió en una institución. Con el Préstamo que solicita en ASDIR, pretende aumentar su producción y al mismo tiempo sus ingresos para poder sufragar las necesidades básicas de su familia.

loans.use: Working capital to buy raw materials

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Née en 1961, Monsieur B. Koffi est marié à une femme productrice d’huile rouge. Il pratique la scierie et vent des planches en gros et en détail. Ce qui finalement ne l’aide pas suffisamment à partager avec sa femme les charges de ses six (06) enfants. A présent, elle sollicite un crédit qui va lui servir de s’approvisionner des matériels de travail et acheter une plantation de teckeraie pour la production des planches en grande quantité en vue de satisfaire sa clientèle à temps et au bon moment.
texts.en:
Born in 1961, Koffi B. is married to a woman who produces red palm oil. He runs a saw mill and sells boards wholesale and retail, a business that ultimately doesn't sufficiently help him and his wife support his six children. At present, he is requesting a loan that is going to be used to get work supplies and to buy a teak plantation to produce boards in large quantities with the goal of satisfying his customers on a timely basis.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work supplies and a teak farm for trade in lumber

loans.name: Bertchissou

texts.fr: D. Bertchissou est une femme née en 1952 à Sokodé, ville située au centre du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Depuis 1990, elle a commencé la vente de pagnes et de draps dans les quartiers de Lomé. Elle était une revendeuse ambulante et distribue les pagnes et les draps à crédit de quartier en quartier et récupère l’argent après une semaine. Après obtention du premier crédit, elle a loué un magasin dans lequel elle expose ses marchandises. Cette activité qu’elle mène lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à celui de sa famille. Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 30 pièces de pagne et 20 draps.
texts.en:
Bertchissou D. is a woman who was born in 1952 in Sokodé, a city located in the middle of Togo. She is married and the mother of two children. In 1990, she started selling “pagnes” (colorful West African cloth) and sheets in the districts of Lomé. She used to be a door-to-door retail seller. She now distributes pagnes and sheets on credit from district to district and collects the money after a week. After obtaining an initial loan, she rented a store in which she displayed her merchandise. This business that she manages enables her to provide for her needs and those of her family. This second loan that she is requesting will enable her to buy 30 lengths of pagnes and 20 sheets.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes, sheets, and jewels

loans.name: Merlyn Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Merlyn tiene 38 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Francisco Salazar, es soltera y con tres hijos,  dos varones y una mujer. Los varones tienen 16 y 18 años de edad los cuales trabajan en construcción y la niña mujer tiene 14 años de edad, y está estudiando. Para Doña Merlyn ha sido difícil educar a sus hijos ya que no tiene el apoyo del padre de sus éstos. Su negocio es una pulpería que tiene cuatro años de tenerla e inició con dinero propio y con la ayuda de sus padres, la pulpería está ubicada en su casa de habitación lo que le dá ventaja para poder estar pendiente de sus hijos y de su hogar. Con la solicitud que está haciendo es para invertir en la compra de productos tales como granos básicos y productos de limpieza para el gohar y así no desmejorar la demanda hacia sus clientes.
texts.en:
Merlyn is 38 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Francisco Salazar. She is single with two sons and one daughter. Her sons are 16 and 18 years old and work in construction. Her daughter is 15 years old and is a student. For Merlyn, it has been difficult to educate her sons without the support from their father. Her business has been a small market for the past 4 years that she started with her own money and the help of her parents. The market is located in her house, of which the benefits are dedicated to her children and household. The purpose of this loan is to invest in the purchase of products like whole grains and cleaning products for growth and to not disappoint the demands of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase whole grains and cleaning products

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị Hường năm nay 33 tuổi. năm 2007 chị tham gia Quỹ  tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Hiện nay ngoài chăn nuôi, tranh thủ thời gian nhàn rỗi chị Hường còn đi làm thuê để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Với mức thu nhập 3 triệu đồng/ tháng không chỉ trả vốn đúng hạn gia đình chị Hường còn có điều kiện hơn trong việc cải thiện cuộc sống. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 12 triệu đồng để đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại và mua lợn giống vè nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. H. Thi Tran, 33 years old, joined the fund in 2007. She first borrowed money to raise livestock. Currently besides the livestock business, she also takes advantage of her free time to work as labor for hire to increase the family's income. With an income of 3 million VND per month, her family is not only able to make all loan payments on time, but they are also able to enjoy a higher standard of living. In this round of funding she is requesting 12 million VND to invest in renovating the holding pens and buy a sow to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovate holding pens, buy a sow

loans.name: Bismarck Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. C. de 56 años de edad, casado con 3 hijos, 2 universitarios y uno en la secundaria, su esposa es Ing. Agronomo, trabaja en el MAGFOR; el Sr. C. tiene 4 años de laborar para la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa como director de proyectos, esta solicitando su primer credito el que utilizara para mejorar su vivienda  poniendo la ceramica en el piso de su casa, pues esta embaldosado y comprar las persianas de las ventanas ya que solo tiene los protectores; su ilusion es mejorar su vivienda, ya que sus hijos estan creciendo tanto intelectual como en su desarrollo fisico, pues una sera graduado de ingeniero, otro esta en 2do año de la universidad y el otro en 3er año de bachillerato y quiere que se sientan realizados al ver su vivienda con comodidades y condiciones; su vivienda es propia, desde hace muchos años no habia podido realizar este sueño de mejorarla hasta que supo que la Alcaldia tiene convenio con AFODENIC y conoce de las excelentes politicas que no se igualan a las de los bancos que son creditos impagables o los deudores se quedan sin nada.
texts.en:
Mr. C. is 56 years old, married with three children, two of whom are college students and one who is still in high school. His wife is an agricultural engineer and works in MAGFOR. For the past four years, Mr. C. has worked in the local municipality as Project Director. He is requesting his first loan in order to improve his home, installing a ceramic floor since it is currently quite slippery; he would also like to put up blinds and glass in the windows as they currently only have bars covering them. His dream is to improve his home since his children are growing, both physically and intellectually. One will graduate soon in engineering, another is in his second year of college and the third is in his 3rd year of high school. Mr. C. would like his children to feel fulfilled in their home and see it in good condition with comfortable accommodations. He owns his home but for many years has not been able to find funds to improve it until he found out that the mayor's office has an agreement with AFODENIC which offers much better terms than banks who offer loans that debtors can never pay and they are eventually left with nothing.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a ceramic floor and windows in his home

loans.name: Alma Lola

texts.es:
La señora Alma Lola Beltrán H. tiene 37 años, es tesorera del Banco Comunal Las Emprendedoras II y vive en  Mz I lote 24 del Asentamiento Humano Luis Alberto Sánchez del Puerto Marítimo de Salaverry de la provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió educación secundaria y empezó a estudiar Comunicaciones pero no concluyó porque se casó y tiene 2 hijos que aun son estudiantes.
Alma es cosmetóloga y también vende cena en las noches o comidas al paso, actividad que realiza en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que canceló en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió en comprar un espejo y una vitrina.
Con este crédito de 1400 que será cancelado en 6 cuotas invertirá en compra de juguetes y  arreglar un ambiente para sus ventas de comidas.
Alma sueña con comprarse un carro.
texts.en:
Alma Lola Beltrán H. is 37 years old and treasurer of the “Enterprising Women II” cooperative bank. She lives in the Trujillo province, located in La Libertad, Perú. She completed secondary school and began studies in Communications, but did not finish because she got married and had two children who are still students. Alma is in cosmetology, and also sells dinners at night or food to go, activities that she conducts from her home. With her first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles, which she repaid in four installments, she invested in the purchase of a mirror and display cabinet. With this loan of 1,400.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in six installments, she will invest in the purchase of toys and improve the ambiance for her food sales. Alma dreams of buying her own car.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase toys for the holiday season.  To make improvements to her location.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia A. is the 40-year-old mother of two girls and five boys, five in school, one a commercial driver, and one of preschool age. Olivia’s husband is a farmer cultivating plantains, cassava and cocoa, and they live in a rented apartment in Offinso, a farming and commercial town in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

For the past eight years Olivia has traded in maize, purchasing bags from the farmers in her community and nearby villages and selling to vendors in her community. She says some of her customers come from the cities to buy in the local market where she sells, and she is now requesting a loan to purchase maize on a larger scale in order to increase her customer base and profit margin.

Olivia aspires to improve upon her family’s standard of living and help her children ultimately attain higher education.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize.

loans.name: Efia

texts.en: Efia S. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high. Efia sells saucepans at the Elmina New Market, which she has done since 1998. Her husband is a painter. Efia uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses and sometime pays the children's school fees. Efia will use the loan to increase her stock of saucepans and cooking pots to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efia plans to save towards a house she wants to build for her family.

loans.use: To increase her stock of saucepans and cooking pots

loans.name: Sergio Noel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Estelí el señor Sergio A. con gran esfuerzo se dedica a su negocio de venta de accesorios de celulares siendo este su negocio que desde hace varios años ha logrado mantener. También se ha destacado en la reparación de celulares siendo este su único negocio con el cual sustenta a su familia.

Actualmente el señor Sergio ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los accesorios de celulares para su respectiva venta y por este motivo es que espera muy confiadamente en que Ceprodel le brindará el crédito y así saldrá adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Estelí, Sergio A. is enthusiastically dedicated to his business in cellular phone accessories. He has run his business successfully for a few years. He stands out by also repairing cellular phones, this being his only business to support his family.

Today Sergio turns to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy cellular accessories for his business, and he is very confident that Ceprodel will grant him this credit so that his business can move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cellular phone accessories

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
