Manuela H. is a member of the San Pedro D. Katañiray Village Bank, along with her daughter, Irma. Manuela is a grandmother and a widow. She lives in a rural, predominately agricultural area in the Municipality of Anta, about one hour outsiD. of the city of Cusco. Her village bank, maD. up of 21 members, meets once a month at the local church to make their repayments and attend training and educational sessions.

Like many others in Anta, Manuela travels to Cusco to work, since there are many business opportunities in the city and very few in the area where she lives. Manuela brings milk from local farms to Cusco to sell from door to door. Depending on the season, she also buys and sells broad beans (habas), potatoes and cheeses. Manuela is requesting a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to buy potatoes from local farmers, which she will sell in Cusco.

Manuela has been a member of the San Pedro D. Katañiray Village Bank for multiple loan cycles and has shown herself to be responsible and punctual. She has pledged to make each of her repayments in full and on time.

loans.use: Buy potatoes to resell in Cusco

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta and her husband are helping one another sustain their rice and onion farm. Aside from farming, Marieta also helps her husband generate extra income by selling different snacks: pansit (noodles), native rice cakes, macaroni soup and other cooked foods in the public market.

Marieta and her family live in Barangay Tuao Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Jerry and blessed with six children who are presently studying in high school and elementary school. They want their children to finish college so they will have a good future someday.

In preparation for the future college education of their six children, Marieta has decided to double her work time hoping that her income will increase. Following her dream, she would like to borrow 5,000 PHP that they will use for their farming needs. Marieta says they will do their best to increase their onion production. With faith and trust in the Lord, and with the help of the lenders, she will be successful in this endeavor.

loans.use: For farm supplies

loans.name: Amarsanaa

texts.en:
Amarsanaa G. lives with her husband and three teenage children in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. All three children are attending a local high school. Her husband is a fireman for the central heating station of the town. In order to contribute to the family of five, she started a small retail business selling dairy products in 2000. She purchases dairy products from herder families and sells them at a stall she rents in the local food market. She sells milk, curds, cream and cheese.

Her business capital has increased from 80,000 MNT ($1 = 1,400 MNT) in the beginning to 400,000 MNT. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and make sure that all her children receive a good education. She requests a loan to purchase more dairy products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products for her business

loans.name: Manchuria

texts.en:
Manchuria R. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 50 years old, widowed and has four adult children. To make a living, Manchuria owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Manchuria has been in this business for over eleven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Manchuria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Manchuria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 14th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in a fishing business

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es: Yeny es una mujer muy admirada por sus vecinos, a sus 22 años ya tiene un negocio propio, vive en la casa de sus padres y desea mejorar la vida que actualmente lleva. Esta muchacha siempre ha luchado por tener una vida mejor, actualmente cuenta con un pequeño puesto donde vende quesos en el mercado Las Mercedes (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), es una vendedora muy alegre y carismática que siempre recibe con una sonrisa a sus clientes. Nos comenta que lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender, y lo que no le agrada es que tiene que hacerlo en un espacio muy reducido. Por ello, para un futuro cercano, Yeny quiere tener un puesto más grande, donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y vender sus quesos con mayor tranquilidad. Lleva 5 años en este negocio y hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien, una de las cosas más importantes para ella, es atender muy bien a sus clientes, ya que sabe que de ellos depende el éxito de su negocio. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es muy querida por sus compañeras, ya que es muy alegre. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más quesos para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Yeny is a woman who is very admired by her neighbors. At 22 years of age, she has her own business. She lives in her parents’ house, and she wants to improve her life. She has always fought to have a better life. She currently has a small stand in the Las Mercedes market (important market in the city of Juliaca). She is a happy and charismatic sales person who always greets her customers with a smile. What she likes best about her work is selling. What she does not appreciate is having to do so in a very small space. Yeny would like to have a larger stand where she could better tend to her customers and sell her cheeses more peacefully. She has been in this business for five years, and it is going very well for her. One of the most important things to her is paying very good attention to her customers. She knows that the success of her business depends upon them. This is her third loan with MFP. She has always been punctual with her payments, and she expects to do the same with this loan as well. She is well-regarded by her colleagues; she is very happy. She will use the 2,000 PEN to buy more cheese to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Sosefina

texts.en:
Sosefina A., 34, is married with three children. She has three year of experience in her grocery shop business. She sells to the village people and to the general public seven days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala. She has no previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Sosefina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her business is doing well.

loans.use: To buy noodles, lollipops, cookies, peanut butter, soft drinks, vailima (beer), cartons of milk, chicken, mutton flaps, sausages, bags of rice, flour, sugar, onions, etc.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Hòa Nguyễn Thị (1409030297) is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Hòa owns & operates a manufacturing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling mattresses to local business and community members.  Hòa has been engaged in this business for over one year and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2003, Hòa joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hòa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.  Hòa is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Hòa from TYM Fund.  Hòa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
36-year-old Lorna M. is a mother of two children, ages 13 and 17 years old. Both are high school students and are sincere about studying. Salvador, Lorna's husband is a delivery helper for gas tanks, while Lorna is an entrepreneur. She is as hard working as her husband because she is determined to give her two children the opportunity of going to college - an opportunity which she and her husband never had when they were young because of poverty.

Lorna had different kinds of businesses when she had an access to credit for business capital through ASHI in 1997. However, none of those became successful until 2004. Lorna never thought of fish to buy and sell as a business, although the village where she and her family lives is surrounded by the sea and fish ponds. It was after several failures that she tried the said business. In 2004, Lorna's loan from ASHI was Php20,000. She used the loan to finance her first endeavor with fish to buy and sell. After years of doing such business activity, she found success and contentment. She has been a vendor of fish since then until now. With her previous loan she planned to buy crab, shrimp and other varieties of fish for her avid costumers to have many choices in buying. Lorna rents a space in the market where she sells her fish. 

Despite her busy schedule in attending to her business, Lorna gives time to attend to her weekly center meeting in ASHI and pays her weekly amortization from the loan she has taken out. Through ASHI, Lorna was able to realize the importance of savings thus making her save weekly in preparation for her other personal needs.

loans.use: Variety of fish and seafood to be sold.

loans.name: Rolando Antonio

texts.es: El joven Rolando A. de 25 años de edad, soltero, reside en Villa el carmen Carretera vieja a León, trabaja en la alcaldía como contador general, y vive junto con sus padres, anteriormente trabajaba en un negocio en cuenta por cobrar en medio tiempo, el ha mucho esfuerzo ha logrado estar estudiando y es su ultimo año en contabilidad. También en el terreno de sus padres comenzó a construir  su propia casa pero todavía no se ha pasado ya que le faltan muchos detalles, con este préstamo hará la cocina y poco a poco la terminara el cual espera lograrlo y poder establecerse con su propia familia. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad de poder hacer las mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Rolando A. is 25, is single, and lives in Villa El Carmen. He travels to León and works in the mayor's office as a general accountant. He lives with his parents. Previously, he worked at a business in accounts receivable part time. He has worked very hard at school, and he is in his last year of his accounting program. He also has started to construct his own home on his parents' land, but he hasn't finished it yet because there are still many details to be completed. With this loan, he will construct the kitchen, and little by little, he will finish his house, where he hopes to establish his own family. He is thankful to the microfinance institution for giving him the opportunity to make improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to construct his kitchen.

loans.name: Berenice

texts.es:
Berenice tiene 65 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y un nieto D. 19 años D. edad en el caserío Sime, distrito D. Pítipo, ubicado a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

DesD. hace más D. 20 años se dedica a la venta D. aves D. corral, usualmente cría pavos y gallinas, pero hace algunas semanas una extraña peste mató a todas sus gallinas quedándose sólo con los pocos pavos que cría actualente.

Los ingresos que percibe D. este negocio son utilizados habitualmente en su salud y en la D. su esposo, ambos, debido a su edad avanzada y por la gran cantidad D. esfuerzo físico que realizaron durante su juventud trabajando en la agricultura, tienen la necesidad D. acudir constantemente al doctor ya que sufren D. diversas dolencias.

Su nieto estudia en un Instituto D. la zona y durante sus vacaciones también trabaja para ayudar a solventar los gastos del hogar; ella desea invertir en la compra D. más aves D. corral para su engorD. y posterior venta y D. esta manera seguir ayudando a su nieto en sus estudios, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar a nuestra Institución un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr sus objetivos.

Su más granD. anhelo es ver a su nieto convertido en un profesional y trabajador responsable, esta es la segunda vez que trabaja con nosotros y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos por lo que es considerada como una cliente excelente.
texts.en:
Berenice, 65 years old, lives with her husband and 19 year old grandson in the village of Sime, part of the Pitipo district, located 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 20 years, she has raised and sold fowl -- usually turkeys and chickens. However, a few weeks ago, a strange plague killed all her chickens so now she is left only with a few turkeys. The money her business makes is used to pay for the costs needed to maintain both her and her husband's health now that since they are growing older. The high level of physical labor and farm work they performed in their earlier years has maD. it necessary for them go to the doctor on a regular basis to treat their various ailments. Her grandson attends a local high school and during his vacations, he too works to help pay for household costs. Berenice wishes to invest in the the purchase of more fowl so she can raise and sell them and therefore allow their grandson to continue on with his studies. She requests a loan of 1500 nuevos soles that will allow her to carry out her objectives. Her biggest wish is to see her grandson become a responsible worker in a professional job setting. This is the second time that Berenice has worked with us and has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality in her payments and for this reason, considered as an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of farm fowl (to raise and then sell)

loans.name: Carmelino

texts.en:
Carmelino J. is from the village of San Antonio, Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 37 years old. Carmelino is married and has 4 school-aged children. Carmelino owns & operates a business cutting trees or logging. Carmelino has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Carmelino joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to engage in business activities. Carmelino is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to be used towards the purchase of materials needed to for his business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Carmelino from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tree-cutting materials for business.

loans.name: Umijima

texts.en:
Umijima J. is currently in the business of selling rice, beans, etc. and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice to sell.  Umijima is 30 years old and is married to a policeman. She has 4 children and her children all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine Ayiinakamiye is 36 years old. She is married and has seven children, ages 1 - 17. Vestine and her family live in the Burera District in the Northern Province of Rwanda, a 2-hour drive from Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.   

Vestine grows and sells potatoes. She employs three people in her centrally located business. Vestine is a seasoned entrepreneur with 5 years of experience in the potato industry. Her business is open every day from 6 AM to 4 PM. With the extra income that she hopes to earn from her loan, Vestine plans to continue to expand her business offerings and her enterprise. 

Credit from VFC and Kiva lenders help her to manage the cash flow uncertainties of her seasonal business by adding to her working capital. Also, she will purchase more and different varieties of potatoes to sell to her customers. Vestine is requesting her 5th loan from Vision Finance Company. All of her previous loans were repaid on time and in full.

Vestine thanks VFC and Kiva for their support of her business.

loans.use: To expand the quantity and variety of potatoes that she sells

loans.name: Keng

texts.en:
Mrs. Keng N. lives in Doem Pour village in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and gasoline to pump water to support the rice field. 

Her husband, Mr. Meas Pha, owns a plowing machine, which is hired by the villagers to plow their fields. Mrs. Keng N. is 39 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and gasoline to pump water to support the rice field

loans.name: Akinyemi

texts.en:
Akinyemi sells clothes and colorful sarongs at retail prices to his customers. He hopes to own a boutique in the future. His greatest joy is the one-on-one interaction he has with his customers. 

The festive season is here and he hopes to make more profits. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more sarongs to sell. He is 30 years old and married. He hopes to have children very soon. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin es un joven de 27 años, vive con su pareja, Nilia de 28 años, y con ella tiene dos pequeños hijos; Edinson de 4 y Ángela de 3 años. Ellos viven felices tratando de salir adelante en su pequeña casa ubicada en la zona sierra del Perú. 

Este hombre trabajador se levanta cada día con los primeros rayos del sol con la sola idea de progresar en la vida, y así se dirige a sus tierras en las que cultiva papa y alverjas. Todos los días es una difícil tarea de sembrar para esperar la cosecha, cuidar con paciencia la tierra que le proporcionará el dinero para sostener a su familia. Él realiza las labores del campo con la ayuda de su esposa y le gusta este trabajo porque lo aprendió de muy pequeño de sus padres, posteriormente puso en práctica sus conocimientos para sacar adelante a sus pequeños hijos, pues para el futuro quisiera que tengan la oportunidad de estudiar y llegar a alcanzar lo que él no pudo. Además considera el negocio muy rentable porque vende sus productos al por mayor a comerciantes que ya conoce; para el futuro tiene pensado sembrar mayor cantidad de papa y alverja, además de llegar a comprar un terreno y un auto para poder movilizarse con su familia y llevar sus productos, pues la zona por donde vive está alejada de la ciudad.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y ya piensa en seguir en el futuro con más préstamos hasta llegar a completar las metas que se ha propuesto en la vida. Edwin está satisfecho con el trabajo de los miembros de su banco comunal porque son bastante solidarios. Tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de semilla de alverja para empezar con la siembra, también insecticidas para cuidar y asegurar la tierra en la que cosecha.
texts.en:
Edwin is a 27 year old young man. He lives with his life partner, Nilia, who is 28. They have two small children. Edinson is four, and Ángela is three. They live happily trying to get ahead in their small house, which is in the mountainous area of Perú. This hard-working man gets up everyday with the first rays of the sun. His only idea in life is to progress. He goes to his fields where he grows potatoes and peas. Everyday it is hard work to plant, wait for the harvest, and patiently take care of the land that gives him the money to support his family. He does the field work with help from his wife. He likes this work because he learned it from his parents when he was very small. Later, he put his knowledge into practice to get his small children ahead. In the future he would like them to have the opportunity to study and achieve what he was not able to. Also, he considers the business to be very profitable because he sells his product wholesale to merchants that he knows. In the future he is planning on planting a larger quantity of potatoes and peas. He also plans to buy land and a car to be able to travel with his family and to carry his products. The area where he lives is far from the city. This is his third loan with MFP. He plans to continue in the future with more loans until he reaches the life goals that he has set for himself. Edwin is satisfied with the work of the members of his communal bank because they are very supportive. He plans to use the money he is asking for to buy pea seeds to start planting. He will also buy insecticides for the land that he works.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Roberth

texts.es: Roberth de 23 años, es un joven muy empeñoso y trabajador, vive en la casa de su hermana con ella y  sus sobrinos.Hace algún tiempo trabajaba apoyando a su hermana en la atención de unas cabinas de Internet, y gracias a esta actividad  se le ocurrió aperturar  su propio negocio de  alquiler de juegos de video. Para realizarlo junto un capital y compró algunos televisores, y después unos videos de  playstations, para poder brindar el mejor servicio. El negocio va muy bien y tiene gran acogida, ya que muchos jóvenes suelen ir a su local  no solo por la variedad de juegos que ofrece, sino también por la atención, ya que Roberth se esmera mucho para que  los clientes se sientan cómodos, además  tiene muchas ganas de progresar para forjarse un futuro mejor es por esta razón que quiere hacer crecer su negocio y ya tiene planeado comprar mayor cantidad de juegos y también más  televisores y playstantions, para lograr captar mayor cantidad de  clientes.Aunque es su primer crédito con  MFP promete ser muy responsable y sabe que no dejará de pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.Con el dinero del préstamo tiene pensando comprar más cantidad de CDS de juegos de video,  y mejorar su local.
texts.en:
Roberth is 23 years old. He is a very entrepreneurial and hardworking young man. He lives in his sister’s house with her and her children. He worked for a while helping his sister with some internet cabins, and thanks to that work it occurred to him to open his own business renting video games. To do this, he pulled together capital to buy some televisions, and after that, some Playstation videos. The business is going very well and it has many customers. Lots of young people like to go to his store not just for the variety of games that he offers, but also because puts in a lot of effort so that his customers will feel comfortable. He really wants to progress and make a good future for himself. He wants to grow his business and he has plans to buy more games and also televisions and Playstations so that he can gain a larger number of customers. Though this is his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma [Kiva Field Partner], he promises to be very responsible and he will make his payments punctually because he has a great desire to get ahead. With the money from the loan he plans to buy more video game CDs and to improve his store.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve his busniess with new equipment

loans.name: Lilita Lilia

texts.en:
Lilita Lilia S. is from the village of Guinsiliban , Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old. Lilita Lilia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lilita Lilia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lilita Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lilita Lilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilita Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lilita Lilia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Lilita Lilia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Binetou

texts.en: Ms. Binetou M., aged 46, has been a commercante (vendor) since her youth, being influenced by her parents. She sells fabrics and shoes, which she buys in large quantities and sells them to smaller boutiques. In general, she sells her goods on credit, allowing her customers more flexibility.    Most of her merchandise she buys from Nouakchott, the capital of neighboring Mauritania, where prices are significantly lower. However, the voyage takes a minimum of 10 hours each way, so her clients are happy to buy from her instead of making the trip themselves. This is the third loan for Ms. M.. She is married and the mother of two children, aged 12 and 18.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and shoes in Mauritania

loans.name: Bettys Adalgisa

texts.es:
Bettys T. de 65 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposo le ayuda en la tienda con el tiene 6 hijo todos ya mayores de edad. 

Bettys empezó su negocio hace 30 años atrás, vendiendo arroz y azúcar poco a poco tuvo ingresos necesarios para vender más productos y tener algunas modificaciones en su negocio. 

Ahora Bettys trabaja todos los días desde las 06h30 hasta las 00h00, vendiendo arroz, enlatados, lácteos, verduras, etc. Algunas de las complicaciones que tiene son los cortes de energía que hace el gobierno. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, lácteos para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener su negocio mas ampliado y así poder asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Bettys T. is 65 years old and lives in an urban area in the Guayaquil suburb. Her home is made of concrete and she has all the basic services, her husband helps her in the store, and she has 6 children with him, all are grown up.

Bettys began her business some 30 years ago selling rice and sugar and little by little she began getting profits that allowed her to sell more products and to make some improvements in her business.

Now Bettys works everyday from 06h30 to 00h00, selling rice, canned goods, milk products, vegetables, etc. Some of the problems that she has are the blackouts that the government does.

With the loan she will buy rice, sugar, milk products for her business. In the future she wants to expand her business and in this way secure the future of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, and milk products.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with four children, who attend school. She owns a two-roomed house where she lives with five people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. The family gets two meals per day. Her greatest monthly expense are food, rent and school fees. 

Jane owns a saloon where she works five days per week. She would like to purchase chemicals and machines for her saloon with the Ush. 800,000 loan from MCDT. She rents the space for her business, which she has been running since 1993. She has at least five customers, mainly women, per day. Her greatest challenge are thieves and seasonality. Jane has worked with MCDT since 1997 and chose the organization because they are reliable. Jane hopes to build her own house someday.

loans.use: To buy more hair chemicals and machines for her salon.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Pov H. is 45 years old and the leader of a four-member group loan offered by AMK, located in Boeng Khpob village in Kandal province. The members of the group will use the loan for different purposes.  Mrs. Pov H. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Song Hok, is a construction worker who can receive a little salary to support his family. Mrs. Pov H. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor to support her crops. This couple has four children. One of the children is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other three are students in the local school and support their parent's business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Jocelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn P. is from the village of Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Jocelyn is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jocelyn is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a business selling new clothing to local community members. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jocelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian tiene 30 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposa Elizabeth (24) y de sus 2 menores hijos, en un barrio ubicado en la selva central peruana. 

Este trabajador hombre se dedica, desde muy joven, a la agricultura y en la actualidad siembra frutos cítricos y plátanos en sus chacras propias. Confiesa que en este tipo de trabajo se debe ser muy cuidadoso para asegurar la buena producción de la siembra y aunque ha tenido varios fracasos en la vida, dice que jamás se debe dejar de trabajar para lograr salir adelante. Es así que cada día se levanta muy temprano para vigilar sus cultivos, generalmente trabaja solo, pero cuando aumenta la producción por diversos factores contrata operarios que le ayudan en la siembra o cosecha. Cuando recoge la cosecha vende toda su producción a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona, quienes le que pagan regulares precios por cada saco de fruta. Además, ya tiene pensado, para más adelante, sembrar en mayor cantidad diversidad de frutas, ya que es un negocio muy rentable.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y se muestra muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando, también dice que está muy satisfecho con el desempeño de su banco comunal, ya que todos los integrantes son muy responsables en el pago de sus cuotas.

Cristian tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de un terreno pequeño para seguir sembrando en mayor cantidad y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Cristian, 30, lives in his own home in the central Peruvian jungle with his wife, Elizabeth, 24, and their two children. This hard-working man has been a farmer since he was very young; he grows citrus fruits and bananas on his own farmlands. He confesses that he must be very careful with this type of work in order to insure a good crop and, despite several failures in his life, he must never stop working in order to get ahead. Every day he rises very early to watch over his crops. He usually works alone but, when production increases for any reason, he hires hands to help him plant or harvest. His harvested crops are sold to area wholesalers who pay the usual prices for each sack of fruit. In addition, his plans for the future are to plant a greater variety of fruit because this is quite a profitable business. This is his 4th loan with MFP and he is very grateful to all the people that made the loan possible so that he can continue working. He also states that he is very satisfied with the work his communal bank does because all the members are responsible with their payments. Cristian is going to use the funds to buy a small lot to add to his farmlands so that he can plant a larger quantity thereby increasing his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farmland.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Mrs. Thorn P., 44 years old, is a villager who lives in Pun Phnum village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns one hectare of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Tob Yem, is a police officer who receives a small salary to support his family. Even with both businesses, they still don't earn enough income to support the family. Thus, Mrs. Thorn P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. This couple has two children who are students in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Mrs. Sim Un Village Bank Group

texts.en: Seventeen people make up this village bank loan and they are living in Angk Khlaeu village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sim U. is a village bank president, selected by all the members, who will use their loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare piece of land. On this land, she cultivates rice, which she later sels,l to support her family's costs of living. Her problem is that her rice field is on time to do farming but they did not have enough money to support the harvest. So, to improve production, Mrs. Sim U. is asking for a loan to do the farming this current year. Her husband, Mr. Saret Nget, is a construction laborer. She is a mother of a child who is enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To do farming.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa F. is from the village of Siayan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 52 years old, married and has 2 adult and 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Nimfa owns & operates a general store. The other source of income for the business comes from the pension of her husband, as a retired policeman. Nimfa has been engaged in her business for 19 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Nimfa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nimfa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nimfa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nimfa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.
       
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 
       
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy products to sell and for the tuition fees of her children.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 48 years old.  Bernadette is commonly known in the business of selling clothes for women and she has been in this business for about 15 years.  Bernadette's business hours are from 8 am to 5 pm every day.

Bernadette is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company and this loan will allow to expand her business through starting the sale of additional clothes for men and children.  With these additional clothes for sale, Bernadette hopes that she will earn more profit than previously which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and a secure future.

loans.use: Different styles of men's and children's clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase candies to stock his business.

loans.name: Mbollo Moy Dole Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité MBOLLO MOY DOLE est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il fait partie d'un des groupes de solidarité du Banc Villageois de DIADIORDE. Il est composé de 22 femmes toutes issues du même village. Elles ont monté leur groupe par voisinege et par affinité.

Madame Ndiouma B., debout à l'extrême droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant et tutrice de 02 autres. Elle est à sa secondes expérience avec l'institution de CAURIE-MICRO FINANCE. 

Elle fait un commerce de légumes. Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour revendre en gros et au détail dans son village. 

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'augmenter son approvisionnement en légumes. 

Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge familiale, par rapport à la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group, Mbollo Moy Dole, was created on 30th December 2009. It is one of the solidarity groups of the Banc Villageois in Diadiorde and is made up of 22 women coming from the same village. The women who set up the group are neighbors or friends. Mrs. Ndiouma B., who is standing on the extreme right of the photo, is in charge of the group. She is 48 years old, married and mother to one child, as well as being guardian to two other children. She is on her second loan from the Caurie microfinance institution. She trades in vegetables. She gets her supplies at the weekly markets in order to resell them on a wholesale and retail basis in her village. Her new loan will allow her to increase her stock of vegetables. She helps her husband to take care of the family, in terms of food, health and the children's schooling expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Mamasabir

texts.en:
Mamasabir J. is a resident of Kadamjai, a nice town on the south of Kyrgyzstan. He is 43 years old, married, and has three daughters and a son.  The older daughter studies at university and the others are at school. Five years ago, with the initial investment of 10,000 KGS, Mamasabir and his wife started to grow rice. Selling some part of the harvest, Mamasabir makes about $195 per month.  That profit made it possible for him to save money and purchase a vehicle. With money received from this loan he wants to purchase two tons of mineral fertilizers which are needed for sowing rice. In the near future Mamasabir plans to celebrate his daughter’s wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused micro-finance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only micro-finance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Irakoze Ii Group

texts.fr:
Jean de Dieu N. est un commerçant âgé de 38 ans qui habite la localité de Gatumba en  Commune  de Mutimbuzi de la Province de Bujumbura Rural. Il fait le commerce de manioc  au Marché de Gatumba il ya de cela 15 ans. Il a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 10e des études secondaires. Son épouse, Rebecca Ngendanzi est aussi commercante de pommes de terre. Il arrive au 2e cycle dans le crédit communautaire avec Turame. 

Il est père  6 enfants : 2 filles et 4 garçons dont 3 d’entre eux étudient. 
  
Il demande le crédit Kiva avec l’objectif d’avoir un grand capital pour  augmenter la quantité de manioc à vendre dans l’espoir de réaliser un grand bénéfice. Il apprécie beaucoup le crédit Turame-Kiva du fait qu’il est facile à obtenir et les conditions de remboursement sont les plus souples comparativement aux autres institutions de microfinance.

 Il est un des membres du groupe  communautaire « I. II ».
texts.en:
Jean de Dieu N., a member of the I. II community group, is a 38-year-old merchant who lives in the Gatumba area of the Mutimbuzi Commune in the province of Bujumbura Rural. He has been selling manioc at the Gatumba Market for 15 years. He attended school up to 10th grade at the secondary level. His wife, Rebecca Ngendanzi, is also a merchant and sells potatoes. He is on his second loan cycle in the community loan program with Turame. He is the father of six children: two girls and four boys, of whom three are students. He is seeking this loan through Kiva with the goal of having more capital to increase the quantity of manioc for sale, with the hope of realizing a larger profit. He is highly appreciative of the Turame-Kiva loan partnership because the loans are easy to obtain and the repayment terms are smooth, compared to other microfinance institutions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To have a large capital base to increase the amount of manioc for sale, with the hope of realizing a larger profit

loans.name: Esther Ekua

texts.en:
Esther Ekua E. is divorced and has five dependents. She has been through junior high school.

Esther sells fresh and fried fish at Elima and uses the income she makes from her sales to take care of her dependents. She will use the loan to purchase more fish to sell.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Esther plans to save to further her dependents’ education.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. She has been farming for the last twenty years and has employed four people from her community. Her farm produces tea, maize, milk, beans, nappier grass and bananas, which are all sold locally. She also earns income from hiring out her tractor.

Eunice is 52 years old and a widowed mother of 7 children, who are between the ages of 14 and 33. Four of the children are currently attending school.

She successfully repaid her previous loan of 45,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 70,000KES to purchase a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will go towards her children's educations and also improve the livelihood of her family. Her biggest challenges are limited land for planting nappier grass, lack of a good breed of animals, and diseases. She would like to acquire more quality dairy cows that will increase her milk production in future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia N. is from the village of Wigan Cordon. She is 41 years old. Virginia is married. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Virginia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Virginia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 43 years old. Analyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Analyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Analyn wants her children to finish college so she works hard to achieve it. 

Analyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to buy farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Robinson

texts.es: Desde hace 20 años Robinson López viene construyendo su experiencia en el comercio informal, él inició vendiendo gorras y relojes,  y desde el año 2006 añadió electrodomésticos, pero como la era de la tecnología lo revolucionó todo, ahora no solo vende electrodomésticos sino también controles remotos, celulares y hasta presta también el servicio de mantenimiento y reparación de estos equipos. Poco a poco y adaptándose a los cambios, Robinson ha logrado sostener su negocio y también su hogar conformado por su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 12 y 15 años, por los que aun debe trabajar mucho,  para que ellos logren una buena educación a nivel profesional.  Como su sueño es ampliar el negocio para seguirse moviendo en el mercado con mayor amplitud, y ajustado a las oportunidades, está solicitando su credikiva,  pues planea comprar con él, controles para televisión, DVD, aires acondicionados y Compact disk de música y de películas. En la actualidad su capital de trabajo es de $1.795.000 COP, su rentabilidad sobre las ventas es de 34,56%, y su margen de utilidad es de un 12%. Robinson es un hombre muy contento que interactúa en un espacio comercial, caracterizado por una competencia sana entre iguales, lo que le permite la debida interacción comercial y especialmente la cooperación con otros negocios muy cercanos con las misma características mercadológicas.
texts.en: For 20 years Robinson López has been building his experience in informal commerce.  He started out selling caps and watches and in 2006 he added electrical appliances.  However, as the technological age has revolutionized everything, he now no longer sells only electrical appliances but also remote controls, cell phones and he even provides maintenance and repair services for this equipment.  Little by little, adapting to changes, Robinson has managed to sustain his business and also his household which consists of his wife and his 2 children aged 12 and 15.  He still needs to work hard for his children so that they can achieve a good professional-level education.  As his dream is to expand his business in order to continue moving in the market and adjusting to opportunities, he is requesting this Kiva loan.  With it he plans to buy television controls, DVDs, air conditioners, music CDs and movies.  His current working capital is $1,975,000 Colombian pesos.  His profitability on his sales is 34.56% and his profit margin is 12%.  Robinson is a very happy man who works in a commercial space characterized by a healthy competition between equals which allows him to interact and cooperate with other nearby businesses with the same market characteristics.

loans.use: Television controls, DVDS, air conditioners, music CDs and movies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 59-year-old married man living with his wife and two children in Lebanon. He is an experienced carpenter. He has owned his shop for almost 30 years. He manufactures home furniture and he works closely with some local galleries. He also makes home furniture for clients. He presents many choices and designs from furniture catalogs. His story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to take care of household expenses, sick and aging family members, and at the same time run a business. He is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new pusher machine. This new machine will allow him to increase his manufacturing and deliver his products faster. In the future, he is looking to further expand his merchandise and invest in a new wood-sanding machine. He hopes that the coming year will continue to bring positive growth and increased sales.

loans.use: To purchase a new pusher machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy all the requirements of his general store

loans.name: Zarah Mae

texts.en:
Zarah Mae C. is from the village of Agusan Canyon, Camp Phillips, Bukidnon. She is 24 years old. Zarah Mae is married and has two small children. To make a living, Zarah Mae owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and snack foods in the local community. Zarah Mae has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Zarah Mae joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Zarah Mae has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Zarah Mae is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and beverages. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Zarah Mae from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
SABOUGNOUMA est un regroupement de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant  en  moyenne 39 ans, 7 enfants et vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à KANSSENE dans la préfecture de TOMINIAN (Région de Ségou, République du Mali).Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles mènent différentes activités : vente de diverses marchandises et arachide. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année  et  sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
YARA C. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 50 sacs d’arachide. Elle s’approvisionne dans les différentes foires environnantes pour revendre à SAN en gros aux sœurs catholiques qui font la pâte d’arachide. 
Elle espère sur un bénéfice de 14500FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en: Sabougnouma is a group of 6 women, all married, who are 39 years old on average, have 7 children and live in large traditional families in Kanssense in the prefecture of Tominian (region of Ségou, Republic of Mali).  The women know one another through parental and neighborhood ties.  They run different businesses, such as the sale of different merchandise and peanuts.  In the interest of meeting the growing need of their customer base, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are on their first group loan.  Yara Cissa expects to use her loan to buy 50 bags of peanuts.  She stocks up in different fairs in the surrounding areas to re-sell wholesale in San to the Catholic sisters who make peanut butter.  She hopes to make a profit of 14,500 FCFA, a sum which will allow her to repay the loan and to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: Purchase of peanuts

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar has a furniture making workshop. He produces chairs, tables and many other items using bamboo. Anwar is one of the very few people who are still producing such furniture.

Anwar is a father of four daughters and four sons, who are school students, one of Anwar's sons them works with him. Anwar took a loan from FATEN to purchase more supplies of bamboo and to produce a larger number of chairs and tables to increase the returns.

Anwar appears in the picture here in his workshop showing some of his works.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo needed for chairs production

loans.name: Juan Jaime

texts.es: El señor Juan Jaime G. G. solicita  un préstamo para impermeabilizar su vivienda; por que en las temporadas de lluvias el agua se trasmina y su techo se esta deteriorando. Juan Jaime quiere prevenir que el problema se agrave  y tenga que gastar más de lo previsto. Para poder cubrir los gastos el trabaja en maquiladora de Lunes a Viernes y su esposa se queda tiempo extra para tener un ingreso mayor.
texts.en: Juan Jaime G. G. is requesting a loan to waterproof his house because when it rains the water seeps inside and his roof is deteriorating.  Juan Jaime would like to prevent this problem from becoming worse so that he doesn't end up having to spend even more money.  In order to cover his expenses, Juan Jaime works in a cross-border assembly plant from Monday to Friday.  His wife works overtime in order to earn more money.

loans.use: To waterproof his home

loans.name: Bertha Maruja

texts.es:
La Señora. Bertha C. es socia del banco comunal Azogueñitas, vive en la comunidad de Zhullin en la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es hermosa por su estructura colonial y  moderna, también es reconocida por su iglesia catedral que se encuentra en lo mas alto de esta ciudad, su gente es muy cordial y amable.
 
La Señora. Bertha tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos quienes aun son pequeños y estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Bertha se dedica a la cría de pollos actividad que la realiza en su casa, se levanta muy temprano para alimentar a sus animales y de allí sale a su trabajo ya que realiza los quehaceres domésticos en otras casas.

Se encuentra varios años en el banco comunal y le gustan las charlas de educación que les brindan los promotores en cada reunión. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para creer más en este negocio. Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Bertha C. is a member of the communal bank named "Azoguenitas". She lives in the community of Zhullin in the city of Azogues. This city is beautiful for its colonial and modern architecture and it is also well known for its cathedral church upon the most elevated place in the city. The people are very polite and kind. 

Bertha is 32 years old, married, and she has 4 children who are still young and attend school in the city. By working together they have managed to build a house of their own.

Bertha raises poultry, a business that she runs from her house. She gets up very early to feed the livestock and from there she sets out to work in private homes, providing house cleaning services. 

She has been with the communal bank for many years and she enjoys the educational talks that are presented at each meeting. The funds from her loan will be invested in the purchase of poultry, to expand her business. Her goal is to finish building her house.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy electronics to resell

loans.name: Melba

texts.en: Melba is a 41-year-old widow who supports her family by operating a sari-sari store. She lives in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. Melba joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Melba has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future and for household consumption. Melba is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clay, firewood and nacazcol (seeds that provide a black dye).

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is 40 years old and married to Emily T., a business lady. They have five school-going children aged 14,11, eight, six, and three years old. Ezekiel owns a "posho" (cornmeal) mill in Tulon trading centre in Kapsabet town. It has been in operation for a period of six years with a monthly income of KES. 21,000.

He has taken out a loan of KES.80,000 from KADET LTD, this being his fourth loan after he successfully serviced his previous loans well and in good time. He intends to use this amount to purchase spare parts for the posho mill and buy more maize for the business.  

The profits will be used to educate his children and look after their whole family's welfare. His dreams of his business becoming sustainable in the future.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his "posho" (cornmeal) mill and buy more maize for sale.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna C. is from the village of Samay, Gingoog City. She is 53 years old. Digna is married and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Digna owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling coconuts for copra & also green bananas in the local community. Digna has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Digna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Digna is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts & bananas. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Digna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts & bananas.

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es: Wilder, de 29 años convive desde hace 5 años con Cirila. Ambos tienen una hija, “Britney”, a la que quieren mucho y cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Huayounioc. El trabajo al que se dedica desde hace 10 años es la agricultura, desde entonces cuida con mucho esmero sus cultivos de papa y arveja, productos que le proporcionan buenas ganancias después de cada temporada de cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder tener tiempo libre para dedicarse a otras actividades, como el trasporte público cubriendo las rutas Palca-Carpapata. Además cuenta que hace algún tiempo está pensando incursionar en la venta de petróleo en la carretera central, ya que ahí no se encuentra grifos a disposición. Por esa razón está seguro que podrá obtener buenas ganancias con este nuevo negocio. De esa manera espera obtener buenas ganancias para comenzar con la compra de sus propios terrenos agrícolas, minimizando así los gastos de alquiler que hace anualmente.  Él pertenece al banco comunal “Progreso Huayounioc”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera obtener buenos resultados con su asociación. Wilder, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios cilindros de petróleo para comenzar con su nuevo negocio.
texts.en: Wilder is 29 years old and has lived with his partner, Cirila for some 5 years. Together they have a daughter, Britney, who they love very much and take care of in their home in Huayounioc. He has worked for 10 years in agriculture; he takes very good care of his potato and pea crops, since they give him a good income after every harvest season. What Wilder enjoys most of his work is being able to have free time to do other jobs like public transportation in the Palca-Carpapata routes. He has wanted to sell petroleum in the main road for some time since there isn’t any self service in the area. This is why he is sure that he will be able to have good profits with this new business and plans to buy his own farmland which will minimize his annual rental costs. Wilder belongs to the “Progreso Huayounioc” Communal Bank; this is his first loan with MFP and hopes to have good results. Wilder will use the loan to buy various petroleum cylinders to begin his new business.

loans.use: buy petroleum cylinders to sell fuel.

loans.name: Mujeres De Villa Paraiso 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Luz is the coordinator of her group Mujeres de Villa Paraiso (Women of Village Paradise) 1 & 2. Her group is located in one of the neighborhoods of Los Alcarrizos, a community to the northwest of Santo Domingo.

Luz makes her home here in a simple structure except for the rainy seasons. When it rains, her area gets flooded so her most important challenge is to have a comfortable house in a better neighborhood. She lives with her husband and their two children.

Luz is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing beans, coconut, charcoal, sugar, milk, corn and other items. She sells traditional candies such as coconut and milk, sweet beans, Chaca (sweet corn with milk), and other items. Her business profits are to save and invest in her business.

Luz is dreaming to have a depot, where she could sell different products and goods. This is the future for her business, and she will work to make it come true with the Lord's will.

loans.use: to buy beans, coconut, charcoal, sugar, corn, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 50 years old and married with eight children. Her husband works as a farmer and driver. Erlinda is also a farmer. She helps her husband till their land where they grow corn. Erlinda also raises pigs in their backyard.

Erlinda has requested a loan and plans to use it to purchase corn seed, fertilizers and feed. Erlinda hopes to earn more and be able to save for her children's education. She also wants to set aside a budget for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase corn seed, fertilizers and feed

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de URUBAMBA, perteneciente a la provincia de URUBAMBA,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Emperatriz; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 7 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chicha (bebida a base de maíz) y crianza de animales, la socia cría pollo y cuyes y la venta de chicha lo realiza en su casa en forma ambulatoria, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de chicha y crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales y para comprar insumos para hacer la chicha como maíz y jora.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Emperatriz, 44, is a member of the “Cristo Asención de Rumichaca” communal bank which is located in Urubamba District belonging to Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.

She’s married and has 7 children.  She alternates her daily chores with chicha sales (corn based beverage) and with raising farm animals; she raises chickens and guinea pigs.  She is a home-based chicha vendor.  She wants to expand both businesses and is asking for a loan to buy animals and to buy ingredients to make chicha like corn and jora.

She is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy animals and to buy chicha making ingredients like corn and jora.

loans.name: Yolanda Del Carmen

texts.es: Yolanda del Carmen D. 45 años D. edad, vive en su casa con su compañero D. vida José D. 54 años y sus dos hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Yolanda ha trabajado durante mucho tiempo para sacar adelante a su familia y darles lo mejor que Ella ha podido. Posee un puesto en el que venD. frutas y verduras en las afueras del Mercado Local D. la zona donD. ella habita. Su puesto es muy conocido y muchas personas la prefieren ya que es una mujer honesta y confiable que ha sabido ganarse a sus clientes. Ofrece variedad y calidad en sus frutas y verduras. Todo esto ha hecho que sus productos cada día sean más demandados.  Ella es una mujer emprendedora y no quiere dejar pasar esta oportunidad en la que sus ventas marchan excelentemente, y es por esta razón que solicita este crédito para comprar variedad D. frutas y verduras frescas como: yucas, limones, frijoles, papas, tomates, piñas, sandias, melones, naranjas, etc. Para poder ofrecer  a sus clientes variedad D. productos y así poder aspirar a una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Yolanda del Carmen is 45 years old and she lives in a home of her own together with her life partner, Jose, 54 years old, and their two children, both of whom are in school. Yolanda has worked for a very long time to proviD. for her family and to give them the best that she could. She has a stand from where she sells fruits and vegetables in the central market of the region where she lives. Her stand is very well known and many people prefer to buy from her because she is an honest and trustworthy woman, and she has known how to earn her clients. She offers variety of quality fruits and vegetables. All of this has maD. her products to be in increasing demand. She is an enterprising woman and she doesn't want to pass up any opportunities. For this reason she has requested a loan. She will purchase a variety of fresh fruits and vegetables, such as: yuccas, lemons, beans, potatoes, tomatoes, pineapples, watermelons, melons, oranges, etc. This ways she will be able to offer her clients a variety of products and it will let her aspire towards a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fresh fruits and vegetables, such as: yuccas, lemons, beans, potatoes, tomatoes, pinapples, watermelons, melons, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with one child. 

Tessie has a retail shop that sells T-shirts & blouses. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy T-shirts & blouses to sell.

Tessie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Tessie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts & blouses to sell.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline, 45, is a single mother of three children, she runs a food stall (cooking and selling fries) business. She has been loaned KES.5,000 which she plans to use to purchase vegetables for sale (kale to diversify her business).

With her anticipated profits, she would like support her family financially and stabilize her vegetable business. In the future she would like to grow her business to and enjoy the profits made.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for sale (kale to diversify her business)

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité KUÑA GUAPA tiene 5 ciclos de formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya. Las integrantes se sacrifican y luchan día a día para brindar un futuro mejor y distinto a la realidad que a ellas tocó vivir. Actualmente cuenta con 15 miembros, donde todas ellas trabajan dentro de un ambiente de respeto, solidaridad y sobre todo responsabilidad.
La señora Hermelinda tiene una despensa, comenta que tiene muchos clientes que son de su barrio y de zonas aledañas, tiene mucha demanda de todo tipo de productos. Comenta que le gustaría ampliar su local para poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma también ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Dice que todo lo que hace es por el bien de su familia y por aquellos que de ella dependen.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías, como ser comestibles, bebidas, y otros para el abastecimiento de su local. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le da, ya que de obtener el crédito, este le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Communal bank Kuña Guapa has been in 5 lending cycles with Fundación Paraguaya. The members make sacrifices and fight on a daily basis in order to provide a better future, different from the reality in which they lived. Currently the group has 15 members and all of them work in an environment of respect, solidarity and, above all, responsibility.
Hermelinda owns a small grocery store. She reports that she has many customers from her neighborhood and surrounding areas and there is a lot of demand for all kinds of products. She says that she would like to expand her store so that her business can keep on growing and her customers can be more comfortable. She says that everything she does is for the well-being of her family and of those who depend on her.
She requests this loan in order to purchase goods such as foodstuffs, beverages, etc. to stock up her store. She thanks the Fundación for the opportunity she is given, because getting the loan will be a big help.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs, beverages and other goods to stock up her store.

loans.name: Lester Javier

texts.es:
Lester, tiene veinte y nueve años de edad, es soltero estudiante universitario y trabaja como técnico administrativo.
Lester acude a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un préstamo para cancelar aranceles de la universidad ya que este se encuentra en su último año de su carrera y para pagos de servicios básicos de la casa.
Agradece a ceprodel por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Lester is 29 years old and single. He is a university student and works as an administrative technician.

Lester came to the offices of CEPRODEL to request a loan in order to pay his university fees, since he is in his last year before earning his degree. He will also pay for basic household utilities. Lester is grateful to CEPRODEL for this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees and his basic household utilities.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
This is Mary Grace, 32, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Marlon, an electrical engineer, and she is the mother of three children. The eldest is in high school while the other two are in elementary. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 
 
Mary Grace maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon and Natasha. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits for dealers. Aside from direct selling, she also operates a small computer shop. Her regular customers are students, neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy orders for her customers and also to add additional stocks of school supplies. A portion of the loan will go to the maintenance of her computers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Mary Grace hopes her business grows and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anis

texts.en: Anis is a 62-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child. He is the main income provider for his family. He has been working as a vegetable trader for the past 40 years. He works on a freelance basis, distributing goods using his van. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more vegetables. He plans to expand his business by increasing his sales and, therefore, his profits. In the future, he intends to hire a part-time employee to help him with product distribution.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Dilhumor

texts.ru: Дилхумор трудолюбивая и честная женщина, и заботливая мать 4 детей.  Она занимается  куплей и продажей  сухофруктов. За плечами Дилхумор имеет 13 летний  опыт предпринимательской работы. За полученных доход от бизнеса она самостоятельно  вырастила детей и женила сына. Дилхумор много работает и хочет развить бизнес  и этим  обеспечить детей всем необходимым. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 8000 сомони для развития и расширения бизнеса, что принесет пользу и бизнесу и семейному бюджету.
