texts.en: Dilhumor is a hard-working and honest woman and a caring mother of four children.  She is involved in buying and selling dried fruits.  Dilhumor has 13 years of experience in entrepreneurial work behind her.  She used the income from this business to raise her children on her own and married off her son.  Dilhumor works a lot and wants to develop her business and provide her children with everything that they need.  She is requesting a loan in the sum of 8000 somoni to develop and expand her business in order to benefit the business and the family budget.

loans.use: to develop and expand her business

loans.name: Carmen Mercedes

texts.es:
Carmen, una señora trabajadora que a pesar de ser madre soltera ha podido salir adelante con la ayuda de Dios.
Con el préstamo anterior ha podido surtir su negocio e incrementarlo pero no tanto como ella esperaba.
Ahora ella solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertir más en su negocio, además ella quisiera comprar un local en donde podría expandir su negocio.
Su sueño es poder terminar su casa pero al 100%.
texts.en:
Despite being a single mother, Carmen is a hardworking woman who has been able to get ahead with help of God. With her previous loan she was able to restock and increase her business, but not as much as she expected.

She is now requesting a new loan so that she can invest more into her business. In addition, Carmen wants to buy a shop so that she can expand her business.

Her dream is to finish the construction of her house 100%.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Thea

texts.en: Thea is a widow and has four children. She is 41 years old and has been planting crops with her parents since she was around 10 years old. Now she plants crops on her own. This is the first loan that Thea is requesting from VisionFund. Thea took the loan to plant crops on her farmland. She hopes that the crops will grow well and can make more income to feed her children and she can set aside some savings for future needs.

loans.use: To plant crops.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es: Aurelia, de 34 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive con Callo, su esposo desde hace 13 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Aymará. Como buena mujer del campo, ella siembra diversos tubérculos como: papa, olluco y mashua, los cuales cuida constantemente, no puede ocupar todo su tiempo; pues también se dedica al tejido de chompas a base de lana, según cuenta realiza un promedio de 6 ejemplares al mes, ganando 40 soles por cada una, pues invierte un promedio de 10 a 20 soles por ovillo, “me gusta tejer es mi pasatiempo”, afirma. Pero como es hábil y creativa también borda faldas típicas en el mes de agosto donde se realiza la festividad agrícola llamada “santiago”; ahí obtiene una ganancia de mil soles por ese mes. Pero como tiene muchos gastos, su esposo le ayuda trabajando como cargador de sacos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Huancayo. Donde tiene buenas ganancias. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “los pinos” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Aurelia, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Aurela, 34, is a hardworking woman.  She lives with Callo, her husband of 13 years. They have three children they are raising in their own home, located in the rural settlement of Aymará. As a good country woman, she plants various root crops such as potatoes, olluco and mashua, which she constantly tends, however she cannot spend all her time on them. She also knits woolen sweaters. She notes that she produces on average six sweaters a month, earning 40 soles for each one and she invests on average from 10 to 20 soles for a ball of yarn.  “I enjoy knitting, it is my hobby”, she states.

However, as she is skillful and creative, she also embroiders traditional skirts in the month of August when the agricultural festival called “Santiago” is held; there she earns an income of 1,000 soles for the month. Moreover, as she has many expenses, her husband helps her by working as a bag loader in the wholesale market in Huancayo city, where he earns a good salary.

Aurelia belongs to Los Pinos communal bank and this is her first loan with MFP, where she awaits your collaboration in order to be able to concretize her plans. She promises to meet all of her payments on time. As well she likes being part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people. Upon receiving your support, she will invest the money in the purchase of natural fertilizer to spread on her potato plants.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Sinob

texts.en:
Sinob (in the photo) is 25 years old and his wife, Phallin, is 24 years old. They live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2008 and have one young daughter. 

Sinob and his wife are farmers. They grow beans and cauliflower on their farmland in the village where they live. Sinob is asking for his first loan in the amount of $700 to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm

loans.name: Maria Nohelia

texts.es:
Desde muy pequeña Maria Nohelia aprendió a trabajar de cuenta suya, sin depender de nadie, por ello es que hace más de 32 años tiene su propia tienda ambulante donde vende dulces, refrescos, cigarrillos. Necesita pagar sus deudas para dejar el negocio libre y poder tener más ganancias que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Su más grande sueño es poder ampliar en surtido para prestar un mejor servicio ya que a sus 64 años considera que ser una buena persona y servirle a las personas de la forma que a uno les gusta que lo traten es la mejor manera de conseguir más clientela y así ganar más dinero.
texts.en:
Since she was very young, Maria Nohelia has learned to work on her own account without depending on anyone else.  For this reason, she has had her own street-vending business for more than 32 years, where she sells sweets, sodas, and cigarettes.  She needs to pay her debts to leave her business free, and to be able to have more earnings that will permit her to have a better quality of life.

Her biggest dream is to be able to expand her stock to be able to provide better service.  At 64 years old, she considers herself to be a good person and treats people in the way that she she herself would like to be treated.  This is the best way to get more customers and so earn more money.

loans.use: to purchase stock.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman who has seven children. She is 41 years old and resides at Margos, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte, Philippines. 

Caroline is operating a business venture to earn her living. She is selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. She's had 3 years of experience in this business. Each month, she earns PHP4,000 doing this type of business. 

She has requested a loan of PHP15,000 to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. Caroline has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Caroline wants to build a house and to ensure that her children can finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells sweet potatoes at Efufu. She has been selling sweet potatoes for the past 20 years. Elizabeth is a single parent and has two children. As a single parent she uses her income for the general upkeep of her family. Elizabeth will use her loan to purchase more sweet potatoes for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sweet potatoes for sale

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 29 years old, married and the father of one child.  He sells electronics to earn a living and has been in business for two years.  He describes his business environment as good because his business faces no competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to save his income. He has applied for a loan of 25,000 KES in order to buy electric cables, sockets, adapters and chargers.  He hopes to expand his business and open a cyber cafe in the future.

loans.use: to buy electric cables, sockets, adapters and chargers.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel, aged 29, has worked for most often in her farming business than her hog fattening business. She is focused on the production of rice because it brings high income especially when it provides the necessities needed in farming. In this regard, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 pesos in buying agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, pesticides and of course rice seeds. This activity enabled her family to bring progress, most especially to the education maintenance of her two children.  With the combined great effort of her husband, she could increase their production through her availed loan.

loans.use: buying agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, pesticides and of course rice seeds

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy resides in Nkubu, is married and has three children. She has practiced mixed farming for 11 years, producing and selling bananas, maize, beans, potatoes and milk.

She has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) for purchasing a chuff cutter. This will provide better feeds for her cattle and hence, produce more milk to bring about an increase in income. She will be able to better her children's education. 

Her major challenge is pests and diseases. She says that Juhudi Kilimo has done wonders for her farming.

loans.use: To purchase a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.en:
Leocadia is a business woman who sells and sometimes hawks bananas, yellow bananas, cassava and millet flour. She is a hardworking widowed woman who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. She looks after her one grandchild aged 10 who attends school. She also practices crop farming to earn extra income to take care of herself and her grandchild. She anticipates that she will have a good financially supportive business to carter for her life however she is challenged by weather changes that sometimes stop her from moving around to deliver goods to her committed customers.

She is requesting for a loan to buy more bananas, cassava and millet flour for her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, cassava and millet flour for her business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
I have been a secretary of Konguini Thayu Women Group for the last three years. Prior to joining the group I could not take minutes but now I have been empowered and been able to take the minutes for the group and come-up with an Agenda. I am married and have three children

I have been selling cereals as a business in a small town called Mukuyu in Central Kenya. The business has been progressing very well and the profits I get I have been able to venture into buying and selling sand and stones for building.

loans.use: I have been selling maize and beans and I want to increase stock and also sell other cerals like millet, rice, sorgham and groundnuts

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Don Pedro is a second time lender in the Kiva and Mifex program. He is the owner of a small store in Guayaquil where he sells rice, sugar, oil and other basic groceries. With his last loan he invested in more products and he was able to make some minor improvements to his store. He made all of the payments from his last loan on time and is now hoping he can take out a second. He plans on using the loan money to buy a display refrigerator where he can keep products cool and market at them at the same time. Don Pedro is 56 years and has 6 children, 3 of which still depend on him. He is a Colombian who has lived in Ecuador since he was 18.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Abdul Latif

texts.en: Abdul Latif, son of R., lives in District 8 of Kabul City. He is married and runs a grocery shop. Abdul Latif has started with the individual loan because he needed more money for his business. Now he wants to buy more groceries like soft drinks, tea, sugar, milk, etc. because he says that these goods are very much in demand by people and that he has to buy those things which can be sold quickly. He is happy with the loan process and wants to carry on with them.

loans.use: Buying soft drinks, flour, sugar, tea, etc.

loans.name: Yoli

texts.en:
Yoli, a particularly young woman, started her business eight months ago. She sells food on a wheel cart (locally called a “chimi”) commonly used in populated areas to serve those who go out in the night time and need a place to have a bite when they come out of a bar or night club. She typically serves cooked meat products such as hot dogs, hamburgers, and sandwiches. Her husband and a brother-in-law assist her in this business. She tells us that the “chimi,” although it is a business that requires sacrifice, provides the family with a higher income.

She plans to buy “pierna” (roasted leg of ham), which is in high demand by those who have had a few “frias” (cold beers). This, she feels, will probably bring in either a higher number of customers, or at least she’ll be able to mark up her products according to the increased value added by this specialty food ingredient.

loans.use: To buy a new cart and buy goods for it.

loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
Mrs. Hay S. is a 35-year-old married woman with 4 children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province. Her main business is raising pigs. She earns around $6 each day, while her husband (pictured here because S. is unavailable) works as a motor-taxi driver earning about $3 per day. Three of her children now attend school.

Mrs. Hay S. is humbly requesting a loan to increase the number of her pigs and buy pig feed for her livestock.

loans.use: To increase the number of her livestock by adding more pigs and purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Maura Rosa

texts.es:
My name is Maura and I have a small convenience store in my home. I thank God that since one year ago, I have been able to make some money to help cover family expenses as well as taking care of them. My children also help me in their free time.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Maura, mi acitvidad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitación, desde hace un año y gracias a Dios con los ingresos de este negocio puedo contribuir con los gastos familiares y al mismo tiempo atiendo a mi familia, tambien es importante mensionar que mis hijos me colaboran en su tiempo libre.

loans.use: to buy sugar, butter, rice, grains, dairy products, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Christy J. is 43 years old, a widow with 6 children. She sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks. She has 14 years experience in business. She is from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the loan of US$800 to buy more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks for sale

loans.name: Gueider

texts.es:
Gueider is a 38 years old married man. His wife is a domestic employee in the house of a group of Japanese expatriates. Gueider is dedicated to public transport, he is a "motorcycle-taxi driver", he owns two bikes, the one he drives and the other one he rents out.

His experience as a driver in that zone is pretty vast, due to the high demand on that specific zone he only works there. There are a lot of competitors but there are plenty of clients for all of them. The average price per trip is about Bs.2.00, which is an accessible price to everyone’s budget. Gueider has no negative records at his headquarters and in any other centers of information.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

Gueider es un señor casado de 38 años de edad, su esposa trabaja como empleada doméstica en la casade un grupo de japoneses. Gueider se dedica al transporte público, trabaja como mototaxista y paralelamente recibe la el ingreso que le genera la renta de su otra moto.

Su experiencia como chofer de motos en la zona es bastante amplia ya que la misma demanda permite trabajar continuamente en este rubro. Si bien existe gran competencia en el rubro de transporte en taximotos así también es de elevada la demanda por este medio de transporte. El precio que se cobra por carrera promedio asciende a Bs. 2.-, que es un precio accesible a todo tipo de bolsillo. Gueider no tiene antecedentes negativos en la central de riesgos ni en otros burós de información.

loans.use: Repair two motorcycles

loans.name: Adiatu

texts.en:
Adiatu S. is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She has been doing well because of her good business background. Adiatu sells various groceries and household goods.

With previous loans, Adiatu was able to diversify her business and increased her income. Her business is the only source of income for the family. Adiatu’s husband is unemployed and he assists her in the shop. To increase her inventory of goods, Adiatu is requesting a loan of $700.

loans.use: Adiatu would like to increase the inventory in her store so that her husband can work with her to help generate a larger profit.

loans.name: Ni Luh Sutami

texts.id:
Balinese housewives are usually also active in helping the husband in earning more income. There are many occupations that was traditionally male dominated are now done by women. Ni Luh Sutami is an example. She has been farming cattle for the past 2 years. Her earnings even surpassed her husband's who works as a farmer. So her farm really helps her family's finances tremendously. Each cow can only have a child each year. Each infant cow that is ready for maturing can be sold for $220 to $330, depending on the gender. In general male cows sell more than the female. In the past year, Ni Luh Sutami earned $280 from one infant cow. This earnings is not enough to help her husband to pay for all her family's needs., especially this year her son, Gede Artayasa is starting school. With a loan from Dinari, Ni Luh Sutami expects to buy one more breeder cow. She really hopes that she can produce more cows to be sold so she earns more than last year.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Selain sebagai ibu rumah tangga, ibu-ibu di Bali juga sangat perperan aktif bekerja atau berusaha untuk menunjang usaha / pendapatan suami. Banyak pekerjaan atau usaha yang dulunya dilakukan oleh kaum pria kini sudah dikerjakan oleh para wanita. Seperti apa yang telah dilakukan oleh Ni Luh Sutami. Memelihara ternak sapi yang telah ditekuni sejak 2 tahun belakangan ini telah banyak membantu perekonomian keluarganya bahkan hasil yang didapatpun tak kalah dengan pendapatan suaminya yang bekerja sebagai petani. Seekor Induk sapi dalam satu tahun hanya beranak satu kali.Dan harga seekor anak sapi yang sudah siap untuk di pasarkan untuk bibit berkisar 2 sampai 3 juta rupiah tergantung dari jenis kelaminnya. Pada umumnya sapi jantan harganya lebih mahal di bandingkan yang betina. Dalam tahun terhakhir ini Ni luh Sutami mendapat hasil Rp 2.500.000 dari penjualan 1 ekor anak sapi. Hasil ini dirasa belum cukup untuk bisa membantu penghasilan suaminya yang hanya sebagai petani kecil. ( penggarap tanah orang lain) Apalagi tahun ini Gede Artayasa anaknya harus masuk sekolah sehingga Ni Luh Sutami memerlukan biaya tambahan . Dengan modal pinjaman dari Dinari , Niluh Sutami membeli satu ekor Induk sapi lagi bahkan saat ini kedua induk sapi peliharaan Ni luh Sutami sedang hamil. Besar harapan Niluh Sutami sapi-sapi peliharaanya bisa melahirkan dengan selamat, sehingga tahun ini dia bisa mendapatkan hasil dari jerih payahnya lebih banyak dari tahun yang lalu .

loans.use: Purchase Breeding Cow

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 39 years old. He has three children. Two of them are studying in school. His elderly mother lives with him. He has a small carpentry shop and he applied to get $1200 to purchase new wood, a machine for cutting the wood, and some tools to help him in his work. He also wants to renovate the shop to improve his project and increase his income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new wood and a machine for cutting the wood

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María Luisa is a married mother of 3 children ages 12, 7, and 4. Her husband works as a carpenter. She decided to start her own business because she needed to help with the family finances. Furthermore, her husband earned very little, so they needed the extra income. She has been selling all types of footwear by catalogue for 4 years.

She is requesting a loan of $500 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, to invest in the purchase of more shoes. Sometimes her customers order several pairs of shoes, but since she is not able to by them, she has to wait for other customers to pay her. With your help, María will get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

María Luisa es casada tiene 3 hijos de 12,7 y 4 años, su esposo trabaja como carpintero. inicio el negocio ya que necesitaba ayudar en la economía familiar además de que su esposo ganaba poco y necesitaban un ingreso extra ya tiene cuatro años dedicándose a esto y ahora esta vendiendo de todos los zapatos por catalogo que hay en el mercado

Solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para invertir, y comprar mas zapatos porque a veces le piden varios pares y no los puede comprar entonces tiene que esperar a que otros clientes le paguen. Con tu ayuda María saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sokhun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhun C., 29, and her husband, Mr. Phon Phorn, were married in 2001 and have two sons, one of whom is in school. The family lives about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.
Phon has been a truck driver for five years, working for a company in his village. 
Mrs. Sokhun began a hairdressing business earlier this year; previously she sold groceries. Now she is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorcycle to use in the family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use in the family.

loans.name: Kuv

texts.en: Kuv L., 54, is a widow and has six children. She works selling a variety of fruits. She has a big stand and some small sellers always come to get the fruits from her store for re-sell. On average, she makes $10 a day. One of her children has a business running a motor taxi and another one is a fruit selller.  Kuv would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike to distribute fruits to her customers.

loans.use: Kuv would like to purchase a motorbike to transfer fruits.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia is a mother who is committed to her farm work. Her work enables her to meet the needs of her 10 children, who in turn help her in the fields. Florencia grows potatoes and corn, products that are in high demand in the markets, where greater quality brings higher prices.

To enhance the quality of her products, Florencia needs natural and chemical fertilizers, which recently have become more expensive. This makes it hard for Florencia to afford them. For this reason she is requesting a loan to be able to purchase fertilizers. In addition, Florencia plans to help her husband with buying and selling meat and, in so doing, join efforts to improve their wellbeing. She is hoping for a positive response, which will assist her in her work and at the same time improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Florencia es una mujer entregada a su labor como agricultora, con la que pueD. mantener las necesidades D. sus 10 hijos, quienes D. igual manera le ayudan en sus terrenos D. cultivo. Florencia cultiva papa y maíz, productos que son muy solicitados en los mercados y D. acuerdo a su calidad, valorados.

Para mejorar la calidad D. sus productos, requiere D. abono y fertilizantes que en estos tiempos han sobrepasado los habituales costos, lo que hace difícil poder adquirirlos, Florencia solicita este préstamo para poder comprar estos abonos y no tan solo ello, sino también ayudar a su esposo en la compra y venta D. carne y así juntos anudar esfuerzos para su bienestar. Ella estará esperando por una respuesta positiva que le ayuD. en su actividad y D. la misma forma mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of natural and chemical fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Né en 1961 et mère de six (06) enfants, Madame A. Abra a vite quitté les bancs pour s’adonner aux activités de la production d’huile de palme qui lui assurent le minimum vital pour sa famille. Elle reste très attachée à ce métier. Très dynamique et honnête, elle sollicite un financement afin de pouvoir augmenter l’achat de noix de palme qui constitue la matière première pour la production de l’huile et de facto ses revenus. Ainsi elle pourra subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1961 and the mother of six children, Mrs. Abra A. left her studies quickly to devote her time to the production of palm oil, which covers the minimum necessary to meet the needs of her family. She is very dedicated to her craft. Very energetic and honest, she is taking out a loan to purchase more palm fruit, which is the primary ingredient for the production of the oil and, thereby, her revenue. In this way, she will be able to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production and sale of palm oil

loans.name: Eufrin

texts.es: El señor Eufrin es un cliente muy responsable y dedicado a su trabajo, vive con su familia en una casa muy sencilla y humilde que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos de sanidad. Se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y con esa actividad mantiene a su familia, debido a que en la actualidad es su unico medio de ingreso, porque hace mucho tiempo que no puede conseguir un trabajo formal. Sin embargo él trabaja con muchas ganas para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Eufrin is a very responsible cliente and dedicated to his work. He lives with his family in a simple and humble home that has all the basic sanitary services. He sells used clothing and with this work he supports his family, which is the only source of income because it has been a long time since he has been able to find regular work. Nevertheless he works tirelessly to improve the quality of life of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital for used clothing business

loans.name: Maria Hilaria

texts.es:
La señora Maria Hilaria, socia del Banco Comunal “La Esperanza”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Ella y su esposo se dedican a prestar servicio de reparación de vehículos motorizados, sobre todo de carros, también dan servicio de transporte urbano. El taller está ubicado en su casa en la Carretera Marginal Km. 01 de la ciudad. Complementan sus actividades con la compra y venta de ganado vacuno.  

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará repuestos para su carro, también comprará ganado para luego ser vendidos a personas que llegan de otros lugares y compran estos animales para ser llevados a la costa de nuestro país. 

Maria Hilaria tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 03 hijos. Es una mujer muy perseverante y responsable, con ganas de sacar adelante a sus hijos. Más adelante desea implementar un negocio de venta de aceites y lubricantes, negocio que tuvo que dejar por que tiene una bebé.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Hilaria is a member of the group "La Esperanza," (Hope) and she lives in the region of San Martin in the province of Mariscal Caceres, in the district of Juanjui. She and her husband run a motor vehicle repair shop, they fix mostly cars but also work on public transportation vehicles. Their shop is located in their home. They complement this business with a side business of purchasing and selling cattle. With this loan, which they will repay in 6 months, they intend on purchasing spare car parts as well as more cattle to sell to customers who come from other regions and purchase the animals to be brought back and raised on the coast of the country. Maria Hilaria is 35 years old and lives with her husband and her three children. She is persisten and responsible, and wishes to see her children improve their lives. In the future, she hopes to open another side project where she will sell motor oil, lubricants, a project she had to put to the side for a while because she had to care for her newborn.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare car parts and cattle.

loans.name: Dragana

texts.en: Dragana was born in 1979. She lives in Bratunac, a village close to Srebrenica in a region that endured some of the worst damage of the Bosnian War in the 1990s. Dragana is single and lives with her mother.  She is a saleswoman in a grocery, and earns about 600KM/month (about $392 USD).  To support herself and her mother, she also sells clothing at the local market. Dragana requests a 600KM ($400 USD) loan from Women for Women, International, which she will use to purchase clothing that she can sell.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Ariel Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Ariel tiene  34 años de edad, habitante del barrio La Esperanza, casado no tiene hijos pero si anhela un hijo para enseñarle, educarlo y darle todo la comodidad que necesite. Don Ariel tiene su pequeño negocio en su casa de Billar desde hace tres años. Antes trabajaba como maestro de obra y soldador, con ahorros propios inicio el negocio, pero requiere de remodelación y de nuevos muebles. Agracias a los prestamos de Afodenic lograra realizar las compras de los inmuebles necesarios para el billar ya que dentro de sus planes es ampliar su local y ofrecerle al cliente una mayor comodidad y seguridad. Asegurándole a su familia una estabilidad económica y realizar su planes de aumentar la familia con la llegada de un hijo ofreciéndole un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Ariel, 34, lives in the La Esperanza neighborhood. He's married but has no children. He'd very much like to have a son, a boy to teach and to provide for. Ariel has operated his billiards business for three years. He used to work as a "maestro de obra" [could be foreman or master craftsman, but not clear] and welder. He started the business with his savings, but he still needs funds for renovations and new pool tables. Thanks to Afodenic loans, he's managed to buy some pool tables to start the business. He plans to expand the space now and improve it so that his customers will be more comfortable and secure. His goals are to ensure a stable economic future for his family and build a better future for the son that he'd like to have.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements to billiards business.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es:
Julieta se dedica a la venta de comida ya que tiene una pensión familiar en su domicilio, cuenta con una empleada.
Tiene dos hijos, de los cuales una es independiente y el otro termino el colegio. 
Vive en la zona de alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia
El crédito será destinado para la compra de insumos (aceite, papa, arroz, fideo y refrescos).
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su experiencia, las ganas de trabajar y superarse le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito
texts.en:
Julieta dedicates herself to food sales given she serves guests in her home, and she has one employee. She has two children, one of whom lives on her own and the other who has finished school. She lives in the San Pedro zone of the city of La Paz, and owns her home. The loan would be destined for the purchase of supplies (oil, potatoes, rice, noodles and drinks). This is the first time she requests a loan in Impro, and her experience and desire to work to get ahead give her the opportunity to access this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Jaime Roldan

texts.es:
Jaime se dedica a la producción y venta de leche a la Industria PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), además elabora sombreros los cuales vende en la feria de Achacachi,  tiene dos  hijos los cuales todavía son dependieses de Jaime vive en casa propia que esta ubicado en la comunidad de Arasaya  sección Achacachi.


El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera y así podrá producir mas leche y por ende aumentar sus ingresos para la mantención de su familia. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Jaime works in the production and sale of milk to Industria PIL (an industrial milk processing plant). In addition, he makes hats, which he sells at the Achacachi fair. He has two children who are still dependent on him. He lives in a house of his own that is located in the Acacachi section of the Arasaya community. He will use the loan to pay for a dairy cow so he will be able to produce more milk and therefore increase the amount of income he'll have to provide for his family. This is his first loan with Impro, and an evaluation has been conducted which qualifies him for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El señor Félix tiene 40 años  y está acompañado con la señora Silvana de 27 años, tienen 3 hijos de 2, 5 y 7 años.

El señor Félix es de profesión panadero, el mismo se inició en dicha actividad desde los 15 años como ayudante en un negocio familiar, luego de varios años recibió de herencia el local, en el cual realizó varias mejoras como ampliación y refacción del mismo.

Comenta que le va muy bien en el negocio, gracias a su esfuerzo logró adquirir su propio vehículo y así también construir su casa propia.

El monto solicitado es de Gs.1.200.000 el cual será invertido en la compra de insumos para la preparación de panificados.
texts.en:
Félix is 40 years old and lives with Silvana who is 27 years old, they have 3 children ages 2, 5, and 7. Félix is by profession a baker. He began working as an assistant in the family business when he was 15 years old, and years later he inherited the business in which he carried out various renovations such as its expansion and refurbishment. Félix comments that his business is going very well; thanks to his efforts he was able to acquire his own vehicle and was also able to build his own house. The amount solicited is 1,200,000 PYG, which will be invested in the purchase of bread-making supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase break-making supplies such as: flour, yeast, salt, etc,

loans.name: Blanca Asunción

texts.es:
Nicaragua es un país que se caracteriza por tener mujeres muy trabajadoras que llevan el sustento a su casa de habitación. Tal es el caso de la señora Blanca L. el cual se dedica a su actividad de venta de leña en su casa de habitación.

La razón por la cual la señora Blanca ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la leña y es por este motivo que espera que su crédito sea otorgado para así obtener dicha leña  y venderla en su localidad donde muy dignamente mantiene su hogar.
texts.en:
Nicaragua is a country that is known for its very hardworking women who maintain their household. Such is the case of Blanca L., who sells firewood in her home.

The reason why Ms. Blanca L. now turns to Ceprodel is that she needs a loan so that she can purchase firewood and sell it in her area where she earns a decent living.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura a sus 35 años ha decidido hacer progresar el negocio que tiene, vive en L. casa que le dejaron sus padres, junto a sus 2 hijos; Ronaldo D. 3 años y Rosmeri D. 6 meses. Laura sabe lo que es trabajar sin descanso, incentivada por el amor a sus hijos trabaja arduamente en L. venta D. chocolate con leche, actividad que realiza desD. muy temprano en las ferias D. L. Ciudad D. Juliaca. Su día comienza a las 5 D. L. mañana, cuando se levanta a preparar el delicioso chocolate que luego lleva para vender a las personas que desean tomar una bebida caliente a esas horas D. L. mañana. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es que tiene el resto del día para dedicarse a otras actividades, como cuidar a sus hijos o realizar un trabajo eventual que se presente. Lleva 3 años realizando es negocio y anheL. tener un puesto donD. pueda vender su chocolate con mayor comodidad, lo más difícil D. su trabajo es salir tan temprano todos los días y soportar el intenso frió que hace, pero aun así sabe que tiene que hacerlo, ya que quiere darle a sus hijos un buen futuro. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, por lo cual se siente en L. responsabilidad D. pagarlo a tiempo, ya que quiere acceder a muchos más, en su banco comunal le tienen mucho cariño ya que es muy solidaria. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados con para comprar más ingredientes para preparar su delicioso chocolate con leche, además adquirirá ollas para aumentar L. cantidad D. porciones.
texts.en:
Laura at her 35 years of age has decided to make her business progress, she lives in the house that her parents left to her. She has two children, Ronaldo who is 3 years old and Rosmeri who is 6 months old. Laura knows what is to work without rest, encouraged by the love to her children, she works hard selling chocolate milk. She sells her product very early at the fairs of the City of Juliaca. Her day starts at 5 a.m., when he gets up to prepare the delicious chocolate that then takes to the fairs to sell the people who want to have a warm drink at these early hours of the morning. What she likes more about her work is that she has the rest of the day to do other activities, like to take care of her children or do some other last minute job. She has had this business for 3 years, and her wish is to have a stand where she could sell her chocolate milk with more comfort for her and her clients. The most difficult part of her work is having to go out so early every day and to endure the intense cold, but nevertheless she knows that she has to do it because she wants to give her children a good future. This is her second loan with MFP (Kiva's partner), and she feels the responsibility of repaying on time, since she wants to have access to many more. With the requested loan besides buying more ingredients to prepare her delicious chocolate milk, she will also acquire pans to increase the quantity of the portions.

Translated from Spanish by Ana GabrieL. Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to prepare the chocolate milk she sells

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia es una mujer muy admirada por sus vecinas, debido al gran esfuerzo que hace para salir adelante, tiene 30 años y vive en un cuarto alquilado y lo que más desea es mejorar su vida. Se dedica al negocio de los tejidos artesanales, aprendió esta actividad desde muy pequeña cuando ayudaba a su madre a terminar los tejidos que le solicitaban, actualmente es una de las principales proveedoras de las tiendas artesanales de la feria dominical de la ciudad de Juliaca. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y más a un si son artesanías, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y anhela tener su propia tienda de tejidos artesanales donde pueda vender sus propias prendas, lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es transportar sus tejidos hasta donde los distribuye, ya que se le hace muy cansado, aun así sabe que tiene que hacerlo para poder salir adelante. Este es el quinto préstamo de Emilia con MFP, y espera pagar  todas sus cuotas a tiempo para no meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es una socia muy activa. Con el dinero solicitado planea comprar más lana de todos colores y de mejor calidad, para producir más tejidos artesanales.
texts.en:
Emilia is a woman who is much admired by her neighbors due to the great efforts she has made to make ends meet. She is 30 years old and lives in a rented room and she wants to improve her life. She works making handmade fabrics, which she learned as a young child, helping her mother complete her fabric orders. She is currently one of the principal suppliers of fabrics for the Sunday craft market in the city of Juliaca. What she likes most about her job is weaving, especially artisan fabrics. She has spent 8 years doing this work and longs to have her own shop where she could sell her own garments. What she likes least about her job is transporting her materials to where she distributes them; it is very tiring, even though she knows that she must do so to get ahead. This is Emilia's fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she hopes to make all her payments on time so she does not get in trouble with the members of her village bank, where she is a very active member. With the money she has requested, Emilia plans to purchase more wool in a variety of colours and of a better quality than usual, in order to produce a greater supply of fabrics.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Дадобоева Махбуба женщина 31года. Работает продавщицей в частной аптеке, где получает заработную плату. Её доход очень мал и не хватает для полного проживания, её муж работает на стройке, где заработок не постоянный .Поэтому Махбуба вместе с мужем занимается уходом за скотом. Махбуба уже кредитуется третий раз. Получив  кредит,  Махбуба планирует отремонтировать свой хлев и закупить корм для своих коров.
texts.en:
Mahbuba D. is a 31-year-old woman. She works in a private pharmacy, where she receives a salary, but her income is very small and not sufficient to survive to meet their needs. Her husband works in construction and the work is not steady, so Mahbuba and her husband raise cattle. This will be Mahbuba's third loan. With this loan, Mahbuba plans to make repairs to their cowshed and purchase cattle feed.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La Sra. Cirila vive en la comunidad “Cañada Strongesrt”, hace mas de 29 años en la cual tiene formada su familia,  cuenta con una parcela de 20 hectáreas de tierra, en la cual vive con su esposo El Sr. Román Grande y sus nueve hijos.
Esta familia se dedica netamente a la agricultura, el préstamo que están solicitando es para la siembra de papa, fuera de sembrar papa asimismo siembran, maíz yuca y camote. También cuentan con 3 cabezas de ganado y dos chanchitos.
texts.en:
Cirila has lived in the “Cañada Strongesrt” community for over 29 years where she has formed a family, and counts on a 20 hectares plot of land on which she lives with her husband Román Grande and their nine children. This family dedicates itself distinctly to agriculture; the loan that they are requesting is to plant potatoes, aside from which they also plant corn, manioc, and sweet potato. They also have 3 head of cattle, and two small pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potato seed.

loans.name: Wilberto

texts.es:
el sr. Wilberto L. cuenta con una pequeña granja avicola, su negocio se llama POLLO WILLY, tiene mas de 1 año de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, durante este tiempo le ha ido muy bien, porque la carne de pollo es un alimento basico en la dieta familiar de esta comunidad ya que es un producto saludable, de facil preparacion y mucho mas comodo que la carde de res y cerdo, por eso es que el pollo es muy vendido en restaurantes y varios lugares en donde venden comidas. el pollo tiene mucha demanda en la compra para consumo diario.
el esta solicitando un credito para lograr un crecimiento en su granja, el es una persona muy emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superacion y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Wilberto L. has a small poultry farm named Pollo Willy. He has been in this business for over one year. Things have gone very well because chicken is a basic food for the families in this community. It is a healthy product, easy to prepare, and much easier to raise than beef and pork. That is why chicken is sold a lot in restaurants and various places where they sell food. There is much demand to buy chicken for daily consumption. He is asking for a loan to expand his farm. He is a very enterprising person with a great desire to improve for the well being of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy small chickens and concentrated food for them

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana L. A., 31, is married with 3 children.  She has many years of experience in the cattle business. She sells to the public 4 days per week.  Ana has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~110USD).  SPBD loans are Ana’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase wire for fence, cows food, nails and hammer.

loans.name: Đặng Thị

texts.en:
L. Đặng Thị (17110060284) is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, L. owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling elastic band products in the local community. L. has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 Vietnamese dong (about $280 US) a month from these activities.

In 2007, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 dong from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. L. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 dong which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 4th loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif was born in 1956. He is married and has five children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, now settled in Absheron region. He has five years of experiences in the consulting business.
Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy a computer, printer and necessary things for improving his consulting business.

loans.use: To buy a computer and printer

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción tiene 47 años, es madre de 3 hijos, con quienes vive en la casa que a base de sacrificio pudo construir, ya que sola tuvo que asumir el rol de madre y padre en su hogar. Durante 10 años ha prestado sus servicios a diversas entidades públicas y privadas, donde logró adquirir experiencia para mejorar su desempeño. Sin embargo, durante estos meses se viene dedicando al procesamiento de gas en una empresa donde labora todos los días, desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. Pero los deseos de Concepción son de tener un negocio propio, por lo que su meta es ambientar su vivienda para implementar allí su tienda, la cual llevará su nombre. Es por ello que trabaja con mucha alegría, brindando los mejores servicios como empleada, ya que seguirá trabajando por horas en esa empresa. Con  Microfinanzas PRISMA ya tiene 13 créditos, los cuales le permitieron mejorar sus condiciones de vida, tanto de ella como de sus compañeras de su banco comunal, el cual tiene 7 años de formado. Los 2500 soles que ahora solicita el servirán para la compra de mercadería para la apertura de su bodega.
texts.en:
Concepcion is 47 years old, and the mother of three children. She lives with them in a house which she was able to construct, at much sacrifice, while forced into the role of mother and father in her home.

For ten years now she has worked for various entities, public and private, where she acquired experience and improved her performance. For the last several months, she has been processing gas at an enterprise where she works every day, from 9 in the morning to 5 in the afternoon. But what Concepcion wants is to have her own business, and for that, her goal is to prepare her house to contain a store, which will bear her name. This is why she works with much joy, performing her best as an employee, and with this goal she will continue to work many hours in this enterprise.

She has had 13 loans with PRISMA Microfinance, and these have permitted her to improve her condition of life, just like her companions in the community bank, which is now seven years old. With this $850 loan Concepcion will buy merchandise for the opening of her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CAPITAL TO INVEST IN HER GROCERY STORE

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is made up of three members, all residents in the rural area of Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Chea N. has been selected to be group leader by the group members.

Chea N. is 49 years old and earns a living with her husband by cultivating rice. Besides the farm work, her husband is a local veterinarian and fisherman as well. This couple was married years ago and is blessed with seven children, three of whom are married and have started new homes, while the rest of them attend school. One of their daughters works as a seamstress in a factory.

Chea N. will be using her loan as capital to allow her husband to buy more fishing equipment and to repair some broken equipment.

The other borrowers who are jointly taking this loan are:

K. is applying for a loan to buy fishing equipment for her husband’s fishing business and will use the rest of the loan to buy a battery to supply a light in her house.

P., a fish seller, is asking for a loan to enlarge her fish-selling business.

loans.use: To buy and repair fishing equipment for her husband

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lorna B. is from the village of Labo, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Lorna is married and has 2 adult children. Lorna owns & operates a "sari-sari" store where she sells a variety of different products to the local community. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2004, Lorna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP to be used to purchase additional inventory & towards working capital. This will be the 18th loan taken out by Lorna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & increase working capital.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali has been working as a florist since 1985. He is a 62-year-old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon. Ali does nice flower arrangements and bouquets. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He didn’t have a lot of flower choices when he first started his business. Ali has always liked flowers and he decided to become a florist.

Ali requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new flowers. This is his second loan cycle and he has always repaid on time. His previous loan helped him improve his work and purchase more exotic flowers. In the future, he plans on further improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase new flowers.

loans.name: Adelarda

texts.en:
Adelarda M. is from the town of D'Ban, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 69 years old. Adelarda is widowed and has five adult children. To make a living, Adelarda sells agricultural items. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling plants, seedlings and young crops to local farmers. Adelarda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Adelarda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelarda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 70,000 PHP from PMPC. Adelarda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Adelarda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina A. is married and has one child. She has received junior high education. Her husband is an engineer.

Paulina sells panties, weaves, body lotion and so on at Elmina. She has been doing so since 2005. Paulina uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Paulina will use the loan to purchase panties, body lotions and other cosmetics for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Paulina plans to save to build a house.

Paulina was out of stock at the time the picture was taken. She hopes to get the loan early so that she can add it to her capital to increase stock. .

loans.use: To purchase panties, body lotions and other cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Aurore

texts.fr: H. Aurore est née vers 1978 à Allada dans le département de l’Atlantique au Bénin. Aurore vit à Dodomey à Allada depuis 30 ans environs. Divorcée et mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés, Aurore vit seule avec ses enfants. Aurore assure seule les charges de la famille. Aurore a fait seulement le cours primaire. Pour se prendre en charge et subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, Aurore vend des condiments de sauce (tomate fraîche, piments, épices) au marché d’Allada au Bénin. C’est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin et au marché Houègbo que Aurore s’approvisionne. Aurore a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. C’est pour augmenter le volume de son activité et faire face à la demande de la clientèle, que Aurore sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
H. Aurore was born around 1978 in Allada in Atlantique county, Benin. She has been living in Dodomey, in Allada, for about thirty years. Divorced and the mother of two children, who are both in school, Aurore lives alone with her children. She alone ensures that family expenses are covered. Aurore has attended primary school only. To support herself and to provide for her children, she sells sauce condiments (fresh tomatoes, chili peppers, spices) at the Allada market in Benin. She stocks up in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and at the Houègbo market. She has already obtained an ALIDé loan, which she repaid. To increase her business volume and to cope with customer demand, she's requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 baskets of fresh tomatoes, 5 baskets of chili peppers, and various spices

loans.name: Kandy

texts.es: Kandy es una socia dinámica y emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 23 años, es soltera, se dedica a la venta de pollo broster, anticuchos y salchipapas, esta actividad lo realiza de lunes a sábados por las tardes. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Libertadoras” desde hace año y medio, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que lo utilizó en la compra de joyas de plata para vender, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1200 soles, que será utilizado una parte en la compra de utensilios para implementar su negocio de comida y otra parte será utilizado para comprar joyas. La meta de Kandy es seguir implementando su negocio, mejorarlo y seguir creciendo en este negocio.
texts.en:
Kandy, 23, has been a dynamic and enterprising member of the "Las Libertadoras" communal bank for the last year-and-a-half. She is single and lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She sells broasted chicken, anticuchos (small pieces of grilled skewered meat), and salchipapas (thinly sliced pan-fried beef hot dogs or sausage and French fries, mixed together and served on a plate or in a paper cone, served with different sauces) from Monday through Saturday afternoons. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used to buy silver jewelery to sell. Now she needs 1200 soles, part of which will be used to buy kitchen utensils for her food preparation and part to buy jewelry. Kandy's goal is to continue to equip her business, to improve it, and to continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Rubi Group

texts.es:
La señora Olivia T. integrante del grupo Rubí, confecciona ropa de muñeca hace 4 años, repartiendo al por mayor a diferentes lugares de venta en la ciudad de La Paz y de Cochabamba, el préstamo solicitado lo utilizará en la compra de tela gafu y cartón ya que son los dos insumos principales con los cuales elabora sus productos.
Las demás integrantes de Rubí también tiene sus propios negocios de comercialización, producción y servicio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olivia T. is a member of the Rubí community bank and has made doll clothes for the past four years, selling them wholesale to different vendors in La Paz and Cochabamba. She will use the loan requested to buy burlap and cardboard, which are the two materials she uses most in making her products. The other members of the Rubí bank likewise have their own sales, production and service businesses.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and merchandise

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Mom S. is the leader of a group of four members who all live in Dong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectar field to cultivate rice. She faces a problem in her rice cultivation because her field has infertile soil. For this reason, she has decided to ask for a loan in order to buy fertilizer to support her field. She is a widow with five children: two are silk-weaving laborers, two are construction workers, and the youngest attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Dieynaba

texts.fr: Madame Dieynaba G. est une femme de 53 ans très dynamique qui habite a Ouakam a quelques 200 mètres de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC ou elle est sociétaire depuis 9 ans. Elle est spécialisée dans le commerce et la vente d’huile de palme et de produits en provenance de Diaobe ou elle effectue régulièrement des voyages depuis 5 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle a déjà rembourse 4 prêts antérieurs qui l’ont aide a garder une stabilité familiale et autonome. Madame G. sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs dans le but de voyager et d’acheter de l’huile de palme et de la pâte d’arachide en vue de renouveler et d’accroitre son stock de produits qui est destine a la vente. Ses prêts lui ont permis de constater un avancement socio économique non négligeable et de s’assurer une indépendance financière qui lui a donne la force de faire face aux besoins de la maison car son mari est presque inactif.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dieynaba G., 53, is an energetic woman who has been living in Ouakam about 200 meters from the l’U-IMCEC office; she has been a member for 9 years. She is specialized in the buying and selling of palm oil and products coming from Diaobe; she has been making regular trips there for 5 years. She is married and the mother of 8 children. She has already reimbursed four loans which have helped her to have family stability and be independent.

Mrs. G. is requesting a loan in the amount of 200,000 frs with the intention of traveling to buy palm oil and peanut butter so as to update and add to her stock of products to be sold. Her loans have allowed her to make appreciable socio-economic progress and ensure her financial independence which makes it possible for her to deal with family needs, her husband being more or less idle.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 46 años, es una mujer muy alegre y entusiasta, comparte su vida con su pareja y con el menor de sus hijos, puesto que los mayores ya tienen su propia familia y son independientes.
Su negocio es el alquiler de lavadoras, por lo que permanece durante todo el día en su casa para atender a quienes le solicitan este servicio. Hoy cuenta con 5 modernas lavadoras, y con las ganancias adquiridas empezará a incursionar en la crianza y venta de cuyes de raza. 
Ella tiene buenas expectativas con estos dos negocios, los cuales la ayudarán a sacar adelante a su familia.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y siempre ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.  Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará los cuyes y los materiales necesarios para construir las jaulas donde albergará a estos animalitos.
texts.en:
María, age 46, is a very happy and enthusiastic woman. She shares her life with her partner and the youngest of her children,. Her eldest children already have their own families and are independent.

María’s business is the rental of washing machines. She stays in her house in order to attend to those who ask her for this service. Today, she has 5 modern washing machines, and with the earnings from these she will begin to embark on the raising and sale of guinea pigs (used for food in Peru). She has high expectations for these two businesses, which will help her family to prosper.

This is her third loan with MFP, and she had always shown herself to be very responsible in paying her installments. With the money that she is now applying for she will buy guinea pigs and the materials necessary to build the cages where she will house these little animals.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in a new business

loans.name: Pelita

texts.en:
Pelita T. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Pelita is single and has three infant children. To make a living, Pelita owns & operates a specialized retail store selling native vinegar, eggs and more in the local community. Pelita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Pelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Pelita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Pelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Adeola

texts.en:
Adeola is a 38 year old businesswoman, living in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is married and blessed with 3 children.

Adeola sells soft drinks to her retail customers to make a living. She has been in this business for 8 years and has used the proceeds to save and assist her husband in caring for their children’s needs and education.

Adeola would like to see great improvement in her business, therefore she is requesting a loan for the amount of NGN 70, 000 to purchase more drinks. This will attract a bulk-discount, in order to increase her sales and profit. She hopes to improve her family's living conditions. Adeola says thank you in anticipation of such a loan being granted to her.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn D.'s main source of income comes from providing tricykad services in her community. She is 30 years old, married and has five school-age children. They are from the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Jocelyn has been in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to to purchase materials needed to provide her service. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase his inventory

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose sells clothes and wallet at retail prices to make a living. She hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger. She is 45 years old, married with 2 children. Her husband is a commercial tailor and he also supports their home. She is requesting for the loan amount of NGN 60,000 to purchase more clothes to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Beishebubu's Group

texts.en:
Rivalry and competition make people strive to be the best in their fields and professions. Weak people get afraid to lose their positions and begin to feel themselves psychologically backward or weaker than others. However, among ordinary people we can still find many examples of strong-willed people, who not only do not get afraid, but go into business with full enthusiasm and energy, and quickly grow in prosperity. Daily obstacles and life ordeals cannot prevent these people from achieving their goals as they are mature minded and know that after the darkness of night comes the light of the morning.


Beishebubu M. is the leader of this group. She is fifty eight and has two children. Her husband used to be a farmer. Beishebubu’s two sons are grown ups. The elder son is thirty five and the younger is thirty. Both of her sons make their own living independently. Beishebubu obtains her sons’ support. However, she prefers to stay independent and, using the skills she acquired from her husband, she decided to be a farmer. Now she is working in the field, sowing and planting vegetables in a piece of land. Beishebubu needs a loan to buy fuel for field works. 

Beishebubu’s partners:

Juzumkan A., 71, has a daughter. Her daughter lives in the capital. She and her husband still work. Both of them are farmers. Now is the time when they are busy every day sowing in the field. Juzumkan needs a loan to purchase fuel. 

Baktybek K., 59, has a son. Baktybek and his wife are farmers. They also raise some cattle. In the fall they plan to marry their son who is thirty five and still single. Baktybek hopes to obtain this loan and invest the funds in increasing their livestock population. 

Bermet J., 52, has a son. Bermet, her husband and son are engaged in farming. Bermet wants her son to become a big farmer, and therefore actively involves her son in all aspects of the work. These days the whole family is busy working in the field. Bermet needs a loan to buy fuel. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel, which is needed for the sowing process

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou B. is from Miputak, Dipolog City. She is 54 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns and operates a charcoal business.  Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Marilou joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: La Estrella (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Del  grupo la ESTRELLA sus integrantes son:  Marisela (venta de pollo), Maria de los Ángeles (venta de refrescos), Adriana betzabel (venta de cecina), y doña Maria (venta de bisutería).

     De quien vamos a platicar es de Adriana betzabel, ella es hija de la sra. Marisela, como pueden ver son dos mujeres lechones que buscan salir a delante con sus créditos: Adriana cuenta con 23 años de edad, cursó hasta el 3 años de secundaria, es mamá soltera, tiene 1 angelito la cual se llama: Carla Selene de 5 años de edad  a penas va a iniciar el  preescolar, Adriana actualmente vive con sus papás,  poco a poco se a abierto camino,   también a iniciado  su negocio vendiendo  cecina, longaniza y carne enchilada, ella me comenta que le gustaría superarse profesionalmente, prepararse y cursar una carrera técnica en informática para poderle ofrecerle una vida mejor a su hija y para ella… como? Obteniendo un mejor trabajo y más ingresos. Por que con esta oportunidad que tenga va a lograr lo que más anhela, tener su propia casa.

Me comenta que su grupo es muy unido y que le han echado ganas a sus actividades para que no pierdan el beneficio de seguir con los apoyo que  Fundacion Realidad y kiva les han otorgado a su grupo,  también están muy agradecidas y esperan seguir por muchos ciclos mas sus crédito por que sin el no habrían  podido iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the Estrella (Star) group are: Marisela (chicken sales); Maria de los Angeles (soft drink sales); Adriana Betzabel (meat jerky sales); and Maria (costume jewelery sales). We are going to talk about Adriana Betzabel. She is the daughter of Marisela, and as we can see they are both novices who are looking to get ahead with their loans. Adriana is 23, did 3 years of high school, is a single mother and has one little angel named Carla Selene, age 5, who is just about to start preschool. Adriana currently lives with her parents, and bit by bit the way is becoming smooth for her. She started her business selling meat jerky, sausage and beef enchiladas. She tells me that she would like to get ahead professionally, learn and start a career in information technology in order to offer her daughter and herself a better life...how? Through obtaining a better job and more income. With this opportunity she will achieve what she most desires: owning her own home. She tells me that her group is very united and that they are doing their best in their activities so that they do not lose the benefits of continued support that Fundacion Realidad and Kiva have offered them. They are also very grateful and hope to continue with many more cycles because without these credits they would not have been able to start their businesses

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of meat jerky and sausage

loans.name: Moun

texts.en:
Mrs. Moun M. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Chorm Kheun, live on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have been married since 1970 and have five children: one son and four daughters. Three of them have married and live outside the family home and the other two are cleaners. Mr. Chorm Kheun is a fisherman.

Moun has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who then takes them to sell in the market in Phnom Penh. Moun is asking for a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Renato Juan

texts.es:
Renato de 50 años, , vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), el es comerciante informal de galones de agua, trabaja recorriendo y repartiendo las botellas de agua.

El comenzó alquilando departamentos pequeños para poder mantener a su familia pero como necesitaba mas ingresos decidió vender galones de agua en su casa, por esa buena decisión ahora vende cada galón a $ 2.50 y continua alquilando departamentos, su esposa le ayuda en la administración de los departamentos, mientras que el vende los galones. 

Para seguir con sus negocio el quiere comprar con botellones y cemento para mejorar los departamentos, en el futuro quiere tener una distribuidora de agua.
texts.en:
Renato, 50 years old, lives on the outskirts of Guayquil, and he works in the informal sector selling gallons of water. He works collecting and delivering water bottles. He began renting small apartments in order to provide for his family, but he needed more income. He decided to sell gallons of water from his home and now sells each gallon for $2.50. He still rents apartments, and his wife helps him manage his rental properties while he sells water. He wants to continue with his business and buy plastic bottles for water and cement to make improvements on his apartments. In the future he would like to be an official distributor of bottled water.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of gallons of water and cement

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom lives in the historic city called Multan, in Pakistan. She works part time in an embroidering clothes making business to financially support her husband. She is basically a housewife but takes time out after managing the household chores for her embroidery business.  
Her husband is a very skillful man. He has a business making & selling of bed-sheets. He has been doing this work for over seven years. 

Kalsoom is the mother of seven children, three sons and four daughters. Her eldest son helps his father in his bed-sheets business. Kalsoom has transferred her art of embroidery to her daughters who are now earning good income from their quality work. Kalsoom has decided to convert her part time business into full-time to better generate income. She has applied for a loan from Asasah for purchasing an embroidery machine, which will help her make more money and to fulfill orders on time. This is her second loan cycle with ASASAH. In her first loan cycle she helped her daughters start their embroidery business. 

She hopes that she will be able to become successful in her business with the help of this investment.

loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine for embroidery business.

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som S., 50 years-old, owns a shop next to her home where she sells food to people who live in and around her community.
