She typically makes around $3 of profit each day in order to meet her family needs. Som S. has a life partner in her husband who works as a security guard in a private company. The couple are good parents to their three kids.  One of their children is now married and the other two are still unmarried.

In addition to her shop, Som S. also cultivates rice crops during the coming farming season. To help her hard physical labor in the field, Som S. will be using this loan to buy a pair of cows that she will use to plow the farmland.

loans.use: To buy a pair of cows.

loans.name: Diaga

texts.fr: Monsieur Diaga D. est un jeune cultivateur qui s'active dans le maraichage dans la communauté rurale de FISSEL, marié et père de famille il a une expérience de 10 ans dans le secteur . Ce prêt intervient dans le cadre de l'acquisition de semence et de produits phytosanitaires liés à son exploitation agricole .Ainsi il pourra produire plus de légumes et lui permettra de survivre et de générer plus de bénéfices et être en même temps auto suffisant
texts.en:
Mr. Diaga D. is a young farmer engaged in truck farming in the rural community of FISSEL. Married and the head of household, he has 10 years experience in the sector. This loan is for the purpose of purchasing seeds and phytosanitary products for his farm. Thus, he will be able to produce more vegetables, which will enable him to survive and to make a larger profit. At the same time, this will make him self-sufficient.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Truck Farming

loans.name: Abakundisuka Group

texts.fr:
Albert S., née à Ruhuha l’Est du Rwanda, il a 30 ans, il est marié et il a 3 enfants, son ainé a 7 ans et son cadet a 1 ans, son niveau d’étude est primaire. Elle vit avec sa famille à Ruhuha Bugesera. 1 enfant va à l’école.
Il appartient dans un groupe solidaire appelé ABAKUNDISUKA cultivateurs de riz,  qui est un groupe dont les membres sont  agriculteurs de riz et ils se garantissent mutuellement, Albert et son groupe travaillent pour faire vivre leurs familles en améliorant leurs conditions de vie, Albert  comme tout autre membre du groupe il a sa partie dans cette vallée ou il cultive le riz. Le groupe a contracté un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour acheter les engrais chimique pour félitiliser leur champ. Quand le groupe récolte, une partie de la récolte est vendue et une autre est utilisée pour les familles.
N.B:Certains hommes sont eprisonés et sont remplacés par leurs femmes.
texts.en:
Albert S., born in Ruhuha in the Eastern province of Rwanda, is 30 years old. He is married with three children, from 7 to 1 year of age. He finished primary school. [He] lives with his family in Ruhuha Bugesera. One of his children goes to school. He belongs to a solidarity group named Abakundisuka, whose members are rice farmers guaranteeing each other’s loans. to support their families and offer them a better life conditions Albert, like other members of the group, has his land parcel in this valley and cultivates rice. The group has taken out a loan from Amasezerano Community Banking in order to purchase chemical fertilizers for their field. After harvesting, one part of the produce is sold and the other is used by the families. NB: Some of the men are in prison and are replaced by their wives.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers

loans.name: Koim

texts.en: Koim K. is a 42-year-old village woman who has a job as a rice farmer in the province of Kompong Tom. Koim K.’s husband is a local fisherman who helps her with the family. Koim K. owns a small farm that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows various crops on it. Koim K. currently plants a peanut crop and she estimates that she will harvest it within the next two months when the plants mature. She will use the profit from selling her mature produce to better meet her family’s needs. Koim K. thinks that it is time to expand her planting, but her farmland is not big. Therefore, Koim K. would like a loan of $250 in order to purchase a piece of land for her planting.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land for her planting.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary K. is currently in the business of selling beans at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans to sell.  Mary is 30 years old and is married to a policeman. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: Stock bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Agnes Nana Ama Atta

texts.en: Agnes Nana Ama Atta D. is married and has seven dependents. She has received junior high education. Agnes produces and sells 'Fante kenkey' (fermented corn dough) at Elmina. Her husband works in carpentery. Agnes uses her income in assisting her husband to take care of the family. The loan will be added to her initial capital to increase production to meet the demand of her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: add to her initial capital to increase production

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda F., 42, is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has a 7-year-old child. To make a living, Imelda raises crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Imelda works hard to sustain her family and her child's education.

Imelda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar:
علي في عمر 59 سنة يعمل في تصليح وبيع الأدوات الكهربائية والعاب والاقراص المدمجة
له في عمله 30 سنة متزوج وله ولدان له تاريخ مع المجموعة حيث كان يلقى الدعم من العائلة واستطاع القرض ان يحسن
من وضع عمله يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء العاب جديدة واقرص مدمجة وأدوات كهربائية يحب عائلته ويطمح دائما الى زيادة مدخوله حيث يصبح قادر على متابعة الحياة الاقتصادية الصعبة
texts.en: Ali is a 59-year-old husband and father of two who loves his very supportive family. He possesses three decades of experience repairing electronic appliances and selling them along with video games and CDs, and he is perpetually driven to find ways to increase revenues so that he can keep up with these difficult economic times. Ali’s previous loan from Al Majmoua helped to improve his business. He is now seeking another loan to purchase new electronic appliances, video games, and CDs.

loans.use: Purchase electronic appliances, video games, and CDs for shop

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa E. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old. Nimfa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Nimfa owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals to customers like chicken pork adobo, caldereta and afritada in the local community. Nimfa has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nimfa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nimfa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Nimfa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.es: Patrocinia, de 41 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa que es propia junto a su conviviente German (55) y sus 2 jóvenes  hijas, quienes son el impulso de todos sus esfuerzos.Ella decidió instalar un restaurante en su distrito, y sus familiares le ayudaron a organizar el negocio. En la actualidad cuenta con un ayudante  que realiza los mandados y  también le ayuda en la atención a los clientes. Por la buena sazón y precios módicos de sus platillos ha logrado captar pensionistas fijos; y en el negocio ya  lleva cinco años. Según sus palabras su restaurante es el sueño cumplido del negocio propio; porque  depende de ella misma que su puesto surga y tenga  buena concurrencia, pero las ganancias que obtiene la motivan bastante, a pesar del duro trabajo. Es por esta razón que siempre dice que todo sacrificio tiene una buena remuneración, además con  el tiempo desea instalar  su propio local y así ofrecer lo mejor a sus comensales.Es el 14avo crédito que tiene  con MFP, y  se siente muy agradecida con la institución porque recibe todas las facilidades, además  es muy puntual con el  pago de sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, pues  es muy solidaria.Patrocinia tiene planeado invertir  los dos mil soles solicitados en la compra de mayor cantidad de  víveres que necesita para brindar una mejor alimentación  a sus consumidores, de esta manera espera alcanzar el progreso.
texts.en:
Patrocinia is 41 years old.  She is a cheerful and hard-working woman who lives in her own home with her partner, 55 year-old German, and her two young daughters who are the motivation behind all her hard work.

Patrocinia decided to set up a restaurant in her district and her family members helped her to organize the business.  She currently has one helper who does the shopping and also helps to serve the customers.  Owing to the good taste of her meals and their reasonable prices, Patrocinia has managed to attract regular customers.  She has been in her business for five years.

Patrocinia tells us that her restaurant is her dream of owning her own business fulfilled.  It depends on Patrocinia whether her business does well and whether she has a lot of customers.  The profits she makes in her business motivate her a lot, in spite of the hard work.  For this reason, she always says that every sacrifice has its reward.  Over time, Patrocinia would like to set up her own premises and thereby be able to provide her customers with the best.

This is Patrocinia's 14th loan with MFP and she feels very grateful to the institution for having received all her loans.  She is very punctual in making her loan repayments.  She is a very well-liked member of her community bank because she is very supportive.  Patrocinia plans to invest her 2,000 Peruvian soles in buying a larger quantity of foodstuffs that she needs to provide better meals to her customers.  In this way, she hopes to make progress.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of ingredients for her business

loans.name: Razia Begum's Group

texts.en:
Razia begum is the wife of S. D. and belongs to the small city of Kasur in Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its tannery industry. She owns a two-room house there and lives in it with her family. 

She and her husband are involved in a clothing business. Her husband goes to Lahore and Faisalabad for purchasing clothes. Razia sells clothes to her community people and S. operates a clothing shop in the market. They are well known for their business. They get good orders from their customers and earn well by fulfilling them. They keep themselves up to date about the latest trends in fashion and easily understand the customers' demands. Their earnings help them to manage their finances smoothly. 

Besides the clothing business, Razia also manages her household work efficiently.  

She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her family business. With the loan, her husband will buy clothes of different varieties in bulk quantities. The bulk purchasing will decrease the traveling costs and increase their business sales. They are hopeful that their business will be improved further after making this investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia begum.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Mr. Sor Saran Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 13 people who are living in Angkor village, Takeo province. Mr. Sor S. is a village bank president who was selected by the other members who will use their portions of the loan for varied ways to support their families. 

Mr. Sor S. and his wife, Mrs. Kib Nen, are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. He is also a motorbike taxi driver and a construction worker. He is a father of three children, two of whom are attending local public school, but the youngest one is 4 years old.

In the rice field, it is time for growing, so he needs some money to support this activity. To improve this purpose, Mr. Sor S. is applying for a loan to do farming this dry season.

loans.use: To support farming activites

loans.name: Maranatha De Panamericana Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal de “Maranatha de Panamericana”, está iniciando su primer ciclo en el centro focal de Panamericana. Esta asociación comunal cuenta con la participación de ocho integrantes.  La  mesa directiva tiene como presidenta a la señora Lourdes, como tesorera a la señora Salustiana y como secretaria de actas a la señora Vicky.   Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos:   venta de comida, pensión, costura de chamarras, repartición de víveres, venta de artefactos, tejido a máquina, venta de ropa nueva, servicio de llamadas telefónicas de tienda, venta de verduras.
La señora Lourdes,  presidenta de la Asociación Comunal de “Maranatha de Panamericana” es una mujer joven con  experiencia en el trabajo de asociaciones comunales, ella comenta que estuvo durante ocho ciclos en el  Centro Focal de Los Andes.   Desde hace un año y medio  la señora Lourdes tiene como negocio la venta de comida,  antes vendía ropa.   Ella vende comida cerca del  Mercado el Carmen en una pensión que alquiló para aquello, ahora con el crédito que está solicitando piensa comprar una máquina para elaborar pollo a la Broster, el saldo servirá para comprar papa por carga y refresco por mayor.   Por ahora recibe el  apoyo de su mamá para atender la pensión, pues tiene que dividir su tiempo entre el negocio y la familia.
texts.en:
The “Maranatha de Panamericana” communal bank is starting its first cycle in the Panamericana Focal Center.  It has 8 members.  The governing body has Lourdes as President, Salustiana as treasurer and Vicky as Recording Secretary.  The women’s businesses are varied.  Among them are: food sales, eatery, jacket manufacturing, grocery sales, crafts sales, machine knitting, new clothing sales, store-based telephone call services and vegetable sales.

Lourdes, President of “Maranatha de Panamericana” communal bank is a young woman with experience working in communal associations.  She comments that she was in the Los Andes Focal Center for 8 cycles. 

For the last year and a half she’s been selling food; she used to sell clothes.  She sells food near the El Carmen Market in an eatery she leased for that purpose.  With the loan she’s requesting now she wants to buy a machine to make Broaster-style chicken; she’ll use whatever’s left over to buy a load of potatoes and soft drinks at wholesale.  For now, her mother helps her tend to the eatery because she has to divide her time between the business and her family.

loans.use: To buy a fryer to make Broaster-style chicken and for a load of potatoes.

loans.name: Delgersaikhan

texts.en: Delgersaikhan N. is 34 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school.  They live in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a traditional Mongolian housing tent.  His wife is a hair dresser. Delgersaikhan operates a taxi service in the city.  In the mornings, he works at a foreign language center as a driver.  He has been operating his taxi for 11 years and has gained much experience. He is an energetic person who would like to be able to provide a good education and other necessary expenses for his children.  He is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase some spare parts for his car and to renovate his house.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is a married woman who lives in the island of Palawan, Philippines. She earns her living buying and selling charcoal and farming. Her husband Jimmy, who is 38 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 6 and 17 years old. Marissa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marissa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy charcoal to sell and to fund her farming operation so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business and education of her children. Marissa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada con William Javier, vive en compañía de sus padres y hermanos, tiene una hija llamada Kenia Guadalupe de 5 años de edad.
Él negocio de Guadalupe es la venta de ropa, con un horario de 6:00am a 1:00pm, vende únicamente los días de comercio. Por el momento su plan es surtir el negocio de ropa, por lo que solicita un préstamo para realizar la inversión, ayudándole esta compra a variar su mercadería de prendas de vestir nuevas.
Su aspiración es ser comerciante por largo plazo, contar con financiamientos para desarrollarse en el mercado, y ofreciendo a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Guadalupe lives in Corinto in the department of Morazán.  She is 29 years old and married to William Javier.  They live with his parents and siblings, and have a daughter named Kenia Guadalupe, who is 5 years old.

Guadalupe sells clothing on work days from 6:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m.  Her current plan is to buy more clothing so she can offer a wider variety of new garments.  She needs the loan to help her with this purchase.

Her goal is to be a merchant in a larger location and obtain funding to develop her market so she can offer her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more clothing

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en: Theogene is 38 years old. He is not married and he is hardworking. Theogene sells timber, and he has sold timber for 3 years. This business has enabled him look after his family. He is requesting a loan to buy more timber and hence make more profits. He plans make savings and later on purchase cattle for sale.

loans.use: to buy timber for resale

loans.name: Tajir

texts.en:
Tajir is a married woman who sells firewood and operate a cafe business. They own a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two years operating her business, she has been able to educate her children who attend school.  Tajir faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming self-reliant in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha nació en la comunidad de Urco provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, tiene 38 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja y sus tres hijos, quien son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. 

Los verdes campos de la comunidad de Huaran, ubicado en la Valle Sagrado de los Incas donde actualmente vive la socia, han sido en la vida de Martha un lugar muy agradable para trabajar. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja junto a su pareja, que con mucho esmero siembran hortalizas como por ejemplo papa, maíz y otras vegetales. Martha también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, patos, chanchos y gallinas. Martha solicita el préstamo para realizar unos de sus planes, que es incrementar la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas y cuyes. Ella tiene la obligación de pagar sus aportes puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo si desea acceder a otro crédito. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con los 300 nuevos soles, comprará gallinas blancas y cuyes y así aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Martha, 38, was born in Urco, a small town in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.  She's a friendly, hard-working woman.  She and her partner live in a house that they own with their three children who she works hard to provide for.

The green countryside around Huaran, where Martha lives now, is in the Valle Sagrado de los Incas.  The area is an important place for Martha and a happy one, too, because she's been able to do the work that she enjoys there.  She grew up on a farm and learned farming from her parents.  Now she has her own farm where she and her partner work together growing crops such as potatoes, maize and various vegetables.  She also raises and sells small animals: guineau pigs, turkeys, pigs and chickens.  Martha is applying for a loan to expand her animal sales business.  She especially wants to buy more guinea pigs and chickens that she will raise and sell.  She is committed to repaying the loan on time and understands that paying it is a requirement for getting future loans.  She is grateful to the bank for extending the loan.  She will use the 300 new soles to buy chickens and guineau pigs for her animal sales business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guineau pigs for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es:
Rufino, es soltero, vive junto a sus padres y una sobrina, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, a parte de este oficio es empleado de un comercial reconocido de motocicletas,  normalmente para la época de invierno cultiva siempre.
Hoy día se encuentra iniciando el proceso de cultivo, por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra abono y fertilizantes,  esta compra le ayudara para tener todos los materiales necesarios e iniciar el cultivo.
Su objetivo es crecer en los cultivos, para ayudar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Rufino is single and lives with his parents and a niece. He works growing corn and beans, but he is also employed by a renowned motorcycle company. Normally, he always farms during the winter months.

He is now beginning the farming process, which is why he is requesting a loan to buy manure and fertilizers. This purchase will help him to have all the necessary materials and to begin farming.

His goal is for his farming business to grow so that he can help his parents with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Asilkan's Group

texts.en:
Asilkan, 46, is the leader of this group. She is a widow with three kids and resides in the small coal mining town of Tashkomur. Her son is in the army while her daughters go to school and help Asilkan with running her business. She has been involved in livestock breeding and the selling of dried fruits for twenty years. She has been running these two businesses successfully, generating a monthly income of about $140. The purpose of the loan is the purchase of more livestock for further fattening and reselling. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock

loans.name: Adja Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 03 juin 2011. Il est  constitué de dix femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Safiétou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de huit enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge cinq autres enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de denrée alimentaire et du savon. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on 3 June 2011. It comprises ten women who live in the same area. Their main activity consists of running small businesses.

Ms. Safiétou, with the raised hand on the right in the photo, is the group leader. She is 53 years old. She is married and has eight children. She also has five additional children in her care, all of whom where entrusted to her by their parents.

She is active in selling foodstuffs and soap. She has gained solid experience in this field, having been involved in it for several years.

This loan will allow her to strengthen her capital and better develop her business.

The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (health, nutrition, clothing, etc.) and increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and soap.

loans.name: Lynn

texts.en:
Lynn  is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child.  Lynn  has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, breads and rice per kilogram. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.
Lynn  has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Lynn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
This is Michael, 35, resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. He manages his own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Michael operates a "tricycle" transportation business. He owns one "tricycle" (a motorcycle with sidecar attached to it) that carries up to four to five passengers to their destination within the community. Michael is the one who drives his tricycle. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 300 every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan for additional spare parts and the maintenance of his tricycle. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Michael hopes to be able to expand soon and to sustain his daily needs. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of his "tricycle".

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years. A 34-year-old mother of four school-going children, she is married to James.

Lucy was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be her fourth loan. She paid all previous loans well and in good time. Lucy plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow to boost her farming income, and in the future hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 66 year-old mixed crop farmer.  He is widowed, with two adult children, ages forty and thirty six years.  He has been farming for the past year, with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to provide for his basic needs.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully.  Patrick will use the loan to buy seedlings and manure for his farm.  With the anticipated profit from the business he will buy a dairy cow.  His hopes are to open a butchery shop and stop farming.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and manure for his farm.

loans.name: Manuel Salvador

texts.es:
En  la cuidad de Managua le señor Manuel salvador se dedica arduamente a laborar como conductor en una empresa de esta ciudad  dedicándose  a esta labor desde hace 20  años .es casado  tiene una familia a la que le brinda todo su amor y su compresión, pero el en estos momentos esta pasando por una situación muy difícil, lo que lo llevo a que visitara nuestras oficinas,
Ya que necesita el crédito para la preparación de la graduación de su hijo.
Los gastos que el señor va a hacer se deben a las gestiones de diploma y gastos de promoción de bachillerato  de uno de sus hijos.
Agradece a ceprodel por haberle otorgado el crédito para hacer así posible la preparación de lo antes mencionado.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Manuel Salvador works hard as a driver with a local company. He has been doing this work for 20 years. He is married, with a family, to which he provides all his love and understanding.  However, he is now in a very difficult situation, and this brought him to our office.

He needs a loan to prepare for his son's graduation from high school.  The expenditures that he is going to make are due to procedures for the diploma, and for expenses related to the graduation ceremony. 

He is thankful to Ceprodel for having granted him the loan, which is making possible the above-mentioned preparation.

loans.use: Expenses related to their son's graduation from high school.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is 34 years old, married and blessed with two children.  She rears pigs so as to earn a living for her family.  She has been farming for three years.  She also owns a grocery shop which earns her extra income.  She is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because she was able to start up the grocery shop.  In return, she made enough savings from her business and bought pigs. 

Jenifer hopes to expand her farm in the future.  She has requested 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy pigs.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s fruit and vegetable shop. He has been operating his shop for the past four years and provides fresh, quality products to his clients at reasonable rates. 

With the loan, he will buy fresh, seasonal fruits and vegetables in bulk to put in his shop for selling. 

Bashiraan herself is a housewife and does her household responsibilities. She also supports her husband by cleaning the fruits and vegetables with water every day before her husband takes them to his shop for selling. 

She also knows the art of sewing and works as a seamstress on a part-time basis. She is the mother of three children; all of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.
 
She is very hopeful that after the loan investment, her husband will be able to expand his business and earn better profits that will help her children continue their education and also enhance the living standards of her family. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and has never missed any meetings.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Bashiraan.

loans.use: To buy fresh, seasonal fruits and vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is a 47-year-old, still single man who owns a sari-sari (variety) store business. He sells canned goods, instant noodles and breads. He has been doing this business for five years and slowly expanding it through his patience and perseverance. He hopes to continue this operation so that he can help his parents.

Fernando was a high school graduate, but has the ability to operate his own business. In fact, his business is doing well. However, he is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy groceries for his store, such as candies, soft drinks, biscuits, and catsup, and to buy equipment to expand his business, such as hollow blocks and cement. He hopes that he can earn more than his usual income, for the betterment of his own life as well as his parents'. He hopes that Alalay sa Kaunlaran Inc. will always be generous enough to help them.

loans.use: to buy products for his store such as candies, soft drinks, biscuits, and catsup and to buy equipment for expanding his business, such as hollow blocks and cement.

loans.name: Jorge Alejandro

texts.es:
El Joven Jorge tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su madre en la ciudad de Carapeguá. El empezó a trabajar con su padre en la producción y ventas de productos hortícolas, actualmente con la ayuda de su padre ya tiene montado una pequeña gomería en el centro mismo de la ciudad y ya cuenta con muy buena clientela.
Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo ahora está ampliando su gomería y así logra atraer a más clientes y a mantener a los que ya tiene. Dentro de sus objetivos está seguir creciendo económicamente y comercialmente. El se define como un joven muy trabajador, luchador y emprendedor.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de una compresora de aire, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda en su taller.
texts.en:
Jorge, 23, is a single young man living with his mother in the city of Carapeguá.  He started out working with his father producing and selling horticultural products.  Currently, with help from his father he has set up a small tire repair shop downtown and he already has a very good clientele.

Thanks to his work and effort he’s expanding the tire shop to attract more customers and keep his present ones.  Within his objectives is to continue growing economically and commercially.  He defines himself as a hardworking, tenacious and enterprising young man.

He requests the loan to buy an air compressor which will be of much help in his shop.

loans.use: to buy an air compressor.

loans.name: Blessed Group

texts.en:
Jeshua is a 41-year-old man who is married with two children, ages 17 and 10. Both children are going to school. His wife works at a hospital as a nurse. He also takes care of his mother who is in a rural area.

Jeshua sells cosmetics at the flea market, which is in town. He purchases his goods from South Africa. He has been in this business for four years now. He has two employees at the flea market. He faces a challenge of debtors not paying him back in time. It also takes a long time to travel to and from South Africa to purchase goods.

He has applied for a loan to buy cosmetics for sale. In the next five years, he sees himself owning a beauty therapy shop with qualified staff. With the profit from the business, he will be able to take his children to a better school as well as buy another housing stand to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es:
Isaías, de 36 años de edad, soltero, vive en un barrio de Taulabe, Comayagua.
Hace dos años que estableció una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios de primera necesidad, como ser: arroz, frijoles, pan, azúcar, manteca, harina, pastas, churros, dulces etc. El vive con su madre  quien le apoya mucho para vender. Se motivó a establecer este negocio debido a que en el barrio donde vive no hay otro negocio de estos y así la gente se evita de caminar hasta el otro barrio para comprar.
Ha solicitado este préstamo para surtir de más productos, en compra de arroz, frijoles, manteca, azúcar, sal, harina, etc. De las ganancias tiene el plan de mejorar el local del negocio.
texts.en:
Isaías, 36, is single.  He lives in the Taulabe neighborhood, Comayagua.  He opened a grocery store two years ago where he sells basic staple items like rice, beans, bread, sugar, lard, flour, pastas, snacks, candy, etc.

He lives with his mother who helps him a lot with the sales.  He was motivated to start this business because there is no other like it in his neighborhood and people can avoid having to go to a different neighborhood to buy.

He requests this loan to buy more stock merchandise.  He will buy rice, beans, lard, sugar, salt, flour, etc.  He plans to use profits to make improvements to the store.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has 3 children.

Mary Joy has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Mary Joy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mary Joy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Levis

texts.es: Levis de 47 años con su credikiva anterior compró sillas, arregló su local y surtió su negocio con nuevos víveres. El está satisfecho y ahora está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, pues adicionará nuevas sillas, refrescos y víveres para continuar aplicando un capital de préstamos que le ayude a aumentar su capital de trabajo. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Muchas gracias, es la primera vez que he tenido crédito con una entidad y me ha ido muy bien espero sigan apoyándome. “
texts.en: Levis is 47 and with a prior loan was able to improve his shop, buy chairs and stock merchandise.  He is pleased with the result and now seeks credit to buy additional chairs, soft drinks, merchandise and other items to grow his working capital. His message to Kiva lenders is the following: “Many thanks!  This is the first time I have had access to credit and I have used it well.  Please continue to support businesses such as mine. “

loans.use: to buy plastic tables and chairs, juices, cookies, beverages, and diapers in wholesale quantities.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 33-year-old single woman with one child, who is in school. She has had a business of selling food in Yambio, South Sudan for one year.

Martha is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and cooking oil. She will use her extra income as a result of this loan to pay the school fees for her child.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Bibiye

texts.en:
Bibiye is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a single businesswoman who has sold clothes, shoes and handbags for the past year. She started her business with her own savings. Clients delinquent in their payments is a challenge for her.

Bibiye is applying for a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase more handbags and shoes to sell. She will save all additional income coming from the loan.

Bibiye’s ambition is to own a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase more handbags and shoes to sell.
